excerpts: Seriously, stick with the original vanilla cream puffs.
They're the best.
Although they're best right away, I've eaten them a day later and the hard baked exterior actually keeps its crunch.
I'll admit, I've eaten a whole half dozen by myself over 2 days...and I probably got diabetes doing it,
original vanilla.author: Sam L.
original vanilla.review:
Every time I take a bite of the choux cream filled pastry puffs I go into sweet heaven! The regular vanilla bean cream puffs remind me of my childhood when my mom used to bring home a box filled with these wonderful golden crispy balls. Each bite I take make me go into orgasmic heaven. I hope my wife doesn't read this because she might just get a bit jealous of these cream puffs for a share of my love.

Seriously, stick with the original vanilla cream puffs. They're the best. Although they're best right away, I've eaten them a day later and the hard baked exterior actually keeps its crunch. I'll admit, I've eaten a whole half dozen by myself over 2 days...and I probably got diabetes doing it, but hey, it's worth it.

Get some!

excerpts: I tried the Original Vanilla one.
When you want to try a place, always get their first and the most basic one.
original vanilla.author: Riza T.
original vanilla.review:
Large-sized cream puff. I tried the Original Vanilla one. When you want to try a place, always get their first and the most basic one. So I stuck to the Vanilla one.

I'd say it was a good fix on my sweet tooth craving. It only took me 10 seconds (maybe 12 to 13 seconds) to finish one.. then there was none. hmm not enough? maybe, but at almost at less than $3.00 a piece.. I am not sure i'd want more.

Parking in this establishment/area is not conducive to as to any place in SF. hehe but I was staying at the Hotel Palomar (one block away).

If I were visiting the area, sure I'd get one.. or two.. But to make a trip out here just to get it? Maybe not.

They add a flavor of the month which I believe is one of the other flavors listed on their site.
My favs are the Original Vanilla and Eclair.
I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.
I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.
The Chocolate needed more chocolate flavor and the Coffee needed more coffee flavor.
I like my chocolate and coffee flavors strong
so these were both a little too light for me.
Other than that, this is definitely a great place to go if you're craving a cream puff!
original vanilla.author: Elena N.
original vanilla.review: I don't think you can tell by the website, but they only have Original Vanilla and Chocolate on a day to day basis.  They add a flavor of the month which I believe is one of the other flavors listed on their site.  My favs are the Original Vanilla and Eclair.  I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.  The Chocolate needed more chocolate flavor and the Coffee needed more coffee flavor.  I like my chocolate and coffee flavors strong so these were both a little too light for me.  Other than that, this is definitely a great place to go if you're craving a cream puff!

excerpts: My hubby and I each got an original vanilla bean cream puff and our bill was $4.50.
original vanilla.author: Audra M.
original vanilla.review:
YUMMY!!! The pastry is delicious, the cream is creamy and sweet and just so heavenly. My hubby and I each got an original vanilla bean cream puff and our bill was $4.50. They were a good size!

I would definitely go back!

excerpts: Stick to the original vanilla cream puff..
original vanilla.author: Sunny C.
original vanilla.review: So delicious! My fav is the eclair with vanilla. Stick to the original vanilla cream puff.. The strawberry and Choco cream were just ok :)! Must eat within the first 24 hours so only buy what u can eat!

excerpts: but since it was not the weekly special, I went for the original vanilla custard.
I was debating to myself whether or not I should just get one or buy 6 and take them home.
And then, the little voice in my head told me that if i bought the 6, i probably would've just eaten it all by myself and would've regretted it for the day.
More like I would've had to force myself on the treadmill for 2 hours to burn all those unwanted calories off.
original vanilla.author: Pippi L.
original vanilla.review:
After hearing about this place so much, I decided to go ahead and give it a try. Luckily, when I got there, there was no line. I wanted to try the milk tea flavor but since it was not the weekly special, I went for the original vanilla custard. I was debating to myself whether or not I should just get one or buy 6 and take them home. And then, the little voice in my head told me that if i bought the 6, i probably would've just eaten it all by myself and would've regretted it for the day. More like I would've had to force myself on the treadmill for 2 hours to burn all those unwanted calories off. So I just got one.

I have to say, it wasn't anything special. It was good and the pastry was crunchy and it was airy and gooey inside. It took me less than 2 minutes to eat the whole thing. It's like the krispy kreme of cream puffs. Small and not so filling, but good enough to have more. But I'd rather have a more filling cream puff so I wouldn't want to eat any more. I sat out in front and then as I was about to leave a line started forming. I'm glad I got there when I did.  Of course, since it was a windy day I had to take a look in the mirror to make sure I didn't have any gooey gunk on my face. 
The guy that helped me told me that they were going to have the green tea flavor next week.  So FYI to anyone that's reading this review right now! (8/23/06)

excerpts: The only thing i recommend here is the original vanilla bean crem puff.
Doesnt sound too crazy but its really good.
These things are a lil pricy but once in a while, i'll go during my lunch break to pick up half a dozen for home.
original vanilla.author: Mike B.
original vanilla.review: Mmmmmm, this place is good. The only thing i recommend here is the original vanilla bean crem puff. Doesnt sound too crazy but its really good. These things are a lil pricy but once in a while, i'll go during my lunch break to pick up half a dozen for home. I've tried several other flavors like green tea, milk tea, and chocolate...but i still think vanilla is the best. Its like Krispy Kreme, i only like the original glazed.

excerpts: i do wholeheartedly recommend the original vanilla flavor, as well as the pumpkin flavor and the strawberry.
original vanilla.author: Clara K.
original vanilla.review:
i first tried beard papa cream puffs in nyc a few years ago, and was ecstatic when they opened a store at this location on yerba buena lane in san francisco. after a few visits, my elation slipped half a notch, but not because the cream puffs aren't excellent -- they're still quite tasty with the crisp outer shell that they fill with creamy custard when you order -- but because i think i've just kinda outgrown them or maybe realized that only occasional indulgence is a good thing and getting sick of beard papa's CAN happen. :P or maybe because i tried the chocolate one and it wasn't that good, weakly flavored and a bit grainy. i do wholeheartedly recommend the original vanilla flavor, as well as the pumpkin flavor and the strawberry. the green tea is good if you're a green tea fan, and caramel tastes like vanilla with a hint of caramel (which is good but not that caramelly). i also recently tried the royal milk tea flavor and it was okay, but not one of the better flavors. come to think of it, i guess i've tried pretty much all their flavors! the only thing is that they have vanilla and chocolate every day, but the rest of the flavors rotate on a weekly basis so they might not have the flavor you want the day you go.

i've also tried the cheesecake stick which wasn't very good. they also have an eclair (chocolate glazed version of the cream puff) and some kind of molten chocolate lava cake that i haven't yet tried.

i didn't know i had so much to say about beard papa's. the sad thing is that i could go on, but i won't. :P

excerpts: I'll buy more if I'm visiting family because they're absolute die hard fans of the original vanilla Beard Papa's cream puffs.
original vanilla.author: Jessica L.
original vanilla.review:
These are really great cream puffs, but they're not as amazing as I thought they would be. But, talk about great marketing... and that custard aroma that wafts out of the cafe... enticing!
I used to eat Beard Papa's often when I was working in Asia (they're a lot cheaper there) and was thankfully a luxury I could afford but now that they've been translated into American dollars with the American price sting, I've reduced my love for Beard Papa's by a star (tear). But, when I'm in the city I 80% of the time make a stop here for two reasons: one, the menu has expanded and they have a "special" daily flavor, my favorite so far being pumpkin; two, it just smells soooo good and I always feel like I should be rewarded for my small life efforts so I'll dish out for one or two pastries. I'll buy more if I'm visiting family because they're absolute die hard fans of the original vanilla Beard Papa's cream puffs. Beyond the cream puffs and the eclairs (which are actually just the cream puffs dipped in chocolate) I haven't tried their other new offerings, but am planning on going back sometime to try cheesecake and fondant au chocolat. I hear they have mochi ice cream, but haven't seen/heard anything about them yet.
I have to say the 2 greatest selling point of Beard Papa's is that they use custard instead of cream, and it is definitely fresh. If you're willing to spend extra for sweets, Beard Papa would be your thing.

excerpts: LOVE the original vanilla bean and strawberry.
original vanilla.author: Lily L.
original vanilla.review: When they first opened, the puffs were gigantic, filled with lots of creme. After the opening in the Westfield center, they seem to have downsized in their puffs and the cream filling. LOVE the original vanilla bean and strawberry. Great tea is not bad, have not tried the other flavors besides chocolate (which is not my favorite). Tastes and looks fresh, and reasonably priced, except when you're craving for more and only have money for one! Wish they had this in BERKELEY!

excerpts: The thin layer of chocolate was a nice twist to their original.
chocolate.author: Keizzel C.
chocolate.review:
Delicious and HUGE cream puffs in the city. I opted for the eclair with vanilla ice cream filling. The ice cream filling is an additional $.75  and vanilla seems to be the only ice cream option. The cream puff was nice and flaky but was sturdy enough to hold the ice cream. The thin layer of chocolate was a nice twist to their original.

This location is right near the Metreon & Westfield so it's pretty central. The location is fairly small so service can get slow during peak hours.

excerpts: I had the vanilla filling with chocolate icing.
The puff was fresh and crispy, and the vanilla filling was nice and cold.
This is a perfect dessert.
chocolate.author: Ha D.
chocolate.review: You choose your filling for your puff and the topping. I had the vanilla filling with chocolate icing. The puff was fresh and crispy, and the vanilla filling was nice and cold. This is a perfect dessert.

excerpts: My fave combo is a chocolate dipped puff with matcha filling.
chocolate.author: Vicky L.
chocolate.review:
My go-to place for when I need a sweet fix in the area. A crispy pastry shell filled with custard cream? Oh hell yes. Choose the puff that you want--plain or dipped in chocolate(eclair) and filling flavor. Matcha and vanilla bean are the best flavaflavs. Not to sweet, cool and flavorful. My fave combo is a chocolate dipped puff with matcha filling. Bomb AF!

I've tried their Paris Brest (donut shaped pastry w/choice of filling), their Tiramisu pastry stick and they were just as tasty AF. The 'fondant' cakes on the other hand are a pass. I tried the green tea one and it tasted like an uncooked cake with runny matcha filling inside. Not a fan...

Overall, beard papa knows what's up in the cream puff dept. They're a little bit pricey ($3+ for 1?) but I say it's worth it...for SF lol. Service is whatever tho (don't expect exceptional service); tell them what you want, pay and wait off to the side for the goods. I'll keep coming back!

excerpts: The green tea (plus white chocolate) shell on top didn't particularly add any green tea flavor.
The filling was surprisingly somewhat strong on the green tea flavor.
Compared to last week's adventures in transplanted Asian dessert-land, this was certainly a larger dessert and lasted more bites.
Cream was not too sweet and definitely light.
In terms of would I come back though?
Hard to see myself doing that anytime soon, when a box of those Costco mini cream puffs (omg I love those things) would suffice.
chocolate.author: Nicole H.
chocolate.review:
"Do you want to go to Bearded Papa?" asked the bf. "It's Beard Papa," said I. "Beard Papa" is grammatically incorrect," said he. "It's an Asian transplant," said I. We then proceeded to go over this conversation with the newly opened Bake Cheese Tart (yup, it's not Baked Cheese Tart), but I digress....

In my mind's eye, Beard Papa's has always been an upscale sort of treat. Maybe it's specific to this particular store, but I left feeling like the spot had been knocked down a rung. The paint on the counters and walls was chipped in a number of places, the trash bins were overflowing, and the tables and chairs looked quite worn and cheap (not to mention dirty). We got a matcha cream puff (although they're marketed as eclairs now) with matcha filling. 

Perhaps it's because the shell wasn't fresh out of the oven, but it was very...normal. The green tea (plus white chocolate) shell on top didn't particularly add any green tea flavor. The filling was surprisingly somewhat strong on the green tea flavor. Compared to last week's adventures in transplanted Asian dessert-land, this was certainly a larger dessert and lasted more bites. Cream was not too sweet and definitely light. In terms of would I come back though? Hard to see myself doing that anytime soon, when a box of those Costco mini cream puffs (omg I love those things) would suffice.

excerpts: We ordered one Chocolate and Matcha with Matcha filling for both, and overall it was okay.
The Matcha filling was tasty, but the puff itself wasn't fresh.
My boyfriend enjoyed the Chocolate with the Matcha filling, but for me it was too sweet.
chocolate.author: Julia L.
chocolate.review:
Eh... 

I have been craving Beard Papa's recently and I was looking forward to getting their cream puffs, but sadly it wasn't as good as I remembered them.

The boyfriend and I was able to make it 10 minutes before closing. The staff was nice about it in the sense that they didn't seem to be annoyed with us.

We ordered one Chocolate and Matcha with Matcha filling for both, and overall it was okay. The Matcha filling was tasty, but the puff itself wasn't fresh. However, that is understandable since it was almost closing time.

My boyfriend enjoyed the Chocolate with the Matcha filling, but for me it was too sweet. I definitely preferred the double Matcha, but both cream puffs in general were mediocre and not worth the $7 bucks.

Overall, my Beard Papa's craving was not satisfied. I guess I had higher expectations for the cream puffs, especially since so many photos have been floating around on IG recently. But don't get me wrong, I'm not writing them off! I am interested in returning at some point in the future and giving their other pastries a try!

chocolate.author: Janice K.
chocolate.review:
Double Matcha, Chocolate and Vanilla, Double Chocolate, Butter Honey Vanilla, Butter Honey Matcha, or Butter Honey Chocolate. So many options in puff and filling! 

Here's the breakdown of this cream puff goodness: 

Puff choices: 
1) Original
2) Chocolate glazed
3) Honey butter glazed
4) Matcha glazed

Cream filling: 
1) Vanilla
2) Chocolate
3) Matcha

You can fill your cream heart with whatever combination of the above! 
They also have some other Japanese crafted pastries such as Japanese cheesecake to choose from. 

I purchased a box of 9 the day before Thanksgiving to bring over to a party (knowing that everything would be closed on Thanksgiving day) and kept it in the fridge overnight. Although the exterior of the puff wasn't freshly crisp the next day, it wasn't wasn't soggy either! A day in the fridge and the puffs retained their shape, flavor and almost entirety of its texture. 

I was told the Beard Papas in the USA are made in a peanut free factory and this is different than the Beard Papas in Asia where this isn't the case. Don't quote me on that, but if true, this is exciting for my peanut allergy yelpers!

Eat here!

excerpts: The cream puff itself didn't taste as fresh as I had imagined it to be, but the matcha chocolate shell layer definitely added something new to the Beard Papa's cream puff I get in Vancouver.
Overall, a quick and tasty dessert to grab on the go, but I wouldn't expect anything extraordinary.
chocolate.author: Charmaine L.
chocolate.review: I ordered the matcha creampuff with the regular vanilla filling. The cream puff itself didn't taste as fresh as I had imagined it to be, but the matcha chocolate shell layer definitely added something new to the Beard Papa's cream puff I get in Vancouver. Overall, a quick and tasty dessert to grab on the go, but I wouldn't expect anything extraordinary.

excerpts: My bf got the Chocolate (eclair) puff with caramel inside.
I got my sister a Matcha (eclair) puff with vanilla ice cream filling (extra $.75 for ice cream filling).
We all agreed that it only tasted alright - not flavorful.
Honestly there wasn't much flavor to the fillings at all.
They also didn't really fill the puffs up so half of it was empty.
I remember last time we were here the fillings were oozing out of the puffs.
My sister said she couldn't taste the matcha on the outside of the puffs.
All this for $11.25.
Pretty pricy tbh.
We were pretty disappointed and probably wouldn't come back.
chocolate.author: Trang T.
chocolate.review: My bf and I have tried Beard Papa's about 4 times in total. First time at this location, one time in Milpitas, one time in Vietnam, and today. We came here because we were hanging out in SF and we're craving the cream filled yummyness that we remembered from summer '16. I remember back then they had other filling flavors like cookies and cream but this time they have matcha instead. I was excited to try the matcha filling. So I got the Honey and Butter puff with matcha inside. My bf got the Chocolate (eclair) puff with caramel inside. I got my sister a Matcha (eclair) puff with vanilla ice cream filling (extra $.75 for ice cream filling). We all agreed that it only tasted alright - not flavorful. Honestly there wasn't much flavor to the fillings at all. They also didn't really fill the puffs up so half of it was empty. I remember last time we were here the fillings were oozing out of the puffs. My sister said she couldn't taste the matcha on the outside of the puffs. All this for $11.25. Pretty pricy tbh. We were pretty disappointed and probably wouldn't come back.

excerpts: You can typically order from a few different flavors of pastry, and then you also get to choose the cream on the inside from the typical flavors (chocolate, vanilla) and the flavor of the month (March was cookies and cream, a grey speckled goo).
chocolate.author: John B.
chocolate.review:
Recommendation: Great niche dessert place. Menu layout was a little confusing. Maybe a little on the pricey side for what you are getting. 

Beard Papa is a little shop right outside the Metreon building that specializes in creme-filled pastries. Mostly known for their cream puffs, they also serve eclairs and different, crunchy varieties. You can typically order from a few different flavors of pastry, and then you also get to choose the cream on the inside from the typical flavors (chocolate, vanilla) and the flavor of the month (March was cookies and cream, a grey speckled goo). 

The pastries themselves are quite good, but considering they are $3 a piece or so it's not the most cost-efficient way to gain a sugar rush. That being said, the creme is delicious as always and the pastries are filled on the spot, so they are always a perfect texture. 

There are only a couple tables inside and outside so if there isn't much space, I'd suggest going across Mission Street to the Yerba Buena Garden area or into the Metreon building to sit around in the expansive first floor seating area. 

All in all, I'd say it is worth it to try Beard Papa's at least once, and maybe bring friends here to marvel in the wonder of instant cream puffs!

excerpts: We also got a chocolate fondant as well.
They were all amazing.
chocolate.author: Sonia A.
chocolate.review:
I love this place for it's cream puffs! Best cream puffs I have ever had! This last time I went I got the eclair puff and my friend got a cream filled with green tea. We also got a chocolate fondant as well. They were all amazing. 
Next time I come, I am going to get the eclair puff with green tea filling. Must try!

excerpts: They only had the vanilla and chocolate fillings available; and as for the glazed puff itself: only strawberry, green tea, chocolate and vanilla were available.
chocolate.author: Lauren K.
chocolate.review:
I definitely looked like a bearded papa after eating three of these cream puffs...that wasn't necessarily the goal, but I was feeling ravenous and when that hunger hits, I just dig right into my food, mindless of the mess I will make.  I had actually bought these cream puffs and brought them back to my hotel so as to enjoy breakfast in bed...I thought it'd be all luxurious, but I ended up just making a big flaky, creamy mess for the hotel maids to clean up later.

These cream puffs are delicate little things - the cream will ooze out the minute you bite into it so be prepared to lick all the cream off before it falls to the floor.  Let's play a little game of, 'Don't drop the cream!'.  These things are not only delicate, but also fairly small.  They aren't so small in that it's not worth buying them; I would actually say that for their size, they are filled with cream!  What's great about this place is that you can actually choose which filling you want.  I had come on a day where there was a bunch of construction outside and I guess they were preparing to close down temporarily because of it so there were limited flavors available.  They only had the vanilla and chocolate fillings available; and as for the glazed puff itself: only strawberry, green tea, chocolate and vanilla were available.  I was so looking forward to trying all these other flavors, but that wasn't in the cards for me that day.

There was a selection of cream puffs already to go, but then you had the option of picking and choosing your puff and your cream.  For each cream puff, either created by yourself or pre-prepared, it was about $3-4, so I ended up walking away having spent about $12 on cream puffs.  I didn't blink too much of an eye at this because I do love cream puffs...in fact, these cream puffs made for a breakfast of champions.  They didn't hold me over for long and their sugary base probably wasn't good for my diet, but they tasted pretty good in the moment.

excerpts:
They are so good & yum  

My personal favorite is the chocolate filling!!
chocolate.author: Deebs M.
chocolate.review:
Love love their cream puffs!! 
They are so good & yum  

My personal favorite is the chocolate filling!!

excerpts: I got almond, green tea, chocolate, and creme brulée.
They were all for myself lol.
They fill the puffs for you on the spot, according to your cream flavor selection (vanilla, caramel, green tea).
They also do ice cream filling for an extra charge.
Don't go right before closing, they won't let you in.
chocolate.author: Liz H.
chocolate.review: Service is poor but the cream puffs are so good you deal with it. I got almond, green tea, chocolate, and creme brulée. They were all for myself lol. They fill the puffs for you on the spot, according to your cream flavor selection (vanilla, caramel, green tea). They also do ice cream filling for an extra charge. Don't go right before closing, they won't let you in.

excerpts: This location had the original, crunch  and the chocolate cream puff.
You then choose a filling and have the option to choose between vanilla, caramel and chocolate.
These are enormous cream puffs and not the baby ones you see at Costco.
chocolate.author: Tammie W.
chocolate.review:
This place was recommended by a friend who said we should get 6 to share.  Uh...these are big ass cream puffs and one per person is sufficient!

This location had the original, crunch  and the chocolate cream puff.  You then choose a filling and have the option to choose between vanilla, caramel and chocolate.  These are enormous cream puffs and not the baby ones you see at Costco.  They run between $2.70-$3.50 per cream puff but are a delightful treat   

I had the crunch filled with vanilla and the hubby got the original filled with vanilla and a cheesecake stick on the side.  The cream puffs are soft enough and filled with a delicious cream with flecks of vanilla bean.   Try it next time you're in the area.

excerpts: I ordered at the counter, mixing and matching fillings and glazes (vanilla, chocolate, and the flavor of the month: freen tea), and they were ready to go after just a few minutes.
chocolate.author: Rosa Y.
chocolate.review:
Prompt friendly service. Dropped in on a Saturday afternoon before brunch to pick up some cream puffs and these did not disappoint!

I ordered at the counter, mixing and matching fillings and glazes (vanilla, chocolate, and the flavor of the month: freen tea), and they were ready to go after just a few minutes. 

The store was empty so I actually initially thought it was closed. Its location can be easy to miss if you're not looking for it. Definitely a grab and go type of place.

excerpts: The cream puffs are the size of your fist they come with chocolate or vanilla filling.
Enjoy plain, chocolate, vanilla, green tea toppings.
They have a cup of minis too.
The crust is crunchy despite the fact that it is filled with cream.
I will definitely be coming back.
chocolate.author: Misty W.
chocolate.review:
Holy smokes. This is a little piece of heaven in earth. The cream puffs are the size of your fist they come with chocolate or vanilla filling. Enjoy plain, chocolate, vanilla, green tea toppings. They have a cup of minis too. 
The crust is crunchy despite the fact that it is filled with cream. I will definitely be coming back.

excerpts: Everything I have ever tried from cream puffs, eclairs, cheesecake sticks to chocolate lava cakes are delicious.
Customer service however is non existent.
Me and my coworkers were served by this extremely rude lady who was a BITCH.
She was very unfriendly, didn't want to answer questions, no thank you.
She basically acted like we were a nuisance by making our purchases.
She completely ruined our experience.
I will take my business elsewhere if I see her again.
There's another Beard Papa close by inside Westfield Mall.
chocolate.author: Nerdy P.
chocolate.review: The goodies here are solid 5-star quality. Everything I have ever tried from cream puffs, eclairs, cheesecake sticks to chocolate lava cakes are delicious. Customer service however is non existent. Me and my coworkers were served by this extremely rude lady who was a BITCH. She was very unfriendly, didn't want to answer questions, no thank you. She basically acted like we were a nuisance by making our purchases. She completely ruined our experience. I will take my business elsewhere if I see her again. There's another Beard Papa close by inside Westfield Mall.

excerpts: what I got on the other hand were behemoth cream puffs that are filled right up with either chocolate or vanilla filling right in front of you!
We got regular, chocolate, and eclair puffs, all with vanilla filling.
Made fresh daily, these puffs were quite big, but what I liked was that they were not overly sweet or overpowering.
They were an almost refreshing and filling pastry that are definitely best when freshly filled with cream.
Excellent visit!
chocolate.author: Thuan T.
chocolate.review:
I, for one, have never had fresh cream puffs.. but these ones got me HOOKED.
At first the prices on the puffs seem a bit steep, but that's also partially because I was expecting small pastries... what I got on the other hand were behemoth cream puffs that are filled right up with either chocolate or vanilla filling right in front of you!
We got regular, chocolate, and eclair puffs, all with vanilla filling. Made fresh daily, these puffs were quite big, but what I liked was that they were not overly sweet or overpowering. They were an almost refreshing and filling pastry that are definitely best when freshly filled with cream. Excellent visit!

excerpts: Their daily flavors are vanilla and chocolate, but they have weekly flavors as well.
chocolate.author: Michelle C.
chocolate.review: This is the original location for beard papa's. It is not as busy as the one in Westfield, which is good because we actually have a place to sit down. Their daily flavors are vanilla and chocolate, but they have weekly flavors as well. They are Caramel, coffee, mango, green tea, strawberry, and pumpkin. We always miss it when they have green tea and strawberry, but our to go filling is vanilla. They are crunchy and soft. Just make sure you eat it in the wrapping because eating the cream puff can get messy.

excerpts: The cream puffs are filled cream or other flavors like chocolate, mango, etc.
The dough is crunchy.
Not ultra sweet.
Japan style.
Located by the Catholic Church and the Jewish museum.
chocolate.author: Sandie S.
chocolate.review: Great place to stop for snacking after museum hopping. Small place. Two tables and a bench. The cream puffs are filled cream or other flavors like chocolate, mango, etc. The dough is crunchy. Not ultra sweet. Japan style. Located by the Catholic Church and the Jewish museum. Cost: $3.00-3.50.

excerpts: Fillings were limited so we only tried the original and Belgian chocolate puffs.
I'm normally a chocolate fan, but I thought the original cream tasted better.
chocolate.author: Sue V.
chocolate.review:
Conveniently located across the street from the picturesque Yerba Buena Gardens. If you don't feel like sitting in one of the indoor or outdoor tables, just walk across to the Esplanade to enjoy your pastry.

The puffs were soft even at the end of the day. I noticed they made a fresh batch but neglected to ask for those puffs and had no regrets.

Fillings were limited so we only tried the original and Belgian chocolate puffs. I'm normally a chocolate fan, but I thought the original cream tasted better.

They do accept credit cards.

Would I return? Maybe if I'm in the area, I still want to try the matcha puff.

excerpts: They always have the defaulted chocolate and vanilla flavors though.
chocolate.author: Tiffany Z.
chocolate.review:
Generally don't crave cream puffs but if I do I'd probably pick Beard Papa's... Actually I don't even know any other place that specializes in just cream puffs?

I remember when I was younger I used to love going to BP whenever I made my way into DTSF.. Now fast forward, working in DTSF, it's still pretty much the same for me.

Ordered half a dozen of cream puffs for me and my 4 coworkers.  I ended up eating 2 in 1 sitting, what the hell.  I was trying to have some self control & only eat 1 but damn, might as well eat 2 since it's already staring at me in the face.

HAHA anyways despite being a fatass, BP is really good for a cream puff. The shell is good and the cream texture is smooth and light.  BP keeps things interesting by having daily special flavors depending on when you go.  They always have the defaulted chocolate and vanilla flavors though.  One day I'm gunna stump in when they have green tea and I'll have a very happy soul. 

Oh also, the puffs are made to order! So the puff is not creamed til you order ;)

excerpts: The only difference between the two are that the "eclair" had chocolate on its shell.
chocolate.author: Breanna P.
chocolate.review:
These cream puffs are made fresh daily but still are not up to par. This sounds really rude but honestly I think I've had better at Whole Foods. I hate comparing businesses but I don't mess around when it comes to dessert! 

I admit, I ordered an eclair but let me tell you... It tasted exactly like a cream puff. They are definitely not suppose to taste the same. The cream filling was too fluffy and not dense enough. The only difference between the two are that the "eclair" had chocolate on its shell. 

They are in a great location that is a prime touristy spot. Maybe that's all that's going for them? I did see cheesecake sticks but honestly after a subpar eclair I couldn't bring myself to continue. 

Dessert is my favorite type of indulgence. I don't mess around when it comes to that portion of the menu. I was really disappointed in the turnout. I thought I might have been too harsh so I had two friends also taste it. They reassured me that I'm not a psycho eclair critic and that it was a less than average eating experience.

excerpts: The chocolate was kind of boring
chocolate.author: Emma M.
chocolate.review:
5 stars for the the matcha puff with vanilla filling, it was so delicious. The chocolate was kind of boring and I wouldn't get that again. 

0 stars for the place: Kinda a run down spot. Was kind of grossed out that the girl handling our food was wearing one glove but touching everything with it and handling our food with her ungloved hand especially since if you read their health code violations it says they don't have proper hand washing systems in place. Get it together beard papa employees, don't be gross.

excerpts: I tried the chocolate creamy puff and their April spl - cappuccino and coffee jelly.
This was first time I tasted coffee jelly.
Interesting !
chocolate.author: Tejashree M.
chocolate.review: The creamy puffs tasted great ! It had a thick pastry and nice creamy filling that gave a good balance of taste. It was right amount of sweet. I tried the chocolate creamy puff and their April spl - cappuccino and coffee jelly. This was first time I tasted coffee jelly. Interesting !

excerpts: I ordered a chocolate eclair with vanilla filling but was disappointed.
The eclair had a very hard outer layer.
I would have preferred a cake like texture instead.
Also, it did not seem very fresh and the cream filling was okayish.
chocolate.author: Aanchal G.
chocolate.review: I visited this place on an evening to try out eclairs as a friend of mine raved about them. I ordered a chocolate eclair with vanilla filling but was disappointed. The eclair had a very hard outer layer. I would have preferred a cake like texture instead. Also, it did not seem very fresh and the cream filling was okayish.

excerpts: They are usually offered as the flavor of the day) since I'm not a huge fan of the vanilla or chocolate.
One original cream puff is 2.90, and you can get a chocolate covered one for about 50 cents more if you're feeling extra sweet.
Portion sizes here are decent and just the right amount of filling.
They offer eclairs and vanilla slices here if you want something different, but trying their cream puffs here are a must at least once!
chocolate.author: Kathleen S.
chocolate.review:
Love love LOVE their cream puffs here! I usually go to the Westfield location but happened to walk by this one during my lunch break yesterday. You can find a cheap sweet fix here for less than $5 a portion. I always stick with the original cream puff with some sort of fruity filling (I love their strawberry and mango flavors a lot! They are usually offered as the flavor of the day) since I'm not a huge fan of the vanilla or chocolate. Sometimes they have green tea if you're lucky! If anyone else happens to know other unique flavors, please send them my way!

One original cream puff is 2.90, and you can get a chocolate covered one for about 50 cents more if you're feeling extra sweet. Portion sizes here are decent and just the right amount of filling. They offer eclairs and vanilla slices here if you want something different, but trying their cream puffs here are a must at least once!

excerpts: I got the chocolate with vanilla inside and a black coffee.
chocolate.author: Milee S.
chocolate.review: I've never had Beard Papa's cream puffs before and I didn't want anything heavy since we had an amazing brunch at Kitchen Story.  This hit the spot. I got the chocolate with vanilla inside and a black coffee. Others in our group got the crispy caramel, the green tea and the vanilla/vanilla. It was yummy and huge! Will get it again for sure!

excerpts: The regular fillings are vanilla and chocolate, and there's a special filling on weekly rotation.
chocolate.author: Theresa M.
chocolate.review:
CREAM PUFFS ARE SO GOOD. I've never loved a cream puff until now.

I had my first cream puff from here yesterday, and I've already gone back again today for more. The delicious pastry is stuffed full to bursting of thick gooey cream. It will sploosh on your face, and it'll be amazing. 

They have a standard pastry, and cocoa & cookie variants, which you can stuff with whatever filling you'd like. The regular fillings are vanilla and chocolate, and there's a special filling on weekly rotation. You can't go wrong with any of them.

I also had their tiramisu, but it pales in comparison to the majestic cream puff.

excerpts: I ended up ordering the green tea and chocolate cream puff.
I have to say I was not impressed and was very disappointed.
The pastry was dry and tasteless.
It seemed like it had been sitting out a while after being baked.
The cream filling was close to flavorless with only hints of chocolate and green tea.
I would give this place a 2 star rating, but the staff was very friendly so I give it 3 stars.
The cream filling was close to flavorless with only hints of chocolate and green tea.
I would give this place a 2 star rating, but the staff was very friendly so I give it 3 stars.
chocolate.author: Alyssa W.
chocolate.review: Seeing as this was always a hot spot as I walked by, I had to try it. It smelled delicious when I walked in, that very buttery bakery smell. I ended up ordering the green tea and chocolate cream puff. I have to say I was not impressed and was very disappointed. The pastry was dry and tasteless. It seemed like it had been sitting out a while after being baked. The cream filling was close to flavorless with only hints of chocolate and green tea. I would give this place a 2 star rating, but the staff was very friendly so I give it 3 stars.

excerpts: Tried the chocolate and they just didn't taste as good.
chocolate.author: Tsyria T.
chocolate.review:
I love Beard Papas! I've only tried the cream puffs but they were fantastic! Huge fan of the Vanilla Cream ones. Tried the chocolate and they just didn't taste as good.

Took them home and put them in the freezer for a little bit and the cream inside turned into almost an ice cream like consistency. Yum! Don't leave them in too long though, it isn't the same when the whole thing becomes frozen!

I pretty much came here to say, GO FOR THE VANILLA CREAM.

excerpts: I'd much prefer cake or a cupcake or a (chocolate) croissant or.. more cake?
The chocolate on the outside was smooth and rich, which paired very well with the fragrant cream puff.
I think the added layer of chocolate or another ingredient really makes a difference.
chocolate.author: Maggie X.
chocolate.review:
I have to say.. I'm not really a cream puff kind of gal. I'd much prefer cake or a cupcake or a (chocolate) croissant or.. more cake? But even I can tell when a dessert is freshly made, and I definitely appreciate both that and the fact that the custard cream inside isn't deathly sweet.

Located just a few steps from Bluestem Brasserie, it's a short walk from the crowded Market Street and surprisingly calm. There are a few tables situated inside the store, but more scattered outside. The mechanism is assembly line: choose a kind of cream puff, choose your filling, pay, and enjoy. Service was mediocre but efficient, and the prices are very reasonable. 

Eclair cream puff with green tea custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#9I1eafhGAWlh-JbwgGEh-A)
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling. Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did! The chocolate on the outside was smooth and rich, which paired very well with the fragrant cream puff. The silky green tea custard inside seemed to engulf everything in a sea of matcha, and I was pleasantly surprised at how "right" the green tea tasted. 

Vanilla cream puff with vanilla custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#QIj2Oz-kWXntstYnOTPfvQ)
My friend opted for tradition, and he did enjoy his cream puff as well, although he said that my green tea custard would be his first choice next time. I had a quick bite and thought that while I could still taste the freshness of the cream puff itself, it was a little one-dimensional after enjoying my eclair one. I think the added layer of chocolate or another ingredient really makes a difference. I did like that the vanilla custard was also not overly sweet, so the entire thing wasn't too heavy from start to finish.

If there were an option to have the cream puff heated up just a tad before pumping in the cool custard, I think I'd have trouble stopping myself from converting into a cream puff gal..

excerpts: It wasn't overly sweet or artificial tasting, would probably go great with the plain or chocolate glazed shell.
chocolate.author: Amy X.
chocolate.review: Nom nom, I've only had Beard Papa's before in Vancouver and was very excited to see it in SF!  You pick the cream puff shell and the cream filling separately, and then they will fill the cream puff for you on the spot so it's fresh and not soggy.  This time I got the honey and butter shell with the cherry pie filling (May flavor of the month).  The individual parts tasted amazing, but the two didn't really match as a whole--no fault of theirs, just my bad flavor judgement!  The honey and butter shell is like a normal shell but with some sweet/sticky/caramelized sugar melted over it.  The taste was very reminiscent of a palmier and I bet it would have gone great with the vanilla cream.  The cherry filling was AWESOME.  If you're reading this and it's still May, go and get one now!  It wasn't overly sweet or artificial tasting, would probably go great with the plain or chocolate glazed shell.

excerpts: , you pick your shell (plain, chocolate dipped, strawberry dipped, matcha dipped, or honey butter crusted) and then it is filled in front of you (chocolate, vanilla, or matcha).
We got chocolate dipped with vanilla filling and couldn't get enough.
The cream is luscious and thick and was full of vanilla flavor.
The chocolate dip was the perfect contrast to balance the vanilla cream.
The first day we went, we only got two, but we had to go back and get the half dozen.
Overall, the puffs were a little pricey but worth it for the size.
Wonderful spot for a quick dessert!
chocolate.author: Cupcake S.
chocolate.review: Love, love, love! Delicious giant cream puffs!  In desperate search for a bakery with more than muffins, scones, and cookies, we stumbled upon Beard Papa's. Beard Papa's is a gourmet cream-puffery, you pick your shell (plain, chocolate dipped, strawberry dipped, matcha dipped, or honey butter crusted) and then it is filled in front of you (chocolate, vanilla, or matcha). We got chocolate dipped with vanilla filling and couldn't get enough. The cream is luscious and thick and was full of vanilla flavor. The chocolate dip was the perfect contrast to balance the vanilla cream. The first day we went, we only got two, but we had to go back and get the half dozen. Overall, the puffs were a little pricey but worth it for the size. Wonderful spot for a quick dessert!

excerpts: The filling (I think) is the traditional pastry cream plus whipped cream and a flavoring agent (ie strawberry or chocolate).
This is more of a diplomate cream instead of a thick pastry cream, which is really nice on a warm day.
chocolate.author: William V.
chocolate.review:
It has taken me a while, but these beard papa's have been on my list of things to try since moving to SF 2 years ago. So good! I've had the eclairs with strawberry and with vanilla fillings. Both were excellent. The filling (I think) is the traditional pastry cream plus whipped cream and a flavoring agent (ie strawberry or chocolate). This is more of a diplomate cream instead of a thick pastry cream, which is really nice on a warm day. It tastes almost like an ice cream. 

Will need to check out the matcha green tea flavor next!

excerpts: I really wanted to try the coffee and the pumpkins filling but today they only had vanilla, chocolate and strawberry.
I would have been ok w/o the tiramisu stick (average at best)...
chocolate.author: Alejandro R.
chocolate.review:
Super duper amazing cream puffs. If they had espresso coffee it would have been 5 stars.... That and the fact that they don't take Discover (thumb down)
The freshness can be tasted in every bite. No still cream puffs like in many other places. The eclair with vanilla (traditions) filling was my favorite. I really wanted to try the coffee and the pumpkins filling but today they only had vanilla, chocolate and strawberry. 
I would have been ok w/o the tiramisu stick (average at best)...

excerpts: We stuck to the basics, each getting either a vanilla or chocolate cream puff, or an eclair.
You can pick your filling - so there are lots of combinations of flavors to try.
chocolate.author: Rob N.
chocolate.review:
Our family stopped in here for a mid-afternoon snack after going to an event at the Moscone Center. We stuck to the basics, each getting either a vanilla or chocolate cream puff, or an eclair. You can pick your filling - so there are lots of combinations of flavors to try.  Everything was fresh tasting, and the fillings were very creamy and smooth.

Great place to drop in for an affordable treat.

excerpts: Their standard flavor is vanilla and chocolate but if you are lucky enough to get some seasonal flavors you could get mango, which is my favorite, or green tea.
I've also seen coffee and caramel but neither interests me.
I just wish they offered more flavors like they do on their website.
I would love to try TARO cream!
You also have 3 choices of puffs.
You can get original, cookie crunch, which is my favorite or chocolate.
I always ask no powered sugar because whenever I bite into these guys I end up inhaling the powdered sugar and start to cough like mad, so I always skip it
but you have to tell them in advance because they won't ask you.
chocolate.author: Vinkin Ken T.
chocolate.review: There is no other Bay Area bakery that can make cream puffs like Beard Papa's can! You get a fairly large cream puff with 2 pumps of cream filling. But recently I have been asking if I could get an extra pump and they happily did! How awesome is that? Their standard flavor is vanilla and chocolate but if you are lucky enough to get some seasonal flavors you could get mango, which is my favorite, or green tea. I've also seen coffee and caramel but neither interests me. I just wish they offered more flavors like they do on their website. I would love to try TARO cream! You also have 3 choices of puffs. You can get original, cookie crunch, which is my favorite or chocolate. I always ask no powered sugar because whenever I bite into these guys I end up inhaling the powdered sugar and start to cough like mad, so I always skip it but you have to tell them in advance because they won't ask you.

excerpts:
My hubby got the Cookie Crunch puff with the chocolate cream just to be contrary.

but he said the chocolate cream was "just ok".
chocolate.author: Heather T.
chocolate.review:
I love dessert as does my husband.  And by love, I mean we LURVE it.

We popped into Beard Papa's after lunch for a quick dessert.  I was so excited to try the cream puffs.

The employee recommended the Cookie Crunch puff with the vanilla cream (I got that).  My hubby got the Cookie Crunch puff with the chocolate cream just to be contrary.

I ran to the table, bit into it, and it. was. cold.

The puff was room temperature, but the cream was slightly cold.

It was a strange sensation and quite unexpected. I thought it would be warm and gooey and melt in your mouth delicious.  Instead it was cold.  and gooey.  and crumbly.

The vanilla cream itself was DELICIOUS.  The cookie crunch puff was MEH.  I did not try my hubby's but he said the chocolate cream was "just ok".

"just ok" in our dessert-fiend world means we won't be coming back.  Glad we could experience it while we were visiting San Fran, but would not make the list next time.

excerpts: The chocolate one I had a hard chocolate coating and a chocolate custard oozing out when I bit into it.
Yummmmm....
$3 is a little pricey for one
but it's
a must have in the Bay Area.
They have multiple items/variations on their menu as well as a huge variety of flavors.
This location is right in the financial district adjacent to the Jewish Museum and the Yerba Buena Museum/Garden.
Whether you want to sit down and slowly savor it or grab one on the run to your destination, I must say it's a recommendation for anyone with a sweet tooth!!!
chocolate.author: Vikram V.
chocolate.review: This chain is sooo cool. I wish there was one in Michigan. Cream puffs should be so much more popular than they are now. For those who haven't had one of these glorious snacks, it's a pastry with a custard/ice cream-like filling. The chocolate one I had a hard chocolate coating and a chocolate custard oozing out when I bit into it. Yummmmm.... $3 is a little pricey for one but it's a must have in the Bay Area. They have multiple items/variations on their menu as well as a huge variety of flavors. This location is right in the financial district adjacent to the Jewish Museum and the Yerba Buena Museum/Garden. Whether you want to sit down and slowly savor it or grab one on the run to your destination, I must say it's a recommendation for anyone with a sweet tooth!!!

excerpts: The chocolate fondant is wholly satisfying too.
chocolate.author: Vincent L.
chocolate.review:
Raji R. and Angela L. are right on the mark with their observations of the not-terribly-overwhelming puff / eclair shells.

But the cream itself is darn good and just right. Not bland, but not overpoweringly sweet. And there are several choices at any given time. Green tea? Pleasantly refreshing. Pumpkin? A scrumptious way to celebrate the season. The chocolate fondant is wholly satisfying too.

Overall, a sweet, yummy treat that's worth a quick stop if you're in the area.

excerpts:
I'm a huge fan of both vanilla and chocolate creme filling. 
Haven't tried some of the newer iterations with chocolate shell instead of traditional pastry shell. 

I'd prefer it if the chocolate were softer.
chocolate.author: Scott G.
chocolate.review:
I saw another reviewer list the price as $3.50 per puff, but I thought I paid $5 for 2. In any case, definitely worth the money. I'm a huge fan of both vanilla and chocolate creme filling. Haven't tried some of the newer iterations with chocolate shell instead of traditional pastry shell. 

NOT a big fan of the eclair, as I don't care for the hard crispy shell. I'd prefer it if the chocolate were softer.

I'll continue to hit this place when I'm in town!

excerpts: We got a box of 6 cream puffs (2 vanilla, 2 chocolate, and 2 coffee)
all were delicious.
Don't worry, we didn't eat them at once, we spread it out during the day and shared with my brother!
chocolate.author: Joyce D.
chocolate.review:
I don't what it is about cream puffs, but they are so good!

Maybe it is the texture and the fluffy bread, but these cream puffs are amazing. My cousin and I decided to get a tasty treat after running the NWM 2013. Hey, we burned over 1000 calories. I think a cream puff should be okay! My favorite is the vanilla ones, but they have various flavors, like coffee! They added two new pastries instead of the original pastry. I like the location of this one because it is near the park so you can grab your snack and walk over to the outside seating at the park and people watch. The cheesecake stick was okay and the coffee they serve smelled delicious. We got a box of 6 cream puffs (2 vanilla, 2 chocolate, and 2 coffee) all were delicious. Don't worry, we didn't eat them at once, we spread it out during the day and shared with my brother!

excerpts: I got the regular vanilla and the chocolate because those are my faves.
chocolate.author: Mel L.
chocolate.review:
LOVE these puffs! I ordered some to go and they were great even the next day. But, they are the absolute best right after you pay for it and they hand you that freshly filled puff. Oooh it's so good. I got the regular vanilla and the chocolate because those are my faves. I also tried a cheesecake stick which was pretty good too. 

If you haven't tried them, I highly suggest you get over there quick. This is coming from a girl that doesn't even like cream puffs in the everyday sense. But then again, this ain't your ordinary puff.

excerpts: The chocolate was light, airy with only a hint of cocoa taste so it won't weigh down the overall flavor or texture.
But still a nice chocolate flavor that is a good cocoa not
a cheap
chocolate.author: Bianca U.
chocolate.review:
Eating one right now and I had to post a review!

It's a day old and my boyfriend had them, otherwise I never would've known about them, but GODAMN these are good!!!

The chocolate was light, airy with only a hint of cocoa taste so it won't weigh down the overall flavor or texture. But still a nice chocolate flavor that is a good cocoa not a cheap Hershey's. 

It's simply divine! I might have to sneak another from the box.

excerpts: I bought 6 cream puffs yesterday (chocolate filling and vanilla).
chocolate.author: Annette F.
chocolate.review:
Stopped by this place on Memorial Day.The cream puffs were pretty delicious!  I bought 6 cream puffs yesterday (chocolate filling and vanilla).

I was very disappointed at the two girls working there (filipino and caucasian). I was with my bf standing there waiting to order, and with no one in line, after several minutes of waiting for the girls to say something, I said "hi, can i order now?" The caucasian/foreign girl said "You come order HERE!" and rolled her eyes. Omg, what a rude person! We walked out furious. 

Beard Papa's, you just lost two customers for good! I will now just order else where. Please have a word with these two girls.

excerpts: I had the cookie crunch puff with chocolate filling.
It is a great size & costs under $4 for each puff depending on the type you get.
They have different filling flavors on different days.
Yesterday it was vanilla, chocolate and mango.
chocolate.author: Brenda L.
chocolate.review: I had the cookie crunch puff with chocolate filling. It is a great size & costs under $4 for each puff depending on the type you get. They have different filling flavors on different days. Yesterday it was vanilla, chocolate and mango. I've seen strawberry as a filling flavor before in their other location in Union Square. This location is great because it's in the trendy financial district. I don't recall if there is seating indoors. Eating a cream puff can get messy because there's quite a bit of filling. It will ooze out so I advise eating it inside the paper bag! It's a great option for a snack pre pr post movies since this location is by AMC theater. They boast to have the World's Best cream puff, a claim that I would agree to primarily because I don't know anywhere else that serves/makes primarily cream puffs. This is a chain store that originated in Osaka, Japan. I love their bearded man logo because it is so cute! This makes for a great item to bring to potlucks too as dessert.

excerpts: I really like the eclairs with chocolate filling.
Not too sweet and not too filling.
Every time I visit San Francisco I make sure to pick up at least one (and usually two or three) of these.
chocolate.author: Lori M.
chocolate.review: These are so fun! What a nice treat mid-day. I really like the eclairs with chocolate filling. Not too sweet and not too filling. Every time I visit San Francisco I make sure to pick up at least one (and usually two or three) of these.

excerpts: What I DO love are the chocolate eclairs filled with vanilla.
chocolate.author: Raji R.
chocolate.review:
So the puffs are all fine and dandy. I don't hate them, I don't love them. 

What I DO love are the chocolate eclairs filled with vanilla. 

Though I don't mind one in passing here or there, I wouldn't go out of my way to get these little sugary goodies! Not my thing maybe!

excerpts: Its vanilla and chocolate puffs tasted so perfect after you froze them in the refrigerator for a while.
chocolate.author: Judy F.
chocolate.review:
I am a sweet lover. 
Its vanilla and chocolate puffs tasted so perfect after you froze them in the refrigerator for a while.

excerpts: Like their chocolate Cookie Puff very much.
Not a lot of people.
Will try mocha flavor next time.
chocolate.author: Yunong L.
chocolate.review: Like their chocolate Cookie Puff very much. Not a lot of people. Will try mocha flavor next time.

excerpts: I just came here to try the new mini-croissants, available in 3 flavors: butter (regular), chocolate and cheese (cream cheese).
Sold by 3 for $2.95/$3.45, 1/2 dozen for $5.25/$6.25, or one dozen for $10/$12.
I bought a mix to try every flavor.
The "Petit-cro" looked nice and tasted okay, but the inside is a little dry.
Perhaps better when eaten while sipping on a cup of hot coffee or tea.
The "Fondant au chocolat" are little cupcake size chocolate cakes filled with chocolate that melts after they warm it in a microwave.
Nothing to rave about.
If u still want something similar, go to TJ's instead for a cheaper version in the frozen foods aisle.
chocolate.author: Luis C.
chocolate.review:
It's amusing to me how some bored workers like to talk in another language in front of customers, thinking that nobody can understand what they are saying. She was complaining in Spanish to her 2 co-workers that I was taking too long to order. It wasn't even 5 seconds, Sheez! and I was her only customer at the time too.

Normally bakeries/ pastry shops that sell sweet products, hire cheerful people to match the food they sell. The manager of this branch didn't get that memo. The employees looked unhappy, with a deadpan, monotone voice and blank facial expressions, like if either they were inside a jail or they thought that they're too cool to work in that job, not sure. Definitely a disincentive to buy more stuff.

I just came here to try the new mini-croissants, available in 3 flavors: butter (regular), chocolate and cheese (cream cheese). Sold by 3 for $2.95/$3.45, 1/2 dozen for $5.25/$6.25, or one dozen for $10/$12. I bought a mix to try every flavor. The "Petit-cro" looked nice and tasted okay, but the inside is a little dry. Perhaps better when eaten while sipping on a cup of hot coffee or tea. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/fO4nmPfUwyyzLDRxOIwuVg/l

The "Fondant au chocolat" are little cupcake size chocolate cakes filled with chocolate that melts after they warm it in a microwave. Nothing to rave about. If u still want something similar, go to TJ's instead for a cheaper version in the frozen foods aisle. The "Cheese cake stick" (regular, strawberry and tiramisu) is another disappointing item, it's a small layer of cheesecake sliced into strips. I'd rather have a slice of dense NY-style or Zanze's light cheesecakes instead.

I'm not a fan of the cream puffs at this store (maybe I got poorly made ones, don't know), although I really liked the ones I tried at Beard Papa's in Waikiki, inside the Food Pantry market. Also I don't know why the Cupertino location has lower prices than the SF store.

excerpts: My husband got Chocolate and then there is another flavor they have all the time then
each week they have a "flavor of the week".
Let me tell you some of the flavors sounded SO good
but we were not in the right week LOL
I can't speak for the chocolate flavor because I did not try it.
It was a dark chocolate and I am not a fan of anything
but Milk Chocolate.
chocolate.author: Jenn M.
chocolate.review:
We were in the city for Mother's Day weekend just wanderiing around looking at the buildings and window shopping.  We just wanted a small snack.  We happened across this place on the way back to the parking garage. 

I am sure that everyone has had one of those tiny frozen creme puffs that you can get at Costco or Sams Club.  I think most grocery stores sell them too.  Our family likes to eat them frozen however, that is not how they are supposed to be served.

When you walk into this place they have the "puffs" already made.  They are about the size of the palm of my hand.  (I wear a L/XL glove).  They ask you what flavor of creme you want.  I got vanilla which is the kind that comes in the ones from Costco/Sams.  My husband got Chocolate and then there is another flavor they have all the time then each week they have a "flavor of the week".  Let me tell you some of the flavors sounded SO good but we were not in the right week LOL (looks like we will be going back).

Once you choose your flavor they have a machine that looks like a super large needle and they put the puff on it and pull the handle and it fills the puff.

I expected this to be not so good.  I am not huge on super sugary stuff so I cringed at the first bite.  *musical notes plow through your head as your mouth tastes this savory goodness" is exactly how I explained it to my husband LOL.  He agreed it was really good.

I can't speak for the chocolate flavor because I did not try it.  It was a dark chocolate and I am not a fan of anything but Milk Chocolate.  My husband ate all of it so it couldn't have been that bad.

The Vanilla - - WOW - I expected it to be like a pudding consistancy but it wasn't.  It was a mix between pudding and Cool Whip.  It was not sweet it was just creamy goodness with a hint of vanilla flavor.

If you get a chance to stop in . . . I would highly recommend it.  Next time we go we will be getting more and bringing them home and popping them in the freezer.

excerpts: Favorite flavors include green tea, chocolate, strawberries & cream, dulce de leche and pumpkin.
chocolate.author: Cece E.
chocolate.review:
The puffs went poof and disappeared almost as soon as we got them into our greedy hands. Favorite flavors include green tea, chocolate, strawberries & cream, dulce de leche and pumpkin. The cheesecake sticks are also a delicious treat but compared to the cream puffs, I think are a little small for the price.

Right across the street from the Metreon. We usually stop by before or after a movie. We usually buy a few to eat while sitting on the lawn of Yerba Buena Gardens and enjoy their summer concerts.

excerpts: Walked in today with a friend that was craving some sweets and was greeted by two friendly guys who recommended their new tiramisu with chocolate oozing out.
My friend said it was pretty amazing
but I stuck to my favorite chocolate eclair with chocolate filling.
chocolate.author: Leina K.
chocolate.review: Walked in today with a friend that was craving some sweets and was greeted by two friendly guys who recommended their new tiramisu with chocolate oozing out. My friend said it was pretty amazing but I stuck to my favorite chocolate eclair with chocolate filling. Also try their funky fillings like green tea every once in a while.

excerpts: Beard papa's has a variety of flavored creams such as strawberry, blueberry, chocolate, vanilla, and etc.
chocolate.author: Elaine N.
chocolate.review:
Just perfect. Though, almost perfect. I just found another competitor for beard papa's and it's called Pacific puffs. I can't tell which is better! 

Beard papa's has a variety of flavored creams such as strawberry, blueberry, chocolate, vanilla, and etc. In which makes their cream puffs very unique. 

Price range is I think 3.50 per puff? And is a little bigger than a baseball. 
Try it, you won't regret it... And try Pacific puffs too. *drool *

excerpts: I had the chocolate filled and it was delicious.
chocolate.author: Kara S.
chocolate.review: Get yourself a good, messy cream puff from here, you won't regret it! Just don't make the mistake of trying to eat it politely in public. You'll end up a mess. But it's worth it! I had the chocolate filled and it was delicious.

excerpts: The filling is custardy with a hint of vanilla unless of course, you get the chocolate or green tea variations.
Personally I find the whole tasting experience rather generic.
It's not disgusting, just wholly unmemorable.

There is obviously some master plan to make this chain the next Krispy Kreme, but it seems inherently self-limiting to produce these cream-filled eclairs, disguise them as cream puffs and expect people not to get tired of them at some point.
Papa, can you serve it?
The service is efficient, and the lines are managed to the best of the staff's abilities.
I have only tried the place once, but once was enough.
I prefer my calories in a heartier form.
In fact, I think I'd rather see "Yentl" than have another puff.
Papa, watch me...pass this place by!!!
(...then the orchestra swells... and the end credits roll)
FOOD - 2 stars...
yawn

AMBIANCE - 2 stars...made little impression on me
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...efficient
OVERALL - 2 stars
chocolate.author: Ed U.
chocolate.review:
Papa, can you see it?

Leave it to the Japanese to come up with a unique way to mix their native ingenuity in packaging with some semblance of European old-world charm. In fact, the cream puff has a double-crusted shell --- the hard exterior is European, and the softer inside is Japanese. I imagine the combination makes it easier to package than the standard open-shell choux that real bakeries use. But honestly, it just looks like a molded fritter.

Papa, can you taste it?

The filling is custardy with a hint of vanilla unless of course, you get the chocolate or green tea variations. Personally I find the whole tasting experience rather generic. It's not disgusting, just wholly unmemorable. There is obviously some master plan to make this chain the next Krispy Kreme, but it seems inherently self-limiting to produce these cream-filled eclairs, disguise them as cream puffs and expect people not to get tired of them at some point.

Papa, can you serve it?

The service is efficient, and the lines are managed to the best of the staff's abilities. I have only tried the place once, but once was enough. I prefer my calories in a heartier form. In fact, I think I'd rather see "Yentl" than have another puff.

Papa, watch me...pass this place by!!! (...then the orchestra swells... and the end credits roll)

FOOD - 2 stars...yawn 
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...made little impression on me
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...efficient
OVERALL - 2 stars

excerpts: This Beard Papa is located in a small lane next to a chocolate shop.
There are chairs outside and inside so on a nice day you can sit outside and enjoy the views.
The cream puffs are good here -- in fact, these are close to the ones I'm used to eating in Hawaii.
The puff is crunchy and the filling is abundant.
I think in the Bay Area they are very very generous with the filling.
chocolate.author: Anita L.
chocolate.review:
This Beard Papa is located in a small lane next to a chocolate shop. There are chairs outside and inside so on a nice day you can sit outside and enjoy the views. The cream puffs are good here -- in fact, these are close to the ones I'm used to eating in Hawaii. The puff is crunchy and the filling is abundant. I think in the Bay Area they are very very generous with the filling. I've never had BPs with this much filling before.

The bathroom here has a code so no riff raff can just go in and use it. It's clean and if you make a purchase they'll give you the code to use the bathroom.

excerpts: Both the chocolate and vanilla cream puffs were delicious, and they inject the filling into the cream puff right when you order, which is pretty cool.
I liked the vanilla one a little bit better, but you should try them both yourself :-)
chocolate.author: Nikhil S.
chocolate.review:
Heard a lot about this place, so we finally checked it out last week. The cream puffs are DELICIOUS and hands down the best cream puffs I've ever had in my life. No question about it. It is indeed expensive; the price of $2.50 per cream puff is pretty high... but I think it's worth it to come once in a while.

Both the chocolate and vanilla cream puffs were delicious, and they inject the filling into the cream puff right when you order, which is pretty cool. I liked the vanilla one a little bit better, but you should try them both yourself :-)

excerpts: I ended up trying a traditional cream puff and a chocolate one.
They did not disappoint.
They weren't anything earth shattering
but, if you want a delicious cream puff these certainly hit the spot.
I ate way to much and felt a bit sick afterwards, but that was 100% self inflicted; I do not put any blame on the bearded man for that one.
chocolate.author: Holly K.
chocolate.review: Ummm what?! A store that only sells cream puffs? They don't have these types of establishments in NC. I knew I had to try a puff or two and dragged the group that I was with in for some as well. I ended up trying a traditional cream puff and a chocolate one. They did not disappoint. They weren't anything earth shattering but, if you want a delicious cream puff these certainly hit the spot. I ate way to much and felt a bit sick afterwards, but that was 100% self inflicted; I do not put any blame on the bearded man for that one.

excerpts: I got the chocolate cream puff with strawberry filling.
It was divine.
The outer shell itself is just meh...but the filling...
oh man.
Yummy fresh strawberry taste.
Very light.
Not the artificial too-sweet taste that I was expecting.
Not sure if the same flavors are available to us in LA.
I did notice that there are a few Beard Papas around...not close to me in the valley tho.
Very nice area.
Yerba Buena park is pretty.
Then there's the Metreon movie theater right across from it too.
chocolate.author: Avril N.
chocolate.review:
First time trying this wonderful pastry.
I got the chocolate cream puff with strawberry filling. It was divine. The outer shell itself is just meh...but the filling...oh man. Yummy fresh strawberry taste. Very light. Not the artificial too-sweet taste that I was expecting.
Not sure if the same flavors are available to us in LA. I did notice that there are a few Beard Papas around...not close to me in the valley tho.
Very nice area. Yerba Buena park is pretty. Then there's the Metreon movie theater right across from it too.

excerpts: I don't think you can tell by the website, but they only have Original Vanilla and Chocolate on a day to day basis.
They add a flavor of the month which I believe is one of the other flavors listed on their site.
My favs are the Original Vanilla and Eclair.
I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.
I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.
The Chocolate needed more chocolate flavor and the Coffee needed more coffee flavor.
I like my chocolate and coffee flavors strong
so these were both a little too light for me.
Other than that, this is definitely a great place to go if you're craving a cream puff!
chocolate.author: Elena N.
chocolate.review: I don't think you can tell by the website, but they only have Original Vanilla and Chocolate on a day to day basis.  They add a flavor of the month which I believe is one of the other flavors listed on their site.  My favs are the Original Vanilla and Eclair.  I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.  The Chocolate needed more chocolate flavor and the Coffee needed more coffee flavor.  I like my chocolate and coffee flavors strong so these were both a little too light for me.  Other than that, this is definitely a great place to go if you're craving a cream puff!

excerpts: Your classic chocolate brought me here the first time but the mango, cookies and cream, coffee, and other surprise flavors keep me coming back to see what's new.
I have to stop myself from coming here every day since it's on my way home
but I'm only human....right?
chocolate.author: Norris T.
chocolate.review: Beard papa's. You have a weird name and a weird little gnome as your logo but you make a tasty cream puff. Your classic chocolate brought me here the first time but the mango, cookies and cream, coffee, and other surprise flavors keep me coming back to see what's new. I have to stop myself from coming here every day since it's on my way home but I'm only human....right?

excerpts: I had the chocolate cream puff and it wasn't heavy or too sweet.
The puff seemed to melt in my mouth.
We ordered a box of 6, with a mix of different cream flavors.
chocolate.author: Frances L.
chocolate.review:
The cream puffs were delicious. I had the chocolate cream puff and it wasn't heavy or too sweet. The puff seemed to melt in my mouth. We ordered a box of 6, with a mix of different cream flavors. They prepared the puffs on the spot pretty quickly/

Downside? It's a pricey addiction to have, but definitely a treat to have once in a while.

excerpts: Vanilla and chocolate were good as well.
chocolate.author: Learnee L.
chocolate.review:
I'm giving them 4 stars for the consistency, the service and being the first (that I know of) cream puff place in the city.
I've heard of this place before they opened the store in the city and was excited to try them.  I don't go here all the time but am always to have a good cream puff.

Their strawberry puff are good. Vanilla and chocolate were good as well.

excerpts: The chocolate dipped shell is also yummy, though it'd be nice if they used a dark chocolate instead of a milk chocolate.
But the main star is the fresh pastry cream in VANILLA (do not deviate from vanilla).
You can see the real vanilla bean specks and it's just sweet enough.
Considering cupcakes run $3.50-$4 each and, in my opinion, are way way easier to make, these cream puffs are quite a steal.
They used to be like $2.25
but I think they're up to $2.75 now.
For all the people complaining that the pastry cream filling is cold, that's because it is fresh pastry cream made with fresh milk and no preservatives and
no weird gunky stabilizers and texturizes like carrageenan or whatever.
It needs to be cold just like milk needs to be cold.
I think Americans forget what it's like to eat non processed foods.
It's a delicate fresh puff, not a cadbury egg that can sit on a shelf for years!
chocolate.author: Cat M.
chocolate.review: I love cream puffs, or choux creme, whatever you want to call them. Before there was Beard Papa on the mainland, I used to hit up the Beard Papa in Honolulu every.single.day like some kind of addict. When they opened a location in New York, I made a SPECIAL TRIP to have them. It's so amazing to have Beard Papa just a few blocks away from me now. The custard cream filling is incredibly fresh and yummy. They fill the pastry only after you order, so the pastry stays crisp and not soggy. I like to get the cookie crunch pastry shell for the texture. The chocolate dipped shell is also yummy, though it'd be nice if they used a dark chocolate instead of a milk chocolate. But the main star is the fresh pastry cream in VANILLA (do not deviate from vanilla). You can see the real vanilla bean specks and it's just sweet enough. Considering cupcakes run $3.50-$4 each and, in my opinion, are way way easier to make, these cream puffs are quite a steal. They used to be like $2.25 but I think they're up to $2.75 now. For all the people complaining that the pastry cream filling is cold, that's because it is fresh pastry cream made with fresh milk and no preservatives and no weird gunky stabilizers and texturizes like carrageenan or whatever. It needs to be cold just like milk needs to be cold. I think Americans forget what it's like to eat non processed foods. It's a delicate fresh puff, not a cadbury egg that can sit on a shelf for years!

excerpts: I got a chocolate puff to go and thought about trying some later in the day.
I came back to the office, started doing some work and skipped off to a meeting.
I almost forgot the puff behind me.
As the presentation wore on, my mind started to wander.
Might as well try this puff.
I fully disengaged from the folks around me and for five glorious moments it was me and that chocolate puff.
Creamy chocolate that was like clouds of cocoa dreams.
Flaky puff that melted in my mouth before I began to chew.
Hype?
It should be believed.
That's a d@mn good puff.
chocolate.author: Johnny T.
chocolate.review:
Hot D@ng! I didn't believe the hype. I mean, what's so special about cream in between two puffs? Hearing the testimonies and watching people out over each other as though they have been touched by the hand of Oprah herself...well, it didn't make sense to me. I have eaten a lot of pastry in my day. I am jaded when it comes to the sweet stuff. I have been there and seen that.

Oh.my.

I came here after a pretty filling lunch. I was satisfied physically and personally. My stomach was full and my usually greedy eyes were taking 5. I got a chocolate puff to go and thought about trying some later in the day. I came back to the office, started doing some work and skipped off to a meeting. I almost forgot the puff behind me. As the presentation wore on, my mind started to wander. "Might as well try this puff."

That was all she wrote. What began with the intent of having a discrete nibble turned into a full-on public gorging. I got cream all over my face, fingers and hands. I had no shame. I fully disengaged from the folks around me and for five glorious moments it was me and that chocolate puff. Creamy chocolate that was like clouds of cocoa dreams. Flaky puff that melted in my mouth before I began to chew. Hype? It should be believed. That's a d@mn good puff.

excerpts: We tried the eclair, original (vanilla), and chocolate.
chocolate.author: Carolyn H.
chocolate.review:
Tasty cream puffs and great service.  This was our first time at Beard Papa, which serves Japanese cream puffs, which have cream that is less viscous than what you would find in a classic profiterole.  We tried the eclair, original (vanilla), and chocolate.  They were tasty, made with fresh ingredients.
