Separate from the quality pastry, I would like to give a shout out to the service.  In addition to being kind and efficient, they are honest and incredibly helpful.  We left a nondescript messenger bag at the shop, but did not realize our error for over three hours.  When we called the store, they immediately confirmed that they had the bag.  Relieved, we ran over to retrieve our bag, which they had kept safe for us.  We wanted to tip them for their kindness and integrity, and they refused.  Thank you, Beard Papa at Yerba Buena!

excerpts: I am in love with the basic chocolate cream puff, but their seasonal specials are always really good.
The cookie shells cost more, but you should give it a go at least once in your cream puff eating life.
If only these weren't so fattening!
chocolate.author: Colleen M.
chocolate.review:
Best Beard Papa's store yet. The one in Westfield is usually too crowded, the workers are too rushed, and well, that kills it for me. The one in LA doesn't cut it for me, either.

Extremely clean storefront with the perfect location; you can share them with friends in the grass at Yerba Buena right across the street! The people behind the counter are amiable and smile back - how can you NOT buy cream puffs from them?

I am in love with the basic chocolate cream puff, but their seasonal specials are always really good. The cookie shells cost more, but you should give it a go at least once in your cream puff eating life. If only these weren't so fattening!

excerpts: We just got plain and chocolate filled.
chocolate.author: Jay D.
chocolate.review:
We walked by a couple weeks ago and i looked up the place. The reviews were good and we were not dissapointed.

I bought a dozen and my friends ate them right up. I will be coming back to try some of the other flavors. We just got plain and chocolate filled.

A friend tried the cheese cake and she said it was tasty. I will be trying this next time.

Staff was friendly and quick.

excerpts: I've tried their coffee, cheesecake, and chocolate cake, but I don't recommend them.
Stick to the cream puffs!
chocolate.author: Alice J.
chocolate.review:
These cream puffs are great. The shell is nice and crunchy and dusted with powdered sugar. It's not too thick either so you taste a good amount of filling. I've tried all the flavors but my favorite is hands down the vanilla.

I've tried their coffee, cheesecake, and chocolate cake, but I don't recommend them. Stick to the cream puffs!

excerpts: The "Daily Flavors" are: Vanilla Bean and Chocolate.
chocolate.author: Mona C.
chocolate.review:
4.5 Stars

+ Yummy
+ Fresh Ingredients 
+ Friendly Service
+ Clean

- So Fatty :(

LOVE Beard Papas!!! Came here with 2 of my buddies while waiting for a movie to start which wasn't in another hour and half or so. There were no line when we got here. Yes!!

I've been to other Beard Papa locations, and I gotta say, this is the best one yet! There were so much to choose from but the first thing that caught my eyes were the cream puffs. The "Daily Flavors" are: Vanilla Bean and Chocolate. Weekly Flavors are: Caramel, Coffee / Tiramisu, Green Tea, Pumpkin and Strawberry. (1 for $2.25, 6 for $11.00, 12 for $22.00)

Everything looked so tasty! I  was debating on whether to try the Green Tea or the Vanilla Bean, but after a long tough decision, I've gone with the Vanilla Bean Cookie Ccrunch Puff. Sooo good. Crunchy exterior, and creamy and sweet interior. Mmm~ Kinda regret not ordering a dozen to go...

For mango lovers, my buddy Steph recommended me the Mango Ice Shower! Shaved ice, mango sauce, topped with fresh mangoes. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

Will be back to try all the other flavors! :D

excerpts: I ordered 3 vanilla and 3 chocolate puff creams.
It was fantastic!
chocolate.author: Bhanie C.
chocolate.review:
Omg! This was my first time having Beard Papas!!! 

I love it! I thought it was going to be to sweet, but it wasn't at all. I ordered 3 vanilla and 3 chocolate puff creams. It was fantastic! Even more amazing with my Starbucks. 

I was staying in the Marriott marquee in SF, and they didn't have a refrigerator, so i left my pastries out. I ate it the next day and it still tasted good! wasn't as crispy but still good! 

Every time I'm in Sf i will stop by a BEARDS PAPA!!!

excerpts: I actually went for the chocolate covered eclair with a vanilla bean center. '
chocolate.author: Abby S.
chocolate.review:
I'll say it once again: there's always room for dessert! 

After enjoying a healthy lunch over at Samovar, my companions and I decided to mix it up a little bit and order some cream puffs. Uh huh! I actually went for the chocolate covered eclair with a vanilla bean center. 'Twas delish!

Although I will say that my mom makes a DAMN good cream puff herself... so I can't give Beard Papa too many stars. Or she'll come get me and I'll be in trouble :)

excerpts:
Chocolate and regular puffs sit on trays; the drill pump device injects cream into the puff.

Cool concept: vanilla, chocolate, or the cream flavor of the week (changed on Fridays). 
At the beginning of the week, I got a reg. 
HAVE offered me what I wanted: a baked chocolate puff filled with coffee cream, the flavor of the week. 

What I got: a regular puff with chocolate cream filling.
chocolate.author: Sunny T.
chocolate.review:
2.25 stars to be generous b/c that's the price of a cream puff.

I really wanted to like Beard Papa. It made me think of Papa Smurf... but I didn't like the cream puffs as much as I like the 1980s little blue cartoons. 

* FAB location next to Schoggi chocolates of Switzerland... and nice clean design, like a factory tour: video of how cream puffs are made and clear glass, so you can see the workers make your order. Chocolate and regular puffs sit on trays; the drill pump device injects cream into the puff.

* BEST aroma -- baked goody smell. Cool concept: vanilla, chocolate, or the cream flavor of the week (changed on Fridays). At the beginning of the week, I got a reg. puff with green tea filling... the puff was dusted with green tea powdered sugar too. OK taste, not too sweet -- but not addictive as other Yelpers make it seem.

* I visited on a second occasion to test consistency of the quality. Customer service was lacking both times. If workers are not pleasant, it dampens my enthusiasm for your treats. 

** BTW when you saw that I was NOT HAPPY (but DISAPPOINTED) with my order (b/c you didn't read it back to me and I got something different than what I intended -- and I didn't even bite into the puff) you SHOULD HAVE offered me what I wanted: a baked chocolate puff filled with coffee cream, the flavor of the week. 

What I got: a regular puff with chocolate cream filling. 

Note: There's a Beard Papa's in the food court of the Westfield San Francisco center at 5th Street and Market... but the mall setting really cramps the magical factory feeling. They sell the same widgets anyway.

They also sell "sticks" of cheesecake. Picture a slightly skinner stick of butter, but made of cheesecake -- not butter. It would be more cool if it was cheesecake on a stick. If you offer this, please send me royalty checks.

excerpts: the chocolate was crumbling all over the place.
chocolate.author: Richard N.
chocolate.review:
the gf insists that this place is actually good, and that we just went on a bad day.

but "meh. i've experienced better" is exactly what i want to say about this place. the pastry was hard. the chocolate was crumbling all over the place. 

and pacific puffs is way better. sorry to all the fans out there. i would give beard papa's another try, but why? when i know i can get the best cream puffs i've ever had at pacific puffs...

excerpts: Ive tried the vanilla, chocolate, green tea and something else
and they were all good.
A cream puff is basically like a sweet pie outside with flavored cream on the outside and topped with some powdered sugar.
On a hot day theyre real refreshing, but dont save them
chocolate.author: Tim M.
chocolate.review:
For the price of their cream puffs they may not seem worth it but they are dang good! I wish they had seasonal flavors which would be pretty cool but what they have now works well.

Ive tried the vanilla, chocolate, green tea and something else and they were all good. A cream puff is basically like a sweet pie outside with flavored cream on the outside and topped with some powdered sugar. On a hot day theyre real refreshing, but dont save them cause they'll get soggy.

Oh, they can be messy for children... eh and adults. The sugar will get on you and if you dont bite it right so will the cream... watch out!

excerpts: He got a Chocolate eclair.
The vanilla cream was not too sweet which complemented & softened the sweetness of the chocolate on top.
I got a Coffee cream puff.
The pastry was delicate & the cream filling had a good deal of coffee flavor.
chocolate.author: Karen S.
chocolate.review:
Why have I never had Beard Papa's before this; especially when there used to be 1 blocks away from my apartment?

He got a Chocolate eclair.  The vanilla cream was not too sweet which complemented & softened the sweetness of the chocolate on top.  I got a Coffee cream puff.  The pastry was delicate & the cream filling had a good deal of coffee flavor.  Unfortunately, my cream puff was already filled.

These are not your usual cream puffs from the bakery or freezer sections.  $2.25 for a pillow of air & cream is a bit of a luxury but it is a great little treat for those special days (or just when you feel like).

excerpts: I love chocolate.
Beard Papa is just so so to me.
chocolate.author: Chum L.
chocolate.review:
I love chocolate. Beard Papa is just so so to me. BUT, today my sister sent me this text: 

Sis: Dad asked where there is a papa beards. I said SF. Dad said, "They're my favorite."  
no joke his exact words. Lol. 

Anything that makes my dad happy, deserves at least four stars.

excerpts: They have the usual vanilla and chocolate creams as well a special flavor each week like coffee, strawberry, or caramel.
Strawberry is awesome.
Caramel is meh.
My favorite flavors for the cream are: Mango, strawberry, chocolate, and gool ol' vanilla.
My favorite flavors for the cream are: Mango, strawberry, chocolate, and gool ol' vanilla.
chocolate.author: C. Z.
chocolate.review:
I love Beard Papa's. So soft. So fluffy. All the layers. Heaven.

If you're gonna get Beard Papa's, come to this store and not the location in the nearby mall food court. 

There's the regular puff, eclair puff, or my favorite, the cocoa puff. All the creams are great as well. They have the usual vanilla and chocolate creams as well a special flavor each week like coffee, strawberry, or caramel. Strawberry is awesome. Caramel is meh. If you're going to visit somewhere, bring a dozen of these and you'll be so loved. 

My favorite flavors for the cream are: Mango, strawberry, chocolate, and gool ol' vanilla.

I wish they would have a facebook page like the cupertino store to advertise weekly specials/flavors.

excerpts: So I have had the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, green tea....the eclair.
There have been so many flavors over the years that I can't keep track.
chocolate.author: PNotHere E.
chocolate.review:
I first had Beard Papa in Oahu when I went back about 10 or so years back.  It was longer than 10 years but who's counting?  Whenever I get into San Francisco close to the Metreon and Yerba Buena I usually at the very minimum go in the doors and look.  I sometimes don't purchase anything but usually I get at least one.  

So I have had the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, green tea....the eclair.  There have been so many flavors over the years that I can't keep track.  I'd venture to guess I have had all their flavors somehow in the past 10 years. 

This location is nice as it sits across the street from Yerba Buena where you can bring your cream puffs, find a place to sit and relax with your sinful treat.  They are light, fluffy and the cool to cold filling that is placed into the flaky ball really hits the spot.  The price seems a bit outrageous but these are pretty fresh and, in my opinion, well worth going to try and possibly bring home.  

They are sinfully good...so much that there is a church less than 100 feet away to confess your sins.  

Get one or three.  They won't last long.

excerpts: The chocolate and vanilla bean are my favorite treats.
Just biting into them makes me feel like I'm on cloud 9.
These little (actually they are pretty big for cream puffs) goodies are gooey and a bit messy but who cares, they are REALLY
REALLY good.
They aren't too sweet which is a plus since I cringe when I have things that are just too sweet.
chocolate.author: Mia D.
chocolate.review:
The chocolate and vanilla bean are my favorite treats.  Just biting into them makes me feel like I'm on cloud 9.  These little (actually they are pretty big for cream puffs) goodies are gooey and a bit messy but who cares, they are REALLY REALLY good.  They aren't too sweet which is a plus since I cringe when I have things that are just too sweet. I didn't even need a milk chaser like I normally do with pastries.  

I just wish they were in Sacramento so that I could have these yummy goodies anytime I wanted. (hence only 4 stars).

excerpts: You can order your cream filing--chocolate, vanilla, or a rotating flavor.
chocolate.author: alicia k.
chocolate.review:
The shop is bleak, but the cream puffs are delectable. Why 5-stars? They really know how to do it. The perfectly textured shell and the light, somewhat sweet cream filing makes them the best cream puffs. You can order your cream filing--chocolate, vanilla, or a rotating flavor. This week's flavor is caramel.

  It's amazing that a shop can exist in the heart of the city selling just cream puffs and a few other treats. It just shows...if you make good food, they will come.

excerpts: I love the chocolate covered puffs with vanilla filling.
chocolate.author: John H.
chocolate.review:
Beard Papa is like crack! I love the chocolate covered puffs with vanilla filling. 

After you eat one, you want another, then another, then another....

There are locations all around the Bay Area so stop by and try one today if you haven't!

excerpts: That light, flaky crust, smothered in chocolate, stuffed with that fluffy cream can't get in my mouth fast enough.
chocolate.author: Kori M.
chocolate.review:
Being so close to my office, people at work have used these cream puffs as bribery to make their project move up in my "to-do" queue. It works every time.

That light, flaky crust, smothered in chocolate, stuffed with that fluffy cream can't get in my mouth fast enough. 

YUMMY!!!

excerpts: They always have chocolate, vanilla, and flavor of the month.
But I always get vanilla.
Flakey crust with a sweet cream puff.
I wish i had room for more.
chocolate.author: Richard G.
chocolate.review:
Cream puffs.  nice.  This is across the street from the the Metreon.  Its in a nice little alleyway.  

I always get vanilla cream.  They always have chocolate, vanilla, and flavor of the month.  But I always get vanilla.  Flakey crust with a sweet cream puff.   I wish i had room for more.  This is probally my fifth visit.  

One star minus for service.

excerpts: They have vanilla and chocolate, strawberry whipped cream, green tea, cookie crumble.
They also have chocolate fondant, and they sell some pretty Asian things as well like Pocky, Hi Chews, and Calipco.
chocolate.author: Grace Y.
chocolate.review:
Hello!!! Addictingly good! The only downside to this place is the horrible amount of calories consumed because it's hard to just have one. Oh and also when you unwrap one of them and get it close to your mouth, if you choose to inhale before you bite, you get a nose full of powdered sugar. So beware! 

They have CUSTARD filled cream puffs. That's right. CUSTARD. Can you tell that I really like CUSTARD?! They have vanilla and chocolate, strawberry whipped cream, green tea, cookie crumble. They also have chocolate fondant, and they sell some pretty Asian things as well like Pocky, Hi Chews, and Calipco. 

I made the mistake of buying a dozen once. Guess who ate the dozen? 

Mainly me. I think I managed to give away 2, but the other 10 I inhaled over the next 3 days. Grumble.

excerpts: They have a great selection of flavors (when I was in: Vanilla, Chocolate, Pumpkin, Mango, Strawberry, Green Tea) as well as different shells (Original, Chocolate Covered and Cookie Crunch).
chocolate.author: Amanda G.
chocolate.review:
Let's be honest, as soon as I started writing this review I started drooling on my keyboard.  Let's think about it this way - do you like dessert? Mm, sure you do - it's amazing! Do you like your desserts made fresh to order? Well, you're in luck - Beard Papa's doesn't fill their crispy creme puffs until you order!  They have a great selection of flavors (when I was in: Vanilla, Chocolate, Pumpkin, Mango, Strawberry, Green Tea) as well as different shells (Original, Chocolate Covered and Cookie Crunch).

If you're visiting SF, put it on your to do list; and if you live in SF, you have absolutely no excuse not to go!

excerpts: Flavors I've tried are the vanilla, chocolate, coffee and matcha (green tea), and I really loved every single one of those, especially the matcha!
chocolate.author: Valerie R.
chocolate.review:
Whenever I'm hanging out around Downtown SF, I try to make a point to visit Beard Papa's!  Their cream puffs are so, so, soooo delicious! The play on textures with the crispy pastry and the velvety cream filling is such a win!combination.  Also, one cream puff is really filling, so the price, I think, is appropriate. Flavors I've tried are the vanilla, chocolate, coffee and matcha (green tea), and I really loved every single one of those, especially the matcha!

I've also tried the cheesecake sticks. A slice of cheesecake is usually a bit too heavy for me, so these sticks are the perfect size to fulfill a craving for cheesecake! They're not overly sweet, and they've got just the right amount of crust to filling.

In anycase, make sure to grab several napkins if you decide to just go for the cream puffs!! Tryin to eat a cream puff without spilling all over is an art I have yet to manage!

excerpts: I got a chocolate puff with chocolate filling and
it was like no other cream puff I've ever tried!
The cream inside was deliciously light and decadent, with just a subtle chocolate taste.
I polished it off in a few minutes and wished I had bought more before leaving town.
Mmmm!
chocolate.author: Monica L.
chocolate.review: I decided to try these cream puffs on a whim while in San Francisco. Despite the fact that cream puffs are not one of my favorite desserts, something about the funny name intrigued me. I got a chocolate puff with chocolate filling and it was like no other cream puff I've ever tried! The cream inside was deliciously light and decadent, with just a subtle chocolate taste. I polished it off in a few minutes and wished I had bought more before leaving town. Mmmm!

excerpts: I got a cookie crust cream puff shell with chocolate mouseey filling (of course).......yum!
chocolate.author: Rinky N.
chocolate.review:
I had to do an update of BP.  It was one of the first places I Yelped as a newbie Yelper.  

I returned to BP with my good bud, D,  She had never been there before!
We went there on a Friday afternoon and there wasn't a line!  

I got a cookie crust cream puff shell with chocolate mouseey filling (of course).......yum!

Sorry to hear some Yelpers had runny fillings...ugh! 

I just got one though I could have eaten more.

"D" got a green tea cream puff and loved loved it.

The people who work here are so nice.  It would have been easy for me to have ordered at least 100 more but since I am the only one in my household who would eat them, I restrained myself......this time.

I of course was completely mesmerized by the video of the whole cream puff process.  It's hard to believe that I haven't been brainwashed at some point in my life since I am so easily entranced by anything on video or tv or movie.  Or maybe I have......?

excerpts: We ordered a chocolate puff with a fresher puff and it was simply amazing.
Soft, flaky shell filled with fluffy chocolate.
One bite and the filling just oozed out.
A great dessert option!
chocolate.author: Christopher F.
chocolate.review:
I went there with my girlfriend and must say that these are very impressive cream puffs.

Here's a hint! Request one of the fresher empty puffs for filling. We ordered a chocolate puff with a fresher puff and it was simply amazing. Soft, flaky shell filled with fluffy chocolate. One bite and the filling just oozed out. A great dessert option!

excerpts: Today I had chocolate with vanilla, and as James Lipton would say, "It was... delightful.
"   yum
yum yum
This is the kind of thing that you need to buy one, and then walkaway.
It would be so easy to eat more than one!
chocolate.author: Chloe M.
chocolate.review: Today I had chocolate with vanilla, and as James Lipton would say, "It was... delightful."   yum yum yum  This is the kind of thing that you need to buy one, and then walkaway.  It would be so easy to eat more than one!

excerpts: We ordered three puffs in all --- one chocolate, one vanilla, one vanilla eclair.
Each was cold.
I always imagined my puffs would arrive warm.
The chocolate lacked any depth of flavor whatsoever.
The vanilla was significantly better but the temperature just turned me off.
As a result, my cream puff collaborator was forced to eat most of our order himself.
chocolate.author: Miriam W.
chocolate.review:
In my imagination I'd walk into Beard Papa, place my order and at the other end of the counter find heaven waiting for me in a clearly branded bag. Not unlike my daydreams of unicorns and Prince Charming, Beard Papa failed miserably to live up to the heights I had built it to in my mind. 

We ordered three puffs in all --- one chocolate, one vanilla, one vanilla eclair. Each was cold. I always imagined my puffs would arrive warm. The chocolate lacked any depth of flavor whatsoever. The vanilla was significantly better but the temperature just turned me off. As a result, my cream puff collaborator was forced to eat most of our order himself.

excerpts: ( The chocolate flavor is good too
but not my preferance.)
I would give this place a 5 star
but when I came to visit they lacked this dessert that I wanted to try.
But I always have a good experience at Beard Papa's Cream puff.
Defintely my favorite dessert after french macaroons.
chocolate.author: Julie C.
chocolate.review: This place gets a 4 star because they definitely keep me coming back for their delicious vanilla cream puffs. ( The chocolate flavor is good too but not my preferance.) I would give this place a 5 star but when I came to visit they lacked this dessert that I wanted to try. But I always have a good experience at Beard Papa's Cream puff. Defintely my favorite dessert after french macaroons.

excerpts: The pumpkin cream was more savory than sweet which I liked, but I did not care for the chocolate puff much.
All in all a good grab and go treat to share.
chocolate.author: Lama B.
chocolate.review:
It was the first time I had cream puffs from Beard Papa's and I was not toooo disappointed.  There is nothing really too wrong about them but the fact that they are so big is a little bit off putting.  The pumpkin cream was more savory than sweet which I liked, but I did not care for the chocolate puff much.  
All in all a good grab and go treat to share.

excerpts: I've been to Beard Papa's several times now, and I've tried the original cream puff with both the vanilla bean and chocolate custards,
the chocolate eclair with vanilla, and the cookie crunch cream puff with the vanilla filling.
The chocolate filling is a little too rich for my taste (I never thought I would say such a thing), and the cookie crunch shell doesn't amaze me enough to justify the extra costs.
Stick with the original cream puff with vanilla or make it a chocolate eclair for the extra decadence!
chocolate.author: Maggie W.
chocolate.review: What's better than watching big, fluffy cream puffs being filled with the custard of your choice right before your eyes? Why - eating them, of course. I've been to Beard Papa's several times now, and I've tried the original cream puff with both the vanilla bean and chocolate custards, the chocolate eclair with vanilla, and the cookie crunch cream puff with the vanilla filling. The chocolate filling is a little too rich for my taste (I never thought I would say such a thing), and the cookie crunch shell doesn't amaze me enough to justify the extra costs. Stick with the original cream puff with vanilla or make it a chocolate eclair for the extra decadence!

excerpts: That chocolate thing with the chocolate center always looks pretty good, so that's another reason too.
chocolate.author: Teri C.
chocolate.review:
I should say this first - I'm not a cream puffer.

I've tried and tried, and cream puffs just don't do it for me...same for eclairs.  The pastry outside always taste so bland, and the cream filling isn't sweet enough my my taste buds.  And I've tried Beard Papa's Vanilla Bean concoction not once, but twice.  And it still just doesn't make my mouth happy.

Nonetheless, I gave them three stars because the girls working there were pleasant and nice.  It wasn't too busy when I went, and it was a pleasant shopping experience.  (I was picking them up for someone else.)

I was definitely interested in trying the Cheese Cake today, but they were out!  Bummer!  However, I do plan on going back and trying their other goodies.  That chocolate thing with the chocolate center always looks pretty good, so that's another reason too.

It's just as well that I'm not a cream puffer, I don't need to find myself gorging on these things anyway.  With all the other desserts I love to eat, at least there are some that I can no to!

excerpts: The chocolate cream puff with vanilla custard is just divine!
chocolate.author: Juliette R.
chocolate.review:
The aroma of freshly baked cream puffs wafting through the air is something I could get used to. 

I prefer the cream puffs from this location to those from the Westfield mall for some apparent reason. The chocolate cream puff with vanilla custard is just divine!

excerpts: I stopped myself from eating the chocolate cream puff (I got for my b/f), even though I really wanted to.
chocolate.author: Celeste M.
chocolate.review:
I puff, YOU puff, we all scream for cream puff :-)!

Light, flaky, airy and oh so tasty.  The fresh baked aroma is incredible.  It wasn't at all crowded at 1:30pm on a Wednesday afternoon and the service was quick.  I was savoring a strawberry cream puff in no time... 4 minutes later, I gobbled up a vanilla cream puff too. I stopped myself from eating the chocolate cream puff (I got for my b/f), even though I really wanted to.  

A great place for a delicious, sweet snack.  Next time I see a movie at The Metreon, I will make sure to stop by Beard Papa's so I can enjoy a cream puff or two while watching a movie.

excerpts: I tried the vanilla and the chocolate filling and both were delicious.

I was partial to the chocolate, because it was a slightly sweeter flavor, but the light, fluffy dough encapsulating the cream was delicious, and the perfect amount of savory to compliment the filling.
If for your love of the Wreck-it Ralph movie alone wasn't enough, (the character manning the security booth outside the go-kart factory is Beard Papa!)
you should definitely treat yo' self and get some of these cream puffs!
chocolate.author: Laurie B.
chocolate.review: I have a massive sweet tooth, so when my friend described these Japanese style pastries as "not that sweet" I was prepared for disappointment. Thankfully, that was not the case. I tried the vanilla and the chocolate filling and both were delicious. I was partial to the chocolate, because it was a slightly sweeter flavor, but the light, fluffy dough encapsulating the cream was delicious, and the perfect amount of savory to compliment the filling. If for your love of the Wreck-it Ralph movie alone wasn't enough, (the character manning the security booth outside the go-kart factory is Beard Papa!) you should definitely treat yo' self and get some of these cream puffs!

excerpts: I've tried the green tea, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla one.
I love all the flavors.
My favorite is the chocolate one because it's so delicious and flavorful.
It's very creamy and the family loves when I bring some back.
They taste even better the next day.
It's so refreshing for breakfast.
chocolate.author: Natalie M.
chocolate.review:
I LOVE Beard Papa's.

They are yummy yummy cream puffs. It's about $11 for half a dozen (or something like that) and $2.25 for one cream puff. A little pricey but they are sooo yummy. I've tried the green tea, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla one. I love all the flavors. My favorite is the chocolate one because it's so delicious and flavorful. It's very creamy and the family loves when I bring some back. They taste even better the next day. It's so refreshing for breakfast. Just writing about it makes me want to go out and get some!

Definitely recommend this place.

excerpts: The original and chocolate are both delicious.
There were no more COOKIE CRUNCH shells when i ordered but my friend, who came later, ordered a chocolate cream puff with the cookie crunch shell and it was yummy.
The shell was hard and tasted a bit like cookies, not definitely.
chocolate.author: Michael N.
chocolate.review:
I was having a cream puff craving and had recently tried a different place for their puffs so i wanted to come here to try Papa's puffs. Again. 

I tried this place before and always thought the puffs were delicious but this time I was using Yelp and wanted to compare this place with another set of puffs i had recently tried.

Their puffs are BIG. The powdered sugar on top is good but could be a little too much for me. The original and chocolate are both delicious. But what I like about this place is that they have daily special flavors and when i came the flavor was GREEN TEA! Woot woot :] I love green tea flavored things so i just had to order one. There were no more COOKIE CRUNCH shells when i ordered but my friend, who came later, ordered a chocolate cream puff with the cookie crunch shell and it was yummy. The shell was hard and tasted a bit like cookies, not definitely. Anyways, my green tea cream puff was good. Not great but good. It wasn't a really sweet green tea flavor but more like Matcha, sorta. It was 'earthy' and mildly sweet. I cannot wait to try Caramel and Strawberry.

I am most def. coming back here and i recommend people to come here to try it out.

excerpts: I just don't get the strawberry and chocolate fillings.
chocolate.author: Matt B.
chocolate.review:
I first had Beard Papa's in Singapore, and on every visit, I would go and indulge by having a just a few, say five at a time.  

These days, I am hostage to my car whose navigation system identifies the nearest Beard Papa, and gives me false directions until I arrive at one of their stores.  My New Year's resolution since 2001 has been no more than 3 at a time, and I've broken that promise only every time.  

I only choose the custard cream puff.   While I've tried the other flavors and other menu items, it is the custard filled puff that has a special place in my stomach. If they only sold my item, it would be a five star review.  I just don't get the strawberry and chocolate fillings.

excerpts: I have tried the green tea, the chocolate, the vanilla, but this was my first time trying the strawberry.
chocolate.author: Wendy L.
chocolate.review:
I have discovered a new favorite flavor...strawberry. I have tried the green tea, the chocolate, the vanilla, but this was my first time trying the strawberry.

Here's something to be aware though...They have rotating flavors of the week. But I did not know their idea of a week runs from Friday through Thursday (not Monday through Saturday, not Sunday through Saturday...yes, their week starts on a Friday). So off I went today (Friday), because I knew their flavor of the week was mango, but I was disappointed when I was told "Oh that was last week. Yesterday was the last day." I was totally scratching my head thinking, Last week? Last week? But yesterday was Thursday?

So I ended up missing the mango flavor because I went on a Friday and they had rotated the next flavor of the week to strawberry already. I still wanna try the mango one...never had the opportunity, but the strawberry is my new favorite flavor now.

Oh, they have their special flavors of the week (for the entire year!) posted online. Check it out if you wanna plan accordingly.

excerpts: I like that they have a few different varieties of puffs, you can get things like green tea and mango - but we opted just for chocolate and vanilla.
Watching them fill the pastry puffs was also fairly entrancing, perhaps indicative of the sugar coma that was to ensue.
They were tasty, to be sure.
I didn't, like, totally flip out over them, but perhaps I'm not a cream puff kinda gal.
Maybe I should go back...
chocolate.author: Becca S.
chocolate.review:
Working in SOMA, I had passed Bear Papa many times, unable to shake the dirty feeling I got from the term "mango ice shower."  One day, inevitably, it was time to stop in and try the puffs.

Beard Papa's is definitely your standard fast-food-type joint, and I wouldn't really advocate eating there unless you're feeling particularly insouciant about ambiance. (2/3 etymologically French words, go me!)  But nobody really does that.  They grab their loot, their dirty, dirty secrets, and go.  We did the same.

I like that they have a few different varieties of puffs, you can get things like green tea and mango - but we opted just for chocolate and vanilla.  Watching them fill the pastry puffs was also fairly entrancing, perhaps indicative of the sugar coma that was to ensue.  They were tasty, to be sure.  I didn't, like, totally flip out over them, but perhaps I'm not a cream puff kinda gal.  Maybe I should go back...

excerpts: Update 6/10/06: tried the chocolate cream puff.
Still just ok.
It's $1.95 (20c more than vanilla).
220 calories per puff I read. yikes.
My husband and I tried a Beard Papa's cream puff Thurs 5/18/06 around 5pm.
Wait was about 10 minutes which was fine.
Place order on the left, pick-up order on the right.
Cream puff was ok, one for $1.75.
Cold when I expected a warm or even hot cream puff.
Cream didn't have much flavor nor the crust.
We finished it up but probably won't get another one for a while.
Maybe other flavors would be more interesting.
Go only if you are curious, otherwise pass.
There is one unisex bathroom in the tiny shop.
Oh, and the shop is warm inside there.
Walkable from Powell Bart Station.
chocolate.author: Ann L.
chocolate.review:
Update 6/10/06: tried the chocolate cream puff.  Still just ok. It's $1.95 (20c more than vanilla).  220 calories per puff I read. yikes.

My husband and I tried a Beard Papa's cream puff Thurs 5/18/06 around 5pm.  Wait was about 10 minutes which was fine.  Place order on the left, pick-up order on the right.  Cream puff was ok, one for $1.75.  Cold when I expected a warm or even hot cream puff.  Cream didn't have much flavor nor the crust.  We finished it up but probably won't get another one for a while.  Maybe other flavors would be more interesting.

Go only if you are curious, otherwise pass.  There is one unisex bathroom in the tiny shop.  Oh, and the shop is warm inside there.  Walkable from Powell Bart Station.

excerpts: Gotta have the chocolate eclairs too!
chocolate.author: Danny L.
chocolate.review:
Dang, these cream puffs and eclairs are addicting!  And you can choose the flavoring of the creme that goes inside these things too?!  Holy smokes, I'm in a sugary bliss!

My recommendation?  Don't get just one... Get the 6 pack!  Seriously folks, you will want more!  Oh, it's not just about the cream puffs either...  Gotta have the chocolate eclairs too!

excerpts: Except then I dig into a chocolate puff.
Decent.
But I'm not a huge chocolate flavor fan -
so maybe I'm just not appreciating it all.
chocolate.author: Vic C.
chocolate.review:
After hearing about the craze in NYC, I headed over to this joint a couple weeks after it hit SF. I sat there waiting, and waiting, and waiting as the aromas engulfed me. Man, I think right there, the waiting hypes these little guys up more than anything. 

I finally get my hands onto one of 'em and take a bite. Oh, what deliciousness. Soft and chewy. Yum. Okay, arguably, not worth the price tag. 

And... I'm a sucker for really, really sweet things (icing out of a can, anyone?). So maybe these weren't quite sweet enough. But still tasty. I mean, those Japanese know their desserts (mochi?). 

Except then I dig into a chocolate puff. Decent. But I'm not a huge chocolate flavor fan - so maybe I'm just not appreciating it all. Next up to bat: green tea (if I was going to try Beard Papa's, I wasn't going to half-ass it). Okay. Not a fan of the green tea. A little bitter. Actually, a little too much like, well, green tea. I mean, I like my green tea ice cream, but the cream puff definitely didn't do it for me. 

My rating out of 5: 
Taste: 3 overall (4 for vanilla)
Price: 1.5
Service: 3.5

Final thoughts? I wish SF had a Dunkin' Donuts.

excerpts: I had the Chocolate eclair with Vanilla filling.
It was really tasty and the chocolate top was breaking away from the bottom part as I was eating it.
It was really messy and I had chocolate all over my fingers and yellow custard all over my mouth.
chocolate.author: James H.
chocolate.review:
I had the Chocolate eclair with Vanilla filling.  It was really tasty and the chocolate top was breaking away from the bottom part as I was eating it. It was really messy and I had chocolate all over my fingers and yellow custard all over my mouth.

It was pretty good.  I think I may have to work out at the gym for 3 days straight to make up for it.  They probably should not make these places so convenient that you can just bump into them while your walking down the street.

excerpts: Chocolate & the original are delicious.
They also have mango drinks that are good, but overly sweet.
chocolate.author: Emily C.
chocolate.review: I love their delicious, ginormous cream puffs! Chocolate & the original are delicious. They also have mango drinks that are good, but overly sweet.

excerpts: but there is always chocolate cream and a special flavor such as green tea or mango.
Buy two or you'll be sorry.
chocolate.author: Kate N.
chocolate.review: My teenagers' favorite pastry. We have to stop by for the world's best cream puffs whenever we are in the neighborhood. We will actually pay to park in the nearby garage if we have driven, but this location is near the BART (and the other one is down in the food court at the nearby shopping center practically in the BART station) so that's the best way to go.  Vanilla is the best- I don't need all the fancy stuff- but there is always chocolate cream and a special flavor such as green tea or mango. Buy two or you'll be sorry.

excerpts: I've tried these flavors: Vanilla (original), Chocolate, Caramel, and Green Tea.
All of us at work agree that the vanilla is the best, though.
The Green Tea isn't too bad, but it's more mild than the Vanilla (a little smoother, maybe a little less fat).
chocolate.author: Helene K.
chocolate.review:
My review is the 700th one for Beard Papa's (this listing, anyway). What more can I add to these other 699 reviews?

I don't go into the store much, but Beard Papa's is a favorite at work. My manager and I got a box of cream puffs on Administrative Professionals Day this year, and yesterday, our small staff split a dozen cream puffs amongst ourselves. Mmm mmm. It's safe to say we find the cream puffs quite enjoyable and rewarding!

I've tried these flavors: Vanilla (original), Chocolate, Caramel, and Green Tea. All of us at work agree that the vanilla is the best, though. The Green Tea isn't too bad, but it's more mild than the Vanilla (a little smoother, maybe a little less fat). 

Certainly, one of Beard Papa's cream puffs is best with a cup of black coffee. Beware of the oozing cream when you get towards the middle, though!

I wish I could say more about the actual storefront, but alas, I cannot. I assume their service is decent enough if my boss keeps going back there for more cream puffs.

excerpts: Honestly, the custard is just kind of bland (yes, even the chocolate version).
Seems to me like these babies need a long list of exotic (and while we're at it, local/seasonal/organic) filling flavors.
Now *that* would be a 5-star sweet shop.
chocolate.author: Wes M.
chocolate.review:
Once you realize that Beard Papa is actually a Japanese import, it all starts to make sense.  I mean, I don't think the typical SF food entrepreneur would think to start a cream puff shop with a cute but cryptic old-man-of-the-sea mascot named "Beard Papa".  Right?  Then there's the fact that they have a spot in the Westfield food court in addition to the (preferable) Yerba Buena Lane location--so you know there's some money behind this little operation.

Now frankly, I've never been too excited about cream puffs.  And while BP does seem to uphold the SF tradition of freshness (did you know they inject the cream into the puff right there in front of you?  Not too shabby), they don't single-handedly reinvent the genre.  Honestly, the custard is just kind of bland (yes, even the chocolate version).  Seems to me like these babies need a long list of exotic (and while we're at it, local/seasonal/organic) filling flavors.  Now *that* would be a 5-star sweet shop.

excerpts: I had both the chocolate & vanilla cream puffs with a hot caffeinated coffee.
I gotta say it was pretty good.
Perhaps I was just very hungry?
Nah...
I'm an absolute sucker for pastries and something sweet.
This place is right up my alley.
chocolate.author: Gina M.
chocolate.review:
My first time at this location and at any BP period... I was just existing a formal Catholic wedding ceremony.  If you're Catholic, then you know how long I had been in there (1.5 hours)!  We were all very very hungry and walked to the left to find Beard Papa.  We said to ourselves, it's food, it's here, why not.  It was tasty!

I had both the chocolate & vanilla cream puffs with a hot caffeinated coffee.  I gotta say it was pretty good.  Perhaps I was just very hungry?  Nah... I'm an absolute sucker for pastries and something sweet.  This place is right up my alley.

excerpts: I've tried a few of their flavors, and all of them have been so very tasty (green tea, strawberry, chocolate, vanilla).
They even put real vanilla bean in the vanilla custard, a big plus!
chocolate.author: Karen W.
chocolate.review: Cream puffs= mmmm!  I've tried a few of their flavors, and all of them have been so very tasty (green tea, strawberry, chocolate, vanilla).  They even put real vanilla bean in the vanilla custard, a big plus!

excerpts: I tried one vanilla and one chocolate.
yummy.
Everytime
I go shopping there
I make it a routine to grab me a cream puff on my way out.
chocolate.author: Jane A.
chocolate.review:
MY TASTEBUDS ARE SCREAMING!

When the new San Francisco Shopping Center opened I was pretty exited about their food court, definately different then other malls. So many people were lining up at Beard Papa and I'm thinking to myself what the hell is going on. So I moved with the masses and found myself in complete ecstacy over their cream puffs. I tried one vanilla and one chocolate. yummy. Everytime I go shopping there I make it a routine to grab me a cream puff on my way out.

chocolate.author: Kirsten M.
chocolate.review:
Wow.   So I wouldn't say I'm big into cream puffs, but I am after going here last night.   

We were early for an event at the moma and were walking around and saw this place.  I thought that it was odd for a place to just sell cream puffs but then again everyone and their mom has a cupcake place these days.   

We headed off to the moma and afterwards I thought about it again and we went over.  So glad we did! 

The place is kind of sparse inside so I didn't have high hopes,  but we ordered 6 of the éclair puffs ( because a cream puff with chocolate is sure to be better than one without); two with vanilla cream, two with chocolate cream and two with caramel cream,  which was the flavor of the week. 

The guy behind the counter was fast and laughed at all my half drunk boyfriends jokes while packing them to go in a cute little box.

So good.  Love them.  Ate them all that night like a little piggy.  The vanilla is my favorite.  Caramel was good.  Chocolate was weak on the chocolate flavor.

I've since been back and have to say coffee is a close second/tied with vanilla as my favorite flavor.  

No matter what I do though, I can't manage to eat them without some of the custard squirting out the other end.  I've tried many different techniques, all to no avail.  So just put your hand under it to catch the stuff that spills out then lick it up!

excerpts: Just had my first cream puff (chocolate) here today and it was heaven!
A co-worker told me about it...
we snuck out of a conference to fulfill our craving, yum!
I'd give it 5 stars if it had more of a hang out area.
chocolate.author: Isabel M. L.
chocolate.review:
de-freakin'-licious! Just had my first cream puff (chocolate) here today and it was heaven! A co-worker told me about it...we snuck out of a conference to fulfill our craving, yum! I'd give it 5 stars if it had more of a hang out area. It's a tight little space there if you want to enjoy your puff at BP's.

YUM!!!

excerpts: All I can say is that she brought over vanilla, tiramisu, and chocolate - and that is also the order in which I preferred, and devoured them.
chocolate.author: Grace K.
chocolate.review:
I was having a dinner party for a friend of mine who was in town, and she brought over a dozen of these cream puffs.

I have a love affair with cream puffs since childhood.  Growing up in various countries in Asia - this was a treat that was quite often brought over by guests as gifts.  I'm not even a dessert person, but cream puffs (or even donuts with bavarian cream, oooh la laaa) really do it for me.  They make me happy.

All I can say is that she brought over vanilla, tiramisu, and chocolate - and that is also the order in which I preferred, and devoured them.

All twelve.

(OK, I let Rob have 2 and 2 friends and one kid had one each on that evening.  The remaining seven - - in my tummy over the course of 2 days, thank you very much.)

1 cream puff = 2 lbs gain = 3 inch waistline increase.
These are not the "pop in your mouth" size - these are rather enormous, I'm ashamed to admit.

And it's STILL worth it.

Go figure that one out!!!!

I can't believe I have never tried Beard Papa's until this week.
Thank God I hadn't, but now that I have - God help me.

excerpts: They also have eclairs and chocolate fondant.
Thankfully, no beard hair or what ever Beard Papa is smoking makes its way into these delightful lessons in diabetes and obesity.
chocolate.author: Christina C.
chocolate.review:
I had plenty of misgivings about Beard Papa's.   I've seen it in Southern CA but avoided it probably due to its name and logo.  I mean, its name sounds like a Smurf-themed sex shop or gay Bear bar.  I'm also not attracted to the Gordon Fisherman meets Chef Boyardee logo of an old man puffing on a pipe while I'm eating.

This Japanese-based pastry shop I guess started out in Osaka (where my mom used to live) and I love Japanese food so I figured I should give it a try.  According to their website (best watched after you've ingested said cream puffs) the original inspiration of the cream puffs came from the original Beard Papa's .... shockingly, from his facial hair.  He also seemed to be smoking while baking these "World's Best Cream Puffs".  I'm not sure what the most disturbing part of those sentences are, but I'll leave that up to you to decipher.

Regardless, the cream puffs are pretty damn amazing. I'm not normally a fan of puffed pastry seeded in custard and whipped cream, but stopping in was an unexpected treat.  I had the cookie crumb pastry with vanilla bean filling.  It was... awesome.  They also serve treats in stick form which is a form I am fond of.  They had tiramisu, cheesecake and strawberry.  They also have eclairs and chocolate fondant.  Thankfully, no beard hair or what ever Beard Papa is smoking makes its way into these delightful lessons in diabetes and obesity.

excerpts: The special flavor of the day was strawberry, which we didn't get because the pretty girl at the register said their regular vanilla are their best sellers, so we got that plus a chocolate one for me.
chocolate.author: Fancypants X.
chocolate.review:
Beard Papa & I have crossed paths many times in the past: at Christmas last year, my auntie & uncle brought a whole box to dinner, but at the time I was "dieting." I see it every time I go for Peete's Coffee or pick up something at Bristol Farms downtown. And most recently, I've been reading all my fellow YELPers rave reviews about it.

The BFF & I stopped in at the Yerba Beuna location, at my urging, to try Beard Papa's for the first time (*record scratch* "i love it when you call me beard papa's...") The special flavor of the day was strawberry, which we didn't get because the pretty girl at the register said their regular vanilla are their best sellers, so we got that plus a chocolate one for me.

We ordered & they pump the little empty puffs full of filling right there in front of you. We took our first bites & didn't get any filling. Three bites in, we finally taste the custard & it is oozing out everywhere. I don't think I will eat another Beard Papa cream puff ever again. It's just not my stee-lo, ya heard? It's tastes & smells kinda "eggy" (ewww) & it's too many calories for something I just don't enjoy. The cream, the puff, the whole cream puff... is pretty bland. As my friend put it, "it's pretty hallow in the middle & when you eat it, thats how it will make you feel- HALLOW & a little fatter!"

excerpts: And even though I'm never really a fan of chocolate, I had to taste it
and damn I liked it.
Probably b/c
it wasn't an overpowering chocolate taste.
The flavor of the day was the milk tea
and I wasn't brave enough to try it.
I would definitely go back.
chocolate.author: Dina V.
chocolate.review:
YUM! What's not to like? Vanilla custard. Yum! And even though I'm never really a fan of chocolate, I had to taste it and damn I liked it. Probably b/c it wasn't an overpowering chocolate taste. The flavor of the day was the milk tea and I wasn't brave enough to try it. I would definitely go back. Thankfully we popped in on a Sunday afternoon and surprisingly the line wasn't ridiculous. 

Does anyone know how they determine what the special flavor will be? Like does that menu rotate? I would love to try the strawberry and caramel!

excerpts: Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee.
chocolate.author: Tadashi Y.
chocolate.review:
Beard Papa's is owned & operated by the Japanese firm  Muginoho. Their slogan is "Fresh'n natural cream puffs." 

Beard Papa's was opened in 1999 by Yuji Hirota in Osaka, Japan w/ the motto "Pipin' Hot Cream Puffs". Beard Papa's has over 250 stores in Japan & 300 worldwide in countries including  China, Korea, Taiwan, Indonesia, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Canada, & the United States.

Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee. The different flavors are sold on a rotating schedule.

While I like trying each of their flavours, the vanilla original flavour is my favourite. They inject the creamy goodness into the yummy shells to order. The place is imaculately maintained & provide a restroom & outdoor seating. 

There is also another location a block over underneath the Westfield Bloomingdale's Mall, in the food court. 

The name Beard Papa was chosen because the cream puff reminded Yuji of a sailor's beard & he felt that the "Engrish" (disjointed & often unintentionally funny Japanese version of English) title of "Beard Papa" will give Japanese people an American touch, while giving Americans a Japanese touch.

excerpts: We did order the green tea, chocolate, and vanilla.
Green tea usually kind of tastes off when they make it into some other form than tea.
I suggest not trying this.
The chocolate is thick kind of like pudding and the vanilla had the best balance.
chocolate.author: Andrew N.
chocolate.review:
We were shown this place by some friends. First off, they just make creme puffs and the creme has different flavors. The puffs are already pre-made and just filled to order. There was a line and probably always is, but it moved fast.

I thought their puffs were light so that was a plus, but the creme wasn't super and didnt make up for the cost. They are expensive. I am glad to say I've tried it, but I would not come back.

I am a believe in cheap and good. I don't need all the other frills. This place is expensive and good. But in the end its just a creme puff. 

We did order the green tea, chocolate, and vanilla. They were out of strawberry. Green tea usually kind of tastes off when they make it into some other form than tea. I suggest not trying this. The chocolate is thick kind of like pudding and the vanilla had the best balance.

excerpts: We had vanilla, chocolate, and the flavor of the week which was coffee.
Man....those things are friggin' good.
Without a doubt we'll make a return trek to Beard Papa's every year when we're in the city.
chocolate.author: David F.
chocolate.review: My daughter & I were staying down the street, & had never even heard of this place until we searched Yelp for somewhere to get dessert.  They had already closed for the night, so we went back the next morning & picked up a six pack of cream puffs.  We had vanilla, chocolate, and the flavor of the week which was coffee.  Man....those things are friggin' good.  Without a doubt we'll make a return trek to Beard Papa's every year when we're in the city.

excerpts: My fave. is the vanilla flavor but they have chocolate, green tea flavors etc.
chocolate.author: C A.
chocolate.review:
Oh dear vanilla cream puff! I love you. Period.
If you haven't had it, you are wasting your life ... I mean appetite!=)

Warm outside, cold creamy inside and it melts in your mouth. it is probably really bad for you but it tastes so freakin' good. i am a huge fan. i want one right now!..mmm.. maybe i should go get some...holidays as in never ending eating? sigh.

ok, pls. go try and you will see. My fave. is the vanilla flavor but they have chocolate, green tea flavors etc.

excerpts: The special flavor of the week was Coffee, in addition to your usual Vanilla and Chocolate choosing.
chocolate.author: Jing D.
chocolate.review:
I love these little divine puffs of heaven!!

I've had Beard Papa one other time in the Westfields Shopping Mall on Market Street, and I remembered it was a delicious treat. So after visiting the Contemporary Jewish Museum and stumbling upon this location in the adjacent alleyway, my friend and I just HAAAD to stop in for some puffs!

The special flavor of the week was Coffee, in addition to your usual Vanilla and Chocolate choosing. I wish they had Green Tea or Strawberry instead of Coffee, those sound yummy. What I love about these treats that they are just so light and heavenly to indulge!! The puff pastries are soft with a slight crunch, this is a good thing by adding some texture. I'm not so fond of over-buttery and sweet custards. I find the cream fillings here to be on the light (and very fresh) side, which I prefer and love. 

I can't help but smile and be joyous when eating these, even as thoughts of them immediately adhering to my waistline creep up every now and then.

excerpts: The words "served warm" have always been a HUGE selling point for me, so when I came into Bead Papa's and saw their tiny molten chocolate cake with those words right under the label I realized I was guided straight to dessert heaven.
Then my eyes shined as I gleamed at the chocolate cake.
The puff was a perfect complement to the rich chocolate and for about 10 minutes and less than $6 I was in ooey gooey heaven.
chocolate.author: Laura G.
chocolate.review:
The words "served warm" have always been a HUGE selling point for me, so when I came into Bead Papa's and saw their tiny molten chocolate cake with those words right under the label I realized I was guided straight to dessert heaven. 

I was leaving SFMOMA and was coerced into having a dessert *EHEMyouknowwhoyouare!* 
I shrugged my shoulders and went inside without knowing what to expect.
The first thing I saw were the Vanilla Cream Puffs, "sure, why not." Then my eyes shined as I gleamed at the chocolate cake. YESSSS

The puff was a perfect complement to the rich chocolate and for about 10 minutes and less than $6 I was in ooey gooey heaven. *_*

The best part? All that walking around in SF burned off all the calories and I indulged in a guilt-free pleasure.

excerpts: Had the Creamy Vanilla bean and the Chocolate Puff.
The Vanilla was just awesome.
It almost tasted like a thinned out ice cream.
Light, Creamy and slight vanilla flavor,Everything a cream puff should be.
The Chocolate Puff wasn't all that appealing to me.
It tasted like they mixed in cocoa powder to the regular batch of pastry cream.
I wish they would of used a real nice dark chocolate folded inside of the cream.
Possibly even drizzle the top of the pastry with warm chocolate.
Don't get me wrong though.
chocolate.author: Joseph G.
chocolate.review:
How can you go wrong with these delicious Cream filled puffs? Had the Creamy Vanilla bean and the Chocolate Puff. The Vanilla was just awesome. It almost tasted like a thinned out ice cream. Light, Creamy and slight vanilla flavor,Everything a cream puff should be. I was so happy eating this cream puff.

The Chocolate Puff wasn't all that appealing to me. It tasted like they mixed in cocoa powder to the regular batch of pastry cream. I wish they would of used a real nice dark chocolate folded inside of the cream. Possibly even drizzle the top of the pastry with warm chocolate. Don't get me wrong though. It was still a solid B+ 

Good stuff! Would def come back!

excerpts: When you arrive, you basically have two choices to make: regular or "cookie crunch" shells, and vanilla, chocolate, or the week's special cream filling.
For the first choice, the main difference is texture; the cookie crunch is, well, crunchier than the regular.
But I found them both to be rather bland.
For the filling, I've tried the chocolate and the coffee (this week's special), and again I found them to be decent but rather bland.
chocolate.author: Adam B.
chocolate.review:
They do get points for originality and for freshness, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. When you arrive, you basically have two choices to make: regular or "cookie crunch" shells, and vanilla, chocolate, or the week's special cream filling. For the first choice, the main difference is texture; the cookie crunch is, well, crunchier than the regular. But I found them both to be rather bland. For the filling, I've tried the chocolate and the coffee (this week's special), and again I found them to be decent but rather bland.

During the busier of the two times I came here, they were stuffing the cream puffs to order. The quieter time, they had a small stockpile of each of the six combinations. I'm glad that they keep the options limited so that there is fast turnover, thus keeping their inventory fresh.

excerpts: I had the original with chocolate and the chocolate with the vanilla bean.
The chocolate with vanilla was far superior.
The original was bland and over filled.
The cream puff was leathery in texture but the inside was nice.
The leathery outside made you have to struggle for each bite which made the filling pour all over your hands.
They were also out of coffee on a Saturday afternoon.
What gives?
The price was reasonable but I can cross this off my list of things that I must try and put it on my not to repeat list.
chocolate.author: Tracy C.
chocolate.review:
I am not sure what all the fuss is about. I had the original with chocolate and the chocolate with the vanilla bean. The chocolate with vanilla was far superior. The original was bland and over filled. The cream puff was leathery in texture but the inside was nice. The leathery outside made you have to struggle for each bite which made the filling pour all over your hands. 
They were also out of coffee on a Saturday afternoon. What gives? The price was reasonable but I can cross this off my list of things that I must try and put it on my not to repeat list.

excerpts: Your own variants of the standard cream puff, chocolate and the seasonal flavors, simply cannot hold a candle to the classic vanilla masterpiece.
chocolate.author: Christopher K.
chocolate.review:
Oh Beard Papa, you crazy fisherman-looking mofo you.

What right do you have crafting such delectable pastries?  Who granted you the gift of creating such heavenly custards?  What trade ambassador brokered your safe passage on to our shores?  Some diabolical forces are surely at work.  Unregulated consumption of these cream puffs will surely undermine the very fabric of our society.

Beard Papa, my rugged purveyor of delicate treats, you only get four stars.  Your own variants of the standard cream puff, chocolate and the seasonal flavors, simply cannot hold a candle to the classic vanilla masterpiece.

chocolate.review:

I highly reccomend!!!

I dig the vanilla cuz there were speckles of vanilla beans in there

chocolate.review:
I think just maybe I'll have to give this place another try.

You should NEVER, and I mean NEVER leave cream puff shells out like they do for more then a couple hours.. It gets soft and doesn't have much taste to it..

I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, and green tea before.. I think if I had to choose my favorite, it would be the vanilla. I dig the vanilla cuz there were speckles of vanilla beans in there so you know it was made with real vanilla instead of the extract stuff..

Maybe it would be better if I tried it when they had just finished baking those shells..? 

They are pretty expensive for something so mediocre.. I think now it's like $2.25 per piece!?

excerpts: The chocolate cream puff is good, but not as good as the vanilla.
I've also tried the cheesecake sticks here, they are alright and also the chocolate molten cake which is very good!
chocolate.author: Marylouise R.
chocolate.review:
So yummy and sinful!  These little treats are so good when fresh!  I always go to the one near Yerba Buena because they are freshest when they come from here.  My favorite is the vanilla bean.  The chocolate cream puff is good, but not as good as the vanilla.  I've also tried the cheesecake sticks here, they are alright and also the chocolate molten cake which is very good!

This place is good on a hot afternoon.  This is the perfect light dessert!

They were pretty good
