chocolate.author: Nette A.
chocolate.review:
Beard Papa.......I like creme puffs for the most part its one of those things where i'll eat one and then don't really feel like eating anymore.

Anyhoo my Mom brought me over a box with Vanilla bean, Chocolate and Strawberry creme puffs. They were pretty good The pastry was very light and smooshy and the filling was pretty good. I think it could've used a little bit more powdered sugar. 

Either way  I think they are okay.. But for the price You can get a Cupcake from Karas and its wayyy  better!

excerpts: I also tried the chocolate which was good, but vanilla (the original) is the best flavor.
chocolate.author: Lolia S.
chocolate.review:
You know how some places are so good that you think about them all the time, but know that you shouldn't go all the time?  Beard Papa is one of those places.  In a perfect world, we could eat cream puffs every day.  In reality, no one should.

Beard Papa vanilla cream puffs represent cream puff perfection.  Oh, the double-layered shell is light, delicate and flaky.  You can taste the quality of the rich vanilla custard cream.  Piping in the cream keeps the shell crispy.  Beard Papa has cream puff making down.  The recipe is 200 years old and I imagine it has only gotten better and more consistent over time with the advances in cooking technology.   I know these puffs are not healthy, but they are fresh n' natural :-)

They have some seasonal flavors to keep things interesting.  I'd like to try pumpkin whenever that comes back.  I tried the green tea.  For some reason, that green tea cream was too runny.  I also tried the chocolate which was good, but vanilla (the original) is the best flavor.  

I love the Beard Papa mascot; he reminds me of Papa Smurf. Cute name too - very Japanese.  I loved the Beard Papa story: http://www.muginohousa.com/main.php?nav=the_beard_papas_story

It's cute how he smokes while he's baking.  He's never without his pipe.

Also, the puff doesn't keep well.  It gets soggy.  Eat it right after you purchase it.  This location is larger and better than the one inside the mall (Westfield Shopping Center).

excerpts: I gotta eat my words and add a star...the chocolate cream puffs are fucking TITS.
Not the ones dipped in chocolate, the regular ones with cocoa powder on top.
And Whole Foods brought their cream puffs back since my last diatribe.
All is right in the world.
chocolate.author: Frankie D.
chocolate.review:
After months of walking past this place and hearing all the hype, I finally got to try one of these bastards when my friend brought a couple of boxen to a party at my house.

Interesting.  I've always been a pate a choux connosseiur, cream puffs being one of the first things my mom's best friend (my real mom, as the three of us always joke) taught me how to bake.  This isn't quite pate a choux, but it's damn fine shellcrustdoughbatter. 

On the other hand, I had the vanilla bean filling, and while I love cream and I love vanilla flavor, I was summarily not impressed.  This was custard!  Way too thick and way too much of it.  I ate the crust and left a big glob of filling with no regrets.

So now I can say I've tried them and if I were stoned, I'd probably like them more, but I really prefer to saunter over to Whole Foods and pester their bakery people to bring their cream puffs back, as I am wont to do every few weeks.

Oh wait, I was stoned.

EDIT:  I gotta eat my words and add a star...the chocolate cream puffs are fucking TITS.  Not the ones dipped in chocolate, the regular ones with cocoa powder on top.  And Whole Foods brought their cream puffs back since my last diatribe.  All is right in the world.

excerpts: I went to the Bloomingdale's Beard Papa first--where they only sell vanilla, chocolate, and chocolate eclair flavors.
But I noticed this location on Mission was bigger and had specialty flavors
Stick with the vanilla or chocolate.
The chocolate eclairs are even messier.
chocolate.author: Cindy P.
chocolate.review:
A store that only sells cream puffs? I was intrigued. They must be super-amazing-orgasm good, right? Not really.

I went to the Bloomingdale's Beard Papa first--where they only sell vanilla, chocolate, and chocolate eclair flavors. But I noticed this location on Mission was bigger and had specialty flavors so I gave it a shot too.

They rotate the specialty flavors each week and the ones I can remember off the top of my head are pumpkin and green tea. Pumpkin flavor BTW was bleh. I'd rather have a pumpkin pie. Stick with the vanilla or chocolate.

As far as cream puffs go, I like that they are fresh but they are so big that eating them is a HUGE MESS. I guess this would be ok if you have that fetish where you like to be covered in food. I don't. The chocolate eclairs are even messier. I practically needed to take a shower after eating one of those.

In summary, good cream puffs but not good enough to crave. They're comparable to the frozen cream puffs that Trader Joe's sells.

excerpts: If you do keep it down, just know that they come chilled, and should either be shared, eaten on the spot in spite of a tummyache, or othewise don't get the chocolate, as it hella melts.
I don't care personally for the chocolate filling (and
if you've read my other reviews, that's pretty much what I write about)...
so get the vanilla with the brown stuff on the outside!
Beard Papa.
Such a weird name.
chocolate.author: Amelia P.
chocolate.review:
OK. I go to school across the street.
Lord help us, at school they're teaching industry pattern drafting for size zero, and across the street they're teaching how to eat a cream puff on your break, puke it up, and still fit into that zero! Any questions?

If you do keep it down, just know that they come chilled, and should either be shared, eaten on the spot in spite of a tummyache, or othewise don't get the chocolate, as it hella melts.
I don't care personally for the chocolate filling (and if you've read my other reviews, that's pretty much what I write about)...so get the vanilla with the brown stuff on the outside! 
Beard Papa. Such a weird name.

excerpts: A liquidy custard inside a puff pastry with a topping that tasted less like rich chocolate than it should have.
Worse, there was no whipped cream involved!
Vinyl forks unsuited to the task were the final disappointment.
chocolate.author: Lynn S.
chocolate.review: Why would anyone waste calories on this dessert?  I stopped by for a coffee and could not resist trying one of their treats.   What I got:  A liquidy custard inside a puff pastry with a topping that tasted less like rich chocolate than it should have.  Worse, there was no whipped cream involved!  Vinyl forks unsuited to the task were the final disappointment.

excerpts: They told me the chocolate one will be available after Memorial Day.
chocolate.author: Michael M.
chocolate.review:
A hidden little place near the Metreon.  I bought a half dozen vanilla, as other flavors are NOT AVAILABLE yet.  They told me the chocolate one will be available after Memorial Day.  Other flavors will include caramel, green tea, and some others.  Eclairs will be available soon too.

Anyway, they are a good size puff, and not too sweet.  I brought some to work only for my favorite women here.  Especially the one who will bring me my paycheck.  Gotta favor that one!  My roommate stole one from me in the middle of the night and was waiting as I exited the bathroom after my shower this morning.  Since I am the only one who knows where this place is, I have to bring them home more often ... yeah right.  

Anyway, enjoy them cold from the fridge.  They are maddeningly addicting, and very good!  Custard oozing out all over.  Great with a good strong cup of coffee!

excerpts: I only got to try the chocolate (probably bad form to take one of each from the box my coworkers passed around) but it was enough to convert me.
Forever.
chocolate.author: Deanna J.
chocolate.review:
Fluffy, decadent cream puffs. One of those things that I'll know that I'll be obsessing over and will head directly to the door of Beard Papa on my next trip to San Francisco. Unless they ship those bad boys out to other states. But I"m guessing not, due to the delicate nature of the cream puff. 

Good thing I don't actually live near one of these, because I could quickly foresee this becoming a daily ritual. The breakfast, lunch and dinner puff. 

I only got to try the chocolate (probably bad form to take one of each from the box my coworkers passed around) but it was enough to convert me. Forever. To a cream puff, Beard Papa obsessing person. 

I. Want. Another. Puff.

excerpts: Do Not Eat Chocolate Cream Puff...while Driving!
Not only was the chocolate cream everywhere...the taste sent me into a place lets...say for women...
its a happy place.
Forget sex in the city.....chocolate cream puffs are a sure thing, safer, cleaner and cheaper!!
chocolate.author: Kristina A.
chocolate.review:
WARNING! Do Not Eat Chocolate Cream Puff...while Driving!

Holy cow! I have never been a fan of the cream puff family but, I gotta say I just had to see what all the crazy 250++ reviews were about. 

I picked mine up and decided to eat while driving....bad idea! The first bite was consummed while driving on mission to 4th....and yikes!! Talk about a not so wise thing to do. Not only was the chocolate cream everywhere...the taste sent me into a place lets...say for women...its a happy place. (smiles)

Next time I will pick these up if my girlfriends needs a little pick me up. Forget sex in the city.....chocolate cream puffs are a sure thing, safer, cleaner and cheaper!!

excerpts: Oh well, maybe it needed some chocolate swirl in it to add flavor.
More puffs for everyone else.
I'll pass.
chocolate.author: imelda j.
chocolate.review:
The lines outside this place made me wonder what I was missing out.  Puffs, eh?

I went with my brother one day when we were hitting up a bunch of museums and galleries in the area one Saturday. I mentioned I wanted to try one of their puffs since it seems like everyone loves these things.

So we ordered a vanilla bean one and $2.25 later ... meh.  Am I missing something? Did I order the wrong flavor? Didn't do a damn thing for me.  I've had my fair share of cream puffs, but I really don't get what all the lines outside this place are for. Please tell me because I must be totally out of the loop.  I'd rather get some frozen one or buy some ice cream from Walgreens for $2.25.

Oh well, maybe it needed some chocolate swirl in it to add flavor.  More puffs for everyone else.  I'll pass.

excerpts: We came in for a half dozen puffs in chocolate and vanilla, half dozen petit-cro in chocolate, butter and cheese (think danish) and a cheesecake stick.
In Berkeley, you can get a half dozen at a flat price and it doesn't matter the shell or the filling but
NOTE here
you can't...
to get the cookie shell it costs more...
Also it costs more to get flavored petit-cro
but she still let us get 2 of each and gave us an extra cheesecake stick for free to make up for the weirdness of ordering...
We will be back every time we pass through here!
And it's true: there is no weird depression on the bottom or strange rubber consistency like the berk location has!
chocolate.author: J A M.
chocolate.review:
This is the best beard papa's in the bay area solely based on quality of the puffs and nothing else.
Its a tiny location and crowded with quite a wait but its worth it.
Watch out though cause you can easily spend $30 on a box of treats!
We came in for a half dozen puffs in chocolate and vanilla, half dozen petit-cro in chocolate, butter and cheese (think danish) and a cheesecake stick.
In Berkeley, you can get a half dozen at a flat price and it doesn't matter the shell or the filling but NOTE here you can't...to get the cookie shell it costs more...Also it costs more to get flavored petit-cro but she still let us get 2 of each and gave us an extra cheesecake stick for free to make up for the weirdness of ordering...
We will be back every time we pass through here!
And it's true: there is no weird depression on the bottom or strange rubber consistency like the berk location has!

excerpts: One of the best things to do on a summer afternoon - get thee some cream puffs (chocolate, vanilla and strawberry are the staples)
chocolate.author: Simika K.
chocolate.review:
I heard there are other locations but this is the only one I've been to, and i love it! It's always been busy whenever I've visited, so sometimes you have to wait in line for 5-10 minutes. But it's cheap, delicious and definitely worth the wait :) 

One of the best things to do on a summer afternoon - get thee some cream puffs (chocolate, vanilla and strawberry are the staples) and/or some of the other desserts there (mochis, cheesecake etc), and a cup of coffee, and then head across to Yuerba Buena gardens to relax and enjoy the sun!

excerpts: Just had the double chocolate (dark chocolate on top with chocolate filling. wonderful.
though the dark chocolate melts if you put your fingers on it)
chocolate.author: Sophia Y.
chocolate.review:
great cream puffs. Light and not deadly sweet. Just had the double chocolate (dark chocolate on top with chocolate filling. wonderful. though the dark chocolate melts if you put your fingers on it)

I went on a Tues at 3pm and there was no wait at all.

Clean bathroom. Friendly staff.

Thank gawd there is one here now (before had to go to NY or LA) but actually perhaps not so good b/c I will be gaining lots of weight!

Friday before closing, they ran out of eclairs in the afternoon. wah.

excerpts: And if you're in the mood for chocolate, get the double chocolate eclair, much better than just getting the plain chocolate puff.
In the span of 4 days, I've paid Papa 3 visits.
Chocolate cream puffs are now available, but the vanilla ones taste way better, and plus they're 20 cents cheaper.
chocolate.author: Connie C.
chocolate.review:
UPDATE 6/23/06: I tried the green tea cream puffs and they are SO GOOD! Tied with vanilla in my book. And if you're in the mood for chocolate, get the double chocolate eclair, much better than just getting the plain chocolate puff. In the span of 4 days, I've paid Papa 3 visits. I see him more than I see my own dad!

UPDATE 6/2/06: Chocolate cream puffs are now available, but the vanilla ones taste way better, and plus they're 20 cents cheaper.

I learned my lesson the first time I went here and had to walk away empty-handed because the wait was too long. This time, I called Beard Papa and asked them what their wait time was. 

"There's no one in line right now."

"What?! Ok, I'll be right there!" 

I hung up the phone and ran out of my office with my coworker, collecting money from others on the way. We practically ran over there, which was actually smart because when we got there, there was only 1 person in front of us. We placed our order and stepped aside. In seconds, 10 people had lined up behind us. When we got our yellow box of cream puffs, we brought them outside and proceeded to indulge in these heavenly puffs. We looked like 2 kids eating with powdered sugar all over our lips and chins. The puff was not warm, but I didn't mind the vanilla custard inside being chilled. It's probably not worth a wait longer than 10 minutes, but it's good enough that you can't just eat one in a sitting.

excerpts: I had the special of the week which was Caramel cream, and by recommendation from a worker, a chocolate eclaire, which I enjoyed alot more being a big fan of chocolate syrup that shells at room temperature.

Note: if you're consuming your cream puff on the go, esp on the way to work or a date, make sure you wear a bib and check the mirror after you're done eating-- you might want to wipe off that dollop of custard cream filling on your chin, unless, of course, this is your attempt at saving it as a snack for later.
chocolate.author: Marjorie B.
chocolate.review:
It's right next to St. Patricks, the old brick church... where you can go to pray for your soul after committing the heinous sin of gluttony at Beard Papa's.  I had a bit of an adventure finding the place. It's listed as on Yerba Buena Ln, so naturally I thought it would be somewhere around the Park.  Not.

The cream puffs go real well with any of their hot teas and coffees... which are also VERY good.  I had the special of the week which was Caramel cream, and by recommendation from a worker, a chocolate eclaire, which I enjoyed alot more being a big fan of chocolate syrup that shells at room temperature.  

Note: if you're consuming your cream puff on the go, esp on the way to work or a date, make sure you wear a bib and check the mirror after you're done eating-- you might want to wipe off that dollop of custard cream filling on your chin, unless, of course, this is your attempt at saving it as a snack for later.

excerpts: Fluffy as air pastry puffs filled with creamy chocolate or vanilla bean filling.
These babies are so soft could seriously shove a whole one your mouth
(it was a dare!).
Thank goodness these are located in downtown SF or else id be here everyday
The molten chocolate cake is scrumptious!
Best when heated so when you take a slice, the smooth chocolate flows out.
At around $3 each I'd suggest getting your own, after one bite you're not going to be sharing.
chocolate.author: Lola L.
chocolate.review:
For dessert we bough some these before heading to dinner. Fluffy as air pastry puffs filled with creamy chocolate or vanilla bean filling. These babies are so soft could seriously shove a whole one your mouth (it was a dare!). Thank goodness these are located in downtown SF or else id be here everyday
The molten chocolate cake is scrumptious! Best when heated so when you take a slice, the smooth chocolate flows out. At around $3 each I'd suggest getting your own, after one bite you're not going to be sharing.

Hasta La Vista, Baby!

chocolate.author: Yan M.
chocolate.review:
He is my papa, ok nvm my dad does not have a beard. Beard Papa's is papa of cream puffs, they were delectable! I stood in line yesterday and had to turn away since it was taking too long so I diligently returned today and there was no line at 7:30pm. No green tea or chocolate cream yet, it says Coming Soon....

Update: I've tried green tea, caramel, pumpkin, vanilla and chocolate. Will have to try strawberry and Milk tea to complete the quest! :)

excerpts: The choux pastry has no taste (at least not any that's discernible from the glob of sugary cream and powdered sugar - and chocolate if you got the "eclair").
chocolate.author: T C.
chocolate.review:
I don't see what the big deal is about these things.  I've had them a few times, and I just can't fathom why anybody would wait in some ridiculously long line for them.  I've had them here, at the one in the mall, and even in their home country of Japan outside of a train station in Tokyo (where there was also a short line for the freshies).  They smell damn good fresh, but that's about it.

It's a novel idea, and they're not horrible/inedible, but to me, it's the same as getting a tub of Cool hwhip (yeah, hwhip - hwhat's wrong hwhith that?), and taking a big ole spoonful or two and shoving that in your mouth.  The choux pastry has no taste (at least not any that's discernible from the glob of sugary cream and powdered sugar - and chocolate if you got the "eclair").  Maybe it's just me.  

Anyways, if you go to the one in the mall on a weekend afternoon, be prepared for a huge line.  Other times, it's quite manageable, if there's a line at all.

excerpts: Vanilla is my favorite; Chocolate and Green Tea come in second.
Beard Papa's Cream Puffs are probably the Best Commercial made that I have eatten.
I would indulge myself more if it wasn't so rich in calories and fat (about 220 each) I can tell you if you love Cream Puffs
- you need to try Beard Papa.
chocolate.author: David H.
chocolate.review:
Beard Papa is a chain operation originally from Osaka, Japan (BTW the original location in Osaka is Five Stars). They franchise their locations all over the world. 

Because it is a franchise some locations are better than others and some have more variety of flavors. Depending on how well capitalized the franchisee is the quality of the location, decor and freshnest of the Cream Puffs. In addition to the Osaka location I have been to the few in San Francisco and Los Angeles. This one in on Yerba Buena Lane is one the best out of the LA and San Francisco. 

The original flavor Vanilla is my favorite; Chocolate and Green Tea come in second. Beard Papa's Cream Puffs are probably the Best Commercial made that I have eatten. I would indulge myself more if it wasn't so rich in calories and fat (about 220 each) I can tell you if you love Cream Puffs - you need to try Beard Papa.

excerpts: I love the chocolate on the outside!
I have taken a bite out of others' chocolate filled ones and it is pretty good as well.
One of my friends loves getting the cocoa puff.
chocolate.author: Reese E.
chocolate.review: Whenever I come out of church praying, I can imagine heaven smelling like the outside! Ew gross! No, seriously it smells like fresh bakes cream puffs! Yum! Love them! I always get the eclaire cream puff. I love the chocolate on the outside! I always get vanilla cream, but the strawberry cream is my fav! I have taken a bite out of others' chocolate filled ones and it is pretty good as well. One of my friends loves getting the cocoa puff.

excerpts: I bought a few (chocolate, vanilla, and eclair with vanilla) and brought them in to work for my co-workers to sample.
I think the consensus was that the chocolate puff was the best of the three, perhaps because the puff itself tasted most fresh, sort of eggy like a popover.
Yum.
chocolate.author: Cassidy P.
chocolate.review: Okay, so I have to admit I have absolutely nothing to compare to my B. Puffy experience--really not a lot of fried foods where I grew up.  I bought a few (chocolate, vanilla, and eclair with vanilla) and brought them in to work for my co-workers to sample.  I think the consensus was that the chocolate puff was the best of the three, perhaps because the puff itself tasted most fresh, sort of eggy like a popover.  Yum.

excerpts: I love Beard Papa's cream puffs - green tea, vanilla, and chocolate being my top favorites.
Another is the Fondant Au Chocolate - though delicious - was also not as delicious as it could have been.
chocolate.author: Nina M.
chocolate.review:
I don't know what to say that would be different than anyone else.

Beard Papa originated from Osaka, Japan in 1999 that expanded internationally because of its popularity.

I love Beard Papa's cream puffs - green tea, vanilla, and chocolate being my top favorites.  

I would rate it 5, except I'm not a huge fan of its other products.  The cheesecake is adorable and good to eat, but not as great as the cream puff.  Another is the Fondant Au Chocolate - though delicious - was also not as delicious as it could have been.

excerpts: I didn't like the chocolate cream though because it tasted powdery to me.
Maybe it was just a bad batch?
chocolate.author: Jonas T.
chocolate.review:
Well, this is definitely the best cream puff I've ever had. The flavor of the weeks are also delicious - not to sweet, just right. I didn't like the chocolate cream though because it tasted powdery to me. Maybe it was just a bad batch? The cheese cake stick was just a regular cheesecake, but not as sweet.

JONASAPPROVED!

excerpts: Back to Beard Papa, I tried the chocolate and the vanilla.
I wasn't too impressed and for the life of me couldn't figure out how this place gets so busy.
The filling is bland of reminds of refined pudding.
In fact the people in the back were probably whipping up a fresh batch of Jell-O when they saw the line start to get long.
chocolate.author: Bill P.
chocolate.review:
Really what is the big deal about this place.  I had more than one friend tell me I HAVE to try these cream puffs.  So I go what's so special about a cream puff?  I had them before, wasn't too impressed.  My friend goes, "no you really HAVE to try these, it's so much better."

The last time someone told me that in those precise words happened to be when Krispy Kreme was the rave circa 2002 or somewhere around there.  At that time, this person swore up and down it was unlike any other doughnut I'd ever had.  I tried the Krispy Kreme, was none too impressed and went on my merry way.  Krispy Kreme today is eating crow and closing down shops, too big too quick.

Back to Beard Papa, I tried the chocolate and the vanilla.  I wasn't too impressed and for the life of me couldn't figure out how this place gets so busy.  The filling is bland of reminds of refined pudding.  In fact the people in the back were probably whipping up a fresh batch of Jell-O when they saw the line start to get long.  I didn't finish mine and chastised myself for wasting my calories on something I didn't care for.  

Is this like a Krispy Kreme trend of old?  I wouldn't be surprised to see old Beard ride his ship on out of here in a few years once people get cream puff fatigue.

excerpts: So I settled with the brownie looking cake with chocolate icing in the middle.
I had asked them to warm it for me so that when i get to it it'll still be warm.
So after my meal and chompin on some onions from the sandwich I knew that this would be a great compliment to change may pallette.
After about 20 minutes it was still warma dn the filling was also still pretty wam.
I bite into it and immediately I remember the chocolate icing on the Goldilocks's cakes.
So I guess that was the best part, but I definitely think that if they were a bit cheaper it would be most coveted.
SO 3 stars for me
chocolate.author: Justin G.
chocolate.review:
Ok so after seeing this multiple times I finally decided to give it a shot. I guess for mainly just making creme puffs they are pretty succesful. So after my sandwich that I grabbed down the street from A.G Ferrari's I decided to pick up some dessert for my sweet tooth. 

I took a look at the different things they had in the menu and I wasn't really feeling their creme puffs. So I settled with the brownie looking cake with chocolate icing in the middle. I had asked them to warm it for me so that when i get to it it'll still be warm. So after my meal and chompin on some onions from the sandwich I knew that this would be a great compliment to change may pallette. After about 20 minutes it was still warma dn the filling was also still pretty wam. I bite into it and immediately I remember the chocolate icing on the Goldilocks's cakes. So I guess that was the best part, but I definitely think that if they were a bit cheaper it would be most coveted.  SO 3 stars for me

excerpts: I ran in and bought a 12 pack that contained the Vanilla, Chocolate, and Milk Tea flavors.
chocolate.author: Brian L.
chocolate.review:
So I was at a house warming party in So. Cal this weekend and someone brought some Beard Papa's Cream Puffs.  I remember reading a review or two about them on Yelp and thought, "Hey, cool!  I can actually try one now."  2 bites later, the thing was completely devoured and I was hunting for more.  This is what a crack fiend must feel like.

Later on that night, I went to an event at the Hollywood Bowl.  On my way there, I passed by the Kodak Theatre shopping area where low and behold, they had a Beard Papa's store!  I ran in and bought a 12 pack that contained the Vanilla, Chocolate, and Milk Tea flavors.

Now let me pause here for a moment.  When it comes to traveling and the extra security measures, I'm pretty patient, figuring that the important thing is that I arrive safely at my destination.  I need to get to the airport early?  No problem.  Need me to practically strip down to nothing at the security gate?  No problem.  Can't carry on anything that is even remotely liquid like?  No problem...that is, until I can't bring a box full of Beard Papa's cream puffs just because of the delicious and creamy filling!!!  NOW YOU TERRORISTS HAVE GONE TO @$%@#e%!#$%  !#$%!q-ING FAR!!!

Luckily, when I went to write this review, I now see that there is a store in SF!  

Score:  Dessert loving fiends: 1, Terrorists: 0

excerpts: I like all of them except the chocolate one.
It tasted funny to me.
chocolate.review:
I walked by one day and noticed the bright yellow writing on the glass in front. I waited anxiously for opening day to come. Opening day was crazy!!! The line was out the door and down the block. They were handing out samples. I wasn't about to wait in line for that long and decided to come back when things died down a bit. 

They had a promotion going on that first week. Buy 20 cream puffs and get a free thermos. I asked about the thermos and they ran out. I was a lil' disappointed so the guy gave my girlfriend and I a charm for our cell phone. That was nice of him to do that.  

When I tasted that first puff.....oh my!!!! It was sooooo good. It wasn't too sweet. It was perfect!!!! I went back each week to taste all the other flavors. Their flavored cream puffs are "Rotating on a weekly basis". I like all of them except the chocolate one. It tasted funny to me. My favorite is green tea and milk tea. The milk tea puff is available in San Francisco only. The coffee one is available in Redwood City only. 

They have cheesecake sticks for $1.25. It was good but not as good as a regular cheesecake. 

The Fondant Au Chocolat ($2.25) is mouthwatering!!! It's not too sweet either. 

The eclairs cost a little bit more than the cream puffs. I'm not very fond of them. To me, they look exactly like a cream puff except the puff part of the eclair is more dry. And the taste is.....bleh.  This may be only me though.

They had really long lines during the day time and after work for about 6 months. After that, you can just walk in any time of day and wait in line for a few minutes. 

On their website you can see the flavors of the week for San Francisco. I've included a link below.

http://www.beardpapasf.com/flavors_sf.htm 

Go get your puff on!!!!!

EDIT 8/8/07: Just went in and saw they have gotten rid of the milk tea flavor cream puff and replaced it with tiramisu. NOOOO!!!! I really liked the milk tea one. *sob*

excerpts: Such creamy and sweet chocolate and vanilla oozing out the end, leaking across my fingers.
I tossed down 2.5 right on the premises, shared the other .5 with my partner, then took the last 3 to the movie.
chocolate.author: Justin W.
chocolate.review:
I hate movie ads. Despise them. Want to throw things at the screen when I see them. But this ONE time, I'm actually glad I was paying attention. I saw cream puffs, heavenly, fluffy cream puffs. I ran outside, across the street, and found Beard Papa's. Closed. Bastards. I stood with my fingers pressed against the glass, watching the "making of" video as they stepped through the long and difficult process of making the cream puffs and filling.

And last weekend, ahhhhhhh. Finally. Well worth the wait. I got 6, expecting to space them out over the next few days. Not a chance. Such fluffy, crispy pastry. Such creamy and sweet chocolate and vanilla oozing out the end, leaking across my fingers. I tossed down 2.5 right on the premises, shared the other .5 with my partner, then took the last 3 to the movie. Within 5 minutes of the film, I was picking crispy little crumbs from the bottom of the box and licking the paper in which they were wrapped.

I want more. But I mustn't. These things are dangerous.

excerpts: I love love the vanilla and chocolate.
chocolate.author: Jacqueline D.
chocolate.review:
It's near the church i use to go to!

I absolutely love Beard Papas.  We order a dozen :]  i know quite the fatty! I love love the vanilla and chocolate.  We ordered the strawberry filled one, but personally I thought it was alright.  I'll stick to the original and simple flavors of vanilla & choco.  We also got a cookie topping puff instead of the originally breading?  so it had pieces of cookies crumbles on it! I recommend that if you're a cookie maniac.

i been here recently & was surprised that it wasn't quite busy as before..maybe it was the time of day? or maybe every ones going to the one on market now, you know in SF shopping center (do they still call it that?).

chocolate.author: Kingpin X.
chocolate.review:

But you can tell why they are good... no indulgence is spared on the ingredients here... they are like an American cannoli... laced with thick chocolate, oozing with not-too-sweet custard, and flaking with crispy puff pastry. Soooo goood.

excerpts: I'm partial to simple flavors like vanilla and chocolate.
I wish they'd make a chai flavor, would be so good!
chocolate.author: Bhumika K.
chocolate.review:
HOLLLLLLLER to the cream puff gods.  

This place is really great.  I've taken every person who visited me to Beard Papa's - and each person has totally loved this place. 

I'm partial to simple flavors like vanilla and chocolate.  I wish they'd make a chai flavor, would be so good!

excerpts: I got a chocolate cream puff at Beard Papa's &
the filling was so disappointing...
it was like drippy chocolate cake batter.
Which I ate every last bit of.
But ew.
chocolate.author: Holly F.
chocolate.review:
I don't get it.

I'm no stranger to the cream puff...I used to get one every year at the Del Mar Fair, from a rickety cream puff stand.  But they were bigger, & the pastry tasted better, & they had both custard & whipped cream....

I got a chocolate cream puff at Beard Papa's & the filling was so disappointing...it was like drippy chocolate cake batter.  Which I ate every last bit of.  But ew.

excerpts: so we ended up with 1 chocolate, 1 strawberry, and 2 vanillas.
chocolate.author: Kim N.
chocolate.review:
I knew this stuff was good when my boyfriend and I were fighting over who would get the last bite. I even went as far as to suck some of the vanilla cream out of the puff before I passed it over to him.

I told him to buy a dozen cream puffs...but nooooo! He thought we wouldn't be able to finish it all so we ended up with 1 chocolate, 1 strawberry, and 2 vanillas. We split a vanilla  when we got back to the car because we didn't want to eat too much before having dinner at House of Prime Rib and I wanted to enjoy my meat. 

The first bite was luscious! It was crispy on the outside and smooth and creamy on the inside. It wasn't too sweet--just the way I liked it. Unfortunately, I did inhale some of that powdered sugar. I wanted to save the cream puffs for the next day, but my boyfriend peer pressured me into eating them all with him. 

Now, 5 days later, he is still talking about those blasted cream puffs. He laments that he didn't get the dozen that I originally wanted. I can't even sleep at night anymore because he wakes me up and whispers "Beard Papa's" in my ear. Darn you Beard Papa's--you and your puffy, creamy, heavenly goodness.

Minus 1 star for being not hot and fresh out of the oven like I expected.

excerpts: Chocolate and tiramisu are not all that.
I felt that they were bland.
chocolate.author: becky s.
chocolate.review:
If it wasn't for Beard Papa's I would never ever go to that boring ass mall. The line here doesn't get horribly long b/c the workers are very efficient at this location. They got this place set up like an assembly line but then again how hard is it to fill cream puffs with the right flavor?

My favorites are the vanilla and pumpkin flavored cream puffs. Chocolate and tiramisu are not all that. I felt that they were bland. The cheesecake sticks are not that great either. They were kinda dry and the taste was off somehow.

I'm not giving Beard Papa's 5 stars because they never have green tea cream puffs when I am there. People complain that they don't like the pudding texture of the cream but I like it just fine. I think that it tastes healthier and not as sweet as most cream puffs. The pudding recipe is actually common in Japan. I had similar cream puffs when I went to Sunshine City. 

Beard Papa is creepy.

excerpts: EDIT: I have since tried the chocolate and strawberry creampuffs and the eclair.
The eclair is just a vanilla creampuff topped with a shell of chocolate, served cold.
The eclair is just a vanilla creampuff topped with a shell of chocolate, served cold.
Not the best eclair I've had, but a tasty when graded as a creampuff.
The chocolate creampuff was magic.
The strawberry was kind of a drag actually.
I mean I finished it and all, but it tasted not really of strawberries and the filling seemed thinner, more watery than the others .
chocolate.author: Jeremy W.
chocolate.review:
Pulled the pins on this truly whimsical Japanese import tonight and didn't have to wait long. About 6:15/6:20 on a Tuesday night. So it seems like everybody waiting 1/2 hr + for these just needs to plan a visit during off-peak hours. I had a vanilla and a green tea (the flavor of the week) puff less than 5 minutes from when I entered the shop. Both scrumptious. Pick one thing (in this case, the titular creampuffs) and do it properly. 

Five dreamy stars.

EDIT: I have since tried the chocolate and strawberry creampuffs and the eclair. The eclair is just a vanilla creampuff topped with a shell of chocolate, served cold. Not the best eclair I've had, but a tasty when graded as a creampuff. The chocolate creampuff was magic. The strawberry was kind of a drag actually. I mean I finished it and all, but it tasted not really of strawberries and the filling seemed thinner, more watery than the others .

excerpts: I liked the vanilla better than the chocolate.
That's my opinion.
chocolate.author: Adam L.
chocolate.review:
One Word, Legit.

Thanks to our intern who we sent down to get them. You're the man LEE.

I liked the vanilla better than the chocolate.  That's my opinion.  I have heard good things about the Strawberry though.

excerpts: I was however disappointed with the chocolate cake.
Stick with the cream puffs, its what they do best.
chocolate.author: Mathew J.

chocolate.author: s r.
chocolate.review:
I can't believe I'm giving a cream puff shop a 5 star rating, but I am.  I've always loved the cream puff, and have been disappointed by a few over the years.  It's an easy pastry to make at home, and they freeze really well, so once you make a few dozen you can have them on demand right out of your own freezer.  However, after having the vanilla cream puff at Beard Papa, I have since retired from cream puff making.  

Yes, the Beard Papa cream puff beats mine, hands down.  It's ambrosia, really...always fresh, perfectly creamylicious filling, and light, poofy pastry, sprinkled with just the right amount of powdered sugar. It's a little ball of cream puff heaven.  

I don't feel the same way about the chocolate cream puff as I do the vanilla, but I'm not a chocoholic, either.  If they have other flavors I haven't noticed them...I'm too fixated on the vanilla one.  I see nothing else.  I suggest you get one to go, then leave quickly before you finish eating it.  Otherwise, you might go back in to get a dozen or more to take home.  

Beard Papa actually makes me glad that I live in Berkeley....a safe distance, and BART ride, away from their euphoric creamy deliciousness.

chocolate.author: Erin O.
chocolate.review:
It's all about the puff here.  No trappings, no nothing.  I mean, it's clean, nothing really wrong, but go in, order, and walk away before you try and buy more.  

These are lovely. I've always enjoyed a good cream puff, not the Chinese weird overly fatty, super sweet, no soul puffs.  I love a Japanese cream puff.  Now note:  for those not of the Asian persuasion, this probably seems weird. I mean, aren't your people lactose intollerant?  Maybe, but we love the French baking, and some things we have elevated to a new level.  White bread for toast, and cream puffs are two of them.  The French have nothing on these.

I got to have a vanilla bean (my favorite thus far), chocolate, and caramel puff.  The chocolate is good, but I'm not a chocolate person.  A touch pudding-like in the middle even.  The caramel was sweet, rich, and buttery in flavor.  The vanilla bean was very vanilla, light, sweet, but not cloyingly so, and just lovely.  The pastry itself was perfectly cooked, and they make them to order in front of you. How cool is that?  They never sit and get soggy.

That's the mark of a good puff, and I'll do it again.  I think the green tea is definitely on the list to try sooner than later.

excerpts: The chocolate cream puffs, however, look as though someone dumped an ashtray on top of them, and the cocoa is hardly at par with lowly brands such as Hersheys.

chocolate.review:
The vanilla cream puffs will enter the hall of pastry fame.  If you try just one of the puffs, vanilla is the port of entry for you.  Few establishments can make divinity out of vanilla, but this bakery has done it.

The chocolate cream puffs, however, look as though someone dumped an ashtray on top of them, and the cocoa is hardly at par with lowly brands such as Hersheys.   The chocolate eclairs should be removed from the menu as well.  

Beard Papa also offers weekly specials, and it is important to do your own taste test once per week.  The special green tea cream puffs sent me on a culinary high which lasted a few hours!   I must now wait another five weeks or so for their return.   :D

chocolate.author: Sarah L.
chocolate.review:
Uh, yeah, these are heaven.  For real.

My co-worker and I got a Daily Candy email one day that notified us to the cream puff bakery just two blocks (dangerous) from our place of employment.  Before lunch, we headed over and ordered the vanilla cream puff (other flavors are not currently available).  We waited a few minutes as a fresh batch of puffs came out of the oven and watched in amazement as the baker inserted the vanilla cream into the pastry.  A woman then gave the puffs a dusting of powdered sugar and handed the treats to us.

As we sat down on a sunny bench right outside, we looked at each other and exclaimed our excitement.  We both admitted, however, that we thought we didn't like cream puffs or couldn't remember having or wanting one before.  Even with this prejudice, the anticipation from the Daily Candy blurb and all of the happy customers in the surrounding area made us eager to stuff our faces.  Which we did.

Oh, that first bite!  The warm buttery outer layers of pastry hit my tongue and were immediately followed by the cold cream custard filling.  We exclaimed many superlatives as we ate the puffs in a 2 minute span that felt like time had stopped.  "Look, I can see pieces of vanilla bean!" my co-worker stated with glee.  "It's like a vanilla cloud in my mouth!" I replied.

We walked back to the office unable to gripe about the day's awful start and instead talked about the greatness of the puff.  The hope and excitement for two weeks to pass until we could come back when they introduce chocolate.  Oh yes, it made our day.  Thank you, papa beard.  Thank you.

I was hesitant when a friend first gushed to me about this place. I was all - dude, a cream puff is a cream puff. There's no way you're getting me to pay that much for a dinky little pastry with some vanilla cream in the middle.

But, I've been put in my place. A cream puff is certainly not a cream puff. Beard Papa's is on a plane all its own. They are not dinky or little. And its not just vanilla, you can go crazy with chocolate, strawberry, or one of the seasonal flavors.

The only thing that bothers me is the name. Shouldn't it be "BeardED Papa's"? I know they're Japanese cream puffs but the name is in English. Proof read people.

Also, they opened a location at the new mall in the food court where the lines aren't nearly as bad. Pick up a box when you're out shopping. Your family/ roommates will love you for it.

chocolate.author: Sooj O.
chocolate.review:
Just adding to the chorus here.

After a pot-luck lunch with some work friends (pork ribs, shrimp patties, meatloaf, stuffing, lentils with sausage), we decided the appropriate ending was a green tea cream puff from Beard Papa.  Besides, the few blocks of walking would aid our digestion.

It's wonderful: some light choux pastry with cream, all dusted over with some green tea powder sugar.  And it's a joy to watch the puff pastry move down the short assembly line, anticipating the puff pastry that will land in my grubby clutching hand.

Here's an anomaly: the green tea cream puff is perfect with strong coffee.

So, my favorites would be:
vanilla
green tea
double chocolate

Stay away from Milk Tea.  It's floury.

And there's even more good food for me later in the day.  Yelp Korean Chicken Night!  Yay, gluttony!

I don't understand why all these Yelpers are writing about Beard Papa's other deserts. Obviously they are famous for their cream puffs and eclairs... so why would you go there and have anything else? Its like going to Italy and only eating Chinese food, it just doesn't make sense.

Their cream puffs are pretty good. I tried the Yerba Buena location first. But once Beard Papa's came to the mall I decided that they would be my treat to myself every time I made it through a long day of shopping (sometimes I end up buying two then going home and trying on my clothes again and not fitting into them, I suspect, because I had two).

Get the Vanilla Bean. I have tried the Pumpkin, Chocolate and Green Tea (all good) but hands down the Vanilla Bean is the BEST. They are super good on a hot day, or a cold winter day with a cup of coffee. 

I would give them 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't operate that way so I am erring on the side of generosity and giving them four stars. Stick to the cream puffs (specifically the vanilla ones).

-----------------------------------------------------------------
So I changed my mind, despite being good I have demoted them to three stars until the can prove to me that they really want that fourth.

And the custard wasn't overly sweet.
chocolate.author: Ruiqiu K.
chocolate.review:
Taste:  4
Addictability:  5
After-you-eat-them regret factor:  2
Miles to run to burn the calories:  5

I'm so glad my office is too much of a walk to eat here every day.

I once bought 2, intending for the 2nd to go to a coworker.  I ate them both before I got back to the office.  The tell-tale "cocaine powder" residue on my lips (and on my black jacket) was a dead giveaway that I wasn't sharing again.

To paraphrase a few reviewers' opinions, this is the poor man's kitschy  Hello Kitty version of profiteroles filled with ice cream.  But oh so good.  I prefer the vanilla over the chocolate (and I'm a chocolate person).  The puffs were flaky.  And the custard was cold enough that I didn't believe that it wasn't ice cream at first.  And the custard wasn't overly sweet.  Just sweet enough to pop them (and those that were supposed to go to your coworkers) in your mouth.

Great place to go on your cheat days.

excerpts: My friend and I split one chocolate and one vanilla.
The chocolate tasted like it was filled with Jello pudding, but the vanilla one was good.
The puff itself was kinda bland, almost flavorless.
It was light though
and I didn't feel overly stuffed or ill after eating it.
I can't understand how people can eat more than one of these though.
chocolate.author: Rebecca H.
chocolate.review:
I was recently ditching work with my friend and we were spending a day going to the museum. On the way home we passed Beard Papa, and the long line pouring out the door. Since I was already being bad, I figured waiting for 20 minutes and splurging on a fatty, rich treat would be a great way to cap off the day. 

I was surprised that the puffs were not at all heavy. My friend and I split one chocolate and one vanilla. The chocolate tasted like it was filled with Jello pudding, but the vanilla one was good. The puff itself was kinda bland, almost flavorless. It was light though and I didn't feel overly stuffed or ill after eating it. I can't understand how people can eat more than one of these though. I think I would die from a diabetic coma from the inside if I ate one more. 

All said, it wasn't bad, but not really worth the hype. Maybe if I want a sweet, but light snack I'll come back, but only if I don't have to wait 20 minutes in the freezing cold to get one.

excerpts: I had the chocolate and the vanilla, and i CANNOT wait to try the green tea and the cheesecake sticks, and whatever other goodies they have.
chocolate.author: Janet R.
chocolate.review:
I LOVE cream puffs.  I used to love when I went to my mom's house and she had the big tubs of the one from Costco, I would sit there and eat them until i felt like puking.  Then half an hour later, I wanted more.
WIth Beard Papas, I LOVE them, and I think I kept eating them until I passed out from sugar overload.  I had the chocolate and the vanilla, and i CANNOT wait to try the green tea and the cheesecake sticks, and whatever other goodies they have.

excerpts: Best Chocolate Eclair (with Vanilla filling)
I've ever eaten.
However, that's if you wait 5-10 minutes for it to "thaw" out a little.
I got it a little cold, didn't get it fresh from the oven.
Despite that, the eclair was delicious!
They offer  3 types of cream filling (green tea, vanilla, chocolate) in the puffs or eclairs.
I only realized this when the cashier asked.
Other desserts they offer are cheesecake sticks-if you're on the go and don't want cream filling dripping all over, and chocolate au fondant.
I wish they had some iced mocha-chocolate frappes to go down with my eclairs...
chocolate.author: Aileen A.
chocolate.review:
Best Chocolate Eclair (with Vanilla filling) I've ever eaten. However, that's if you wait 5-10 minutes for it to "thaw" out a little. I got it a little cold, didn't get it fresh from the oven. They should seriously consider changing the fridge temperature or think about making less puffs so that there's not a lot of excess to chill up. 

Despite that, the eclair was delicious!

Cream puffs were just okay, puff too crunchy (tasted like crackers for a sec)-not flakey like most-but super generous with the filling.

They offer  3 types of cream filling (green tea, vanilla, chocolate) in the puffs or eclairs. I only realized this when the cashier asked. I'm not sure I saw these choices on the menu.

Other desserts they offer are cheesecake sticks-if you're on the go and don't want cream filling dripping all over, and chocolate au fondant. Other locations offer mango ice shower, mochi, and Mont Blanc. 

For beverages: tea, coffee, vitamin water (no formula fiddy though!), etc. I wish they had some iced mocha-chocolate frappes to go down with my eclairs...

Not worth the travel, but worth the two block walk if you happen to be around the neighborhood...

excerpts: I'm definitely going back to try the chocolate and their weekly specials.
OOOOhHHH.. they also have chocolate fondant cake too, but it's still under "coming soon.
Can't wait!
chocolate.author: Denise L.
chocolate.review:
Every time I'm in NYC, Beard Papa's is always WAY too crowded. Now I understand why! These cream puffs are DELICIOUS!!! As I was heading towards Union square for some shopping, I walked right past the shop and noticed that the line wasn't long at all! I immediately walked in and stood in a line that lasted maybe 2 minutes. As I was waiting, the aroma of buttery puff pastry put me in a trance dreaming about my first bite. I decided to go with the vanilla bean cream puff. The pastry was so crispy on the outside and perfectly soft in the inside. So light and good. The vanilla cream was yummy, not to creamy and more custard like. I'm not a huge fan of cream puffs, but these were heavenly. 

I'm definitely going back to try the chocolate and their weekly specials. Hopefully the next time I'm there, I can try the pumpkin and green tea! YUM! OOOOhHHH.. they also have chocolate fondant cake too, but it's still under "coming soon." Can't wait!

excerpts: But if you commute to the city, and want to bring something back for your friends/family, stop by Bread Papa's and get half a dozen vanilla and half a dozen chocolate puffs, and your friends and family will worship you.
chocolate.author: Evan K.
chocolate.review:
This place makes some seriously good cream puffs.

The line is always really long, so I normally don't stop by Bead Papa's if I just want some for myself.  But if you commute to the city, and want to bring something back for your friends/family, stop by Bread Papa's and get half a dozen vanilla and half a dozen chocolate puffs, and your friends and family will worship you.

excerpts: And then the creme in the diff flavors - I tried vanilla and chocolate
- were delicious altho I liked the chocolate more.
chocolate.author: Jim C.
chocolate.review:
I finally succumbed to trying these flaky puffs of pleasure that everyone's been talking about... and the only disappointment was that I could not try all the flavors on my one visit.

Enough has been said about them so won't elaborate. The puffs pastries themselves were surprisingly light, flaky and perfectly balanced between crisp and crewy. And then the creme in the diff flavors - I tried vanilla and chocolate - were delicious altho I liked the chocolate more. I have to try the other flavors like green tea next time.

Bottom line: I'm a fan. Lucky I don't live near this place - otherwise I'd be 300 pounds easily.

excerpts: The chocolate isn't as luscious.
I tried the warm chocolate cake.
It's a small little cake that they heat up in the microwave.
It's very reminiscent of Mrs. Fields' Cookies, but in cake form.
Super good
chocolate.author: Michael H.
chocolate.review:
Yeah they're good.

Only get the vanilla cream filled puffs.  They have the most pronounced flavor.  The vanilla works well because it has a lot of vanilla beans put into it.  The chocolate isn't as luscious.  I heard the green tea isn't good either.

I'm always apprehensive when buying one.  Because I know that once i finish a single cream puff, it will most likely lead to another one.  Not as jaw dropping as I thought it would be, but oh so satisfying.  The hype is partly correct.

I tried the warm chocolate cake.  It's a small little cake that they heat up in the microwave.  It's very reminiscent of Mrs. Fields' Cookies, but in cake form.  Super good but I bet it's super crazy in terms of nutrition facts.

(They used to show a video of how they make the cream puffs.  A lot of milk, butter, and all the good things that make your pig blush.  They don't show it anymore because I think they realized that it's anti-marketing for the healthies.)

excerpts: CHOCOLATE IS HERE, AND IT'S DELICIOUS!!
chocolate.author: Joe R.
chocolate.review:
Someone told me they're better than Krispy Kremes. They were right. Only problem is the only flavor right now is vanilla. But still so good that they get 5 stars...

UPDATE:

CHOCOLATE IS HERE, AND IT'S DELICIOUS!!

excerpts: On top of that, you can add fruit and chocolate to the puff.
chocolate.author: Bernie L.
chocolate.review:
Okay, I FINALLY tried it after a couple thwarted attempts and much much harrassment from Beard Papa disciples and... well, I've had better.

While I was in NYC, I had probably the best cream puff I've ever had at Puff & Pao (http://www.yelp.com/biz/XNrCuH77b37jf5X4R41xQA?hrid=D8XScfesrcFL3GCw2NJUNg). The puff was not too crusty and not too light, but just light enough and crusty enough - it's hard to describe, but it was just right. the custard was rich and smooth and not too sweet. On top of that, you can add fruit and chocolate to the puff. I'm drooling as I type at the thought of one.

Unfortunately Beard Papa doesn't come close to my Puff & Pao experience. I felt the puff was a bit too crusty for me, and it was a little too delicate and didn't have any structure to it. Also, it might have just been the 3 times I've been, but I found that the cream/custard filling was a bit grainy. I know that for some, this is what they expect from a cream puff, but it ain't me. I admit that it is very very tasty, but how can something that's main ingredients are sugar, flour, cream and butter NOT taste great?

I'll go there again, and possibly often, but that won't make me think they're the shit or that they're reasonably priced. they're like the microsoft of SFcream puffs.

excerpts: Only tried the vanilla cream puffs because they ran out of the chocolate right when I got their.
chocolate.author: Ericka A.
chocolate.review:
Sure, I'll turn fat over these!

Best way to pack on 20 and enjoy every bite of it!

Came here during a recent lunch break say around 1:00 pm on a Tuesday and damn there was still a line out the door.

Only tried the vanilla cream puffs because they ran out of the chocolate right when I got their. 

I'll be back!

excerpts: But the basic ones are vanilla bean and chocolate.
chocolate.author: Judi K.
chocolate.review:
This is the place to come to if you want to have different fillings.... 
Like green tea, thai ice tea.. strawberry.. 
But the basic ones are vanilla bean and chocolate. 

YUMMY!! My best bribe dessert. 

There's also one in the mall that's open later.

excerpts: The second one was a chocolate creme filled cookie crumb puff.
It was a little sweeter than the first but just as delicious.
The puffs are a little more expensive than I thought they would be, but considering that they are rather big (about the size of your palm), they are worth the money.
Definitely a must try.
chocolate.author: Jan Z.
chocolate.review:
After a day at the MOMA, I decided to stop in by to see what all the hub-bub is all about. 
So, I bought 2 flavors. The first one was a regular cream puff with Vanilla cream. It was more like vanilla custard, and it's not too sweet. The puff itself was so flakey, it left crumbs all over my shirt. Yeah, I didn't care if anyone saw me pick those crumbs back up and put them in my mouth. At $2.25 a puff, you would be too!
The second one was a chocolate creme filled cookie crumb puff. It was a little sweeter than the first but just as delicious. 
The puffs are a little more expensive than I thought they would be, but considering that they are rather big (about the size of your palm), they are worth the money. Definitely a must try.

excerpts: But in a few weeks they'll have chocolate, green tea, caramel and strawberry cream puffs and a few other pastries.
I'll definitely be coming back to try the other flavors and this might also replace birthday cakes for a few people.
****Ok, so I had the chocolate cream puff last week and it was...disappointing.
It was good as desserts go but in comparison to the vanilla cream puff?
Not good.
The chocolate filling was gritty and the batch of cream puffs that mine was from were very misshapen and, in my opinion, should not have been used and just tossed.
Aren't choux supposed to be a roundish shape?
The one I had was lumpy.
Maybe I should try another 2 to see if it has improved but for now the vanilla was hands down much better.
I've now also had the green tea flavored puff.
Let's just say that's going to be the only time I try it.
The thing about green tea is that it's fairly subtle flavor.
The custard was so rich that I didn't really detect the green tea until after I was finished.
Which if you didn't know what you were eating you would just think that the taste was off.
Also?
The green powdered sugar that was dusted on top was a turn off.
It was not an appetizing color.
chocolate.author: cyndi L.
chocolate.review:
After finding out about their opening this past weekend, I took a stroll over. Why the heck not? It's just a half block away. Which is a bad, bad thing.

These cream puffs are fantastic! The vanilla bean custard is not too sweet and the texture is just heavenly. The choux is nicely crispy on the outside. I love that these are made to order. 

There's not much of a selection right now. Just vanilla cream puffs. But in a few weeks they'll have chocolate, green tea, caramel and strawberry cream puffs and a few other pastries. 

I'll definitely be coming back to try the other flavors and this might also replace birthday cakes for a few people.

****Ok, so I had the chocolate cream puff last week and it was...disappointing. It was good as desserts go but in comparison to the vanilla cream puff? Not good. The chocolate filling was gritty and the batch of cream puffs that mine was from were very misshapen and, in my opinion, should not have been used and just tossed. Aren't choux supposed to be a roundish shape? The one I had was lumpy. Maybe I should try another 2 to see if it has improved but for now the vanilla was hands down much better.

*****I've now also had the green tea flavored puff. Let's just say that's going to be the only time I try it. The thing about green tea is that it's fairly subtle flavor. The custard was so rich that I didn't really detect the green tea until after I was finished. Which if you didn't know what you were eating you would just think that the taste was off. Also? The green powdered sugar that was dusted on top was a turn off. It was not an appetizing color.

excerpts: I popped it in the microwave for 12 seconds and was rewarded with essentially a chocolate cake with a core of warm melted chocolate filling.
Very good.

The prices seem high but are not outrageous considering these are not some little dainty single bite dealies but instead a whole body pudding-all-over-the-face, powdered sugar down the front of your shirt experience.
Imagine jelly donuts designed by the French for the Japanese export market, and you have a reasonable approximation of what you're going to get.
$1.75 for a puff, $11 for a half-dozen.
I'll be back
chocolate.author: Pat T.
chocolate.review:
The pumpkin cream puff (today's special) was delicious - the filling tasted like pumpkin pie filling and vanilla ice cream. The pastry was a nice compliment, but at Beard Papa's, it's really the filling that's the thing.

Compared to the pumpkin, the vanilla creampuff was a letdown -- the filling was too sweet and rich.

Update: tried the green tea puff today. It is worthy.

The fondant was amazing. I popped it in the microwave for 12 seconds and was rewarded with essentially a chocolate cake with a core of warm melted chocolate filling. Very good.

The prices seem high but are not outrageous considering these are not some little dainty single bite dealies but instead a whole body pudding-all-over-the-face, powdered sugar down the front of your shirt experience. Imagine jelly donuts designed by the French for the Japanese export market, and you have a reasonable approximation of what you're going to get. 

$1.75 for a puff, $11 for a half-dozen. I'll be back

excerpts: I love every cream puff that they have; vanilla, chocolate, grean tea, and more.
chocolate.author: Misty C.
chocolate.review:
awesome, fantastic cream puffs!  I can get much happier with this cream puff on my hand.  :)

yummy yummy ... I love every cream puff that they have; vanilla, chocolate, grean tea, and more.  

I can't wait to go back there and try other flavors ... ahhh ... sooo good!  :)

excerpts:
We had to settle for one chocolate and one vanilla.

I found the chocolate pastry cream to be a bit grainy, but still enjoyable.
chocolate.author: Bruce S.
chocolate.review:
We visited Beard Papa's Cream Puffs on a Thursday at about 3pm or so.  No line!  So, our curiosity was satisfied more quickly than I anticipated.  

I was disappointed to find that only a few flavors are available at any given time.  Why is this?  I've heard that in the east coast locations more flavors are always available.  We couldn't have green tea, which was our first choice.  We had to settle for one chocolate and one vanilla.

I don't really like pate a choux, but this was quite good.  Nice and crunchy, with plenty of air space inside to be filled with cream.  And, the pastry cream was quite good.  I liked the vanilla the best-- smooth and creamy with a good sweet vanilla flavor.  I found the chocolate pastry cream to be a bit grainy, but still enjoyable.

Over all, very enjoyable.  Give them a try!

excerpts: The chocolate custard is genuinely chocolatey!
chocolate.author: Ceren E.
chocolate.review:
I love custards. I do not like whatever the traditional whipped sugar fluff is in other cream puffs. 

I freaking love Beard Papas. 

You order and they stuff the pastry shell right then. The chocolate custard is genuinely chocolatey! Cocoa powder and everything, nom nom nom. 

Get a half dozen for friends, half dozen for yourself. Maybe I'll exercise more if I bribe myself with these....

excerpts: So far I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, and strawberry (favorite!
with bits of chopped strawberry in it!
mmmm.. too bad
it's not a regular flavor), and the cookie crumble puff.
I could give or take the cookie crumble, I think the regular puff is satisfying enough.
chocolate.author: Tori C.
chocolate.review:
Yummmm.. I don't ever normally purchase or make cream puffs. Just not my preferred dessert.. but something about these particular cream puffs makes me crave them whenever I'm within about 6 blocks of their vicinity. (Ok, and sometimes even when I'm not even in the city at all!) 

Restraint is definitely necessary to eat just one. Sometimes I give in and eat one there, and get a second one to take home. :) Don't bother to look up the calories. Why would you do that? It's a cream puff, obviously it's not going to be full of vitamins and other healthy nutrients. But who cares, it's a treat!

So far I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, and strawberry (favorite! with bits of chopped strawberry in it! mmmm.. too bad it's not a regular flavor), and the cookie crumble puff. I could give or take the cookie crumble, I think the regular puff is satisfying enough. My boyfriend has had the green tea flavor and said it was good as well.

The only downside to this place? I'm on a college student budget, and they happen to be 'conveniently' close enough for me to just stop by on my way to BART after class is done... ;)

excerpts: Well I also tasted the chocolate cream puff, which is a little too much choklad (pronounced hwoo-klohd
, that's chocolate in Swedish) for me.
Yay
I have to try the "milk tea" probably the most Asian flavored cream puff you could get..
chocolate.author: O K.
chocolate.review:
MMMMM! I had checked Beard Papa's website a couple months ago to see if they were ever coming to SF after I had a heavenly taste of their cream puffs in Hollywood. Today I checked again to see if they had opened yet, and lo and behold the opening day was yesterday! My friend and I rushed downtown and each bought 3 delicious cream puffs. Not too sweet, wonderful vanilla flavor in the sublimely textured cream, and a crispy-crunchy shell. MMMMMMMMMMMM!!! Apparently yesterday Beard Papa sold more cream puffs than any other California Beard Papa did on their first day. Good job San Francisco! I can't wait to try PUMPKIN cream puff!!!

Edit: I tried the pumpkin cream puff. It was really delicious. It had the slight sweet tang of pumpkin. PUMPYKIN. Does anyone else pronounce the word "pumpykin" like me? Well I also tasted the chocolate cream puff, which is a little too much choklad (pronounced hwoo-klohd, that's chocolate in Swedish) for me. Yay I have to try the "milk tea" probably the most Asian flavored cream puff you could get.. Unless it also had red bean filling and green tea essence in it too. And one prerequisite tapioca bean.

excerpts: I haven't been able to stray away from the vanilla, but they do have tempting flavors such as Green Tea, Chocolate, and Strawberry.
Go out on a limb if you dare, but I just can't seem to think of a reason to choose anything but vanilla.
chocolate.author: Rick V.
chocolate.review:
Ok.  Not sure about the name and what it has to do with cream puffs, but damn, Bearded Papa makes one fine cream puff.  I can't say that I am an expert as I admittedly have not had many elsewhere, but the mouth and tummy don't lie--Yum!

Crispy on the outside, somewhat airy and elastic on the inside with the upper cut of  vanilla custard--body blow, body blow, knock him out, knock him out.  

I haven't been able to stray away from the vanilla, but they do have tempting flavors such as Green Tea, Chocolate, and Strawberry.  Go out on a limb if you dare, but I just can't seem to think of a reason to choose anything but vanilla.

excerpts: I don't think the chocolate is all that, but the vanilla is the quintessential cream puff....
chocolate.author: Amy Z.
chocolate.review:
Ok, Gram doesn't make these anymore so this is a good place when I am feeling a little nostaligic for cream puffs...and while they are tasty at the expense of 200 calories per puff of delight, the line at either location is not worth my time.

I don't think the chocolate is all that, but the vanilla is the quintessential cream puff....

excerpts: $1.75 for a vanilla bean cream puff, a teensy bit more for chocolate and flavor of the week specials.
I believe if the total comes to less than $3 (or was it $5?), you have to pay in cash.
chocolate.author: Lynn O.
chocolate.review:
I prefer this location to the one on Market in the mall, mostly because service here is faster due to less of a crowd (though the line does get really long here, it's usually worse over there due to famished shoppers).  $1.75 for a vanilla bean cream puff, a teensy bit more for chocolate and flavor of the week specials.  I believe if the total comes to less than $3 (or was it $5?), you have to pay in cash.  I ended up buying two puffs one time because all I had was plastic.

You have to try this place at least once.  Oh-- but sometimes, you might be the unlucky one who gets a slightly deflated puff (this happened once at the Market location, hence another reason I avoid that location).  I've never tried to haggle for a puffier cream puff before but I guess anything's possible....

excerpts: I deign to eat the vanilla, chocolate and caramel (vanilla is still my fav), although I'm hesitant to try to strawberry.
Strawberry flavoured puddings aren't my cup of tea (there's my
chocolate.author: C. P.
chocolate.review:
There has to be something intrinsically WRONG with getting cravings for little pastries filled with cool pudding-esque semi-solids.

I admit I've put on my oversized Prada sunglasses and snuck in to Beard Papa's because, like a drug addict, I'm addicted to carbs.

These little babies are absolutely amazing. The no fuss, no judgements little bakery (carb hell, I call it) allow you CHOICES of cream puffs. I deign to eat the vanilla, chocolate and caramel (vanilla is still my fav), although I'm hesitant to try to strawberry. Strawberry flavoured puddings aren't my cup of tea (there's my minus 1 star).

The price range is great for the orgasm of taste your mouth will feel. You'll need a napkin to clean up the mess. :)

excerpts: Cream puffs dipped in solid chocolate -- Beard Papa's eclairs are really as good as it gets.
In my dreams, I live on these, fresh strawberries and champagne.
Mmmmmm.
chocolate.author: Michelly S.
chocolate.review: Cream puffs dipped in solid chocolate -- Beard Papa's eclairs are really as good as it gets.  In my dreams, I live on these, fresh strawberries and champagne.  Mmmmmm.

excerpts: I've tried the Vanilla, Chocolate, Green Tea, and Milk Tea Cream Puffs
(Yes, Milk Tea.

It's not too sweet and tastes like a little puff of heaven! 
Chocolate and Green Tea: Great! but not as awesome as Vanilla bean!
Milk Tea: I thought this would be very strange, but it was delightfully yummy!
I would absolutely get one again!

It's not too sweet and tastes like a little puff of heaven! 
Chocolate and Green Tea: Great! but not as awesome as Vanilla bean!
Milk Tea: I thought this would be very strange, but it was delightfully yummy!
I would absolutely get one again!
chocolate.author: Sally A.
chocolate.review:
What's better after a long day of shopping or just a simple break from shopping than a nice Vanilla Cream Puff from Beard Papa's?

Nothing!

I've tried the Vanilla, Chocolate, Green Tea, and Milk Tea Cream Puffs (Yes, Milk Tea. I'm Taiwanese and felt like I owed it to my heritage to try one). 

Vanilla Bean: I have to say this is still my favorite! It's not too sweet and tastes like a little puff of heaven! 
Chocolate and Green Tea: Great! but not as awesome as Vanilla bean!
Milk Tea: I thought this would be very strange, but it was delightfully yummy! I would absolutely get one again! The milk tea flavor wasn't overpowering, but you could definitely taste it.

All of them are delicious depending on your personal choice of flavor and definitely worth it. Can't wait to go back!

excerpts: The chocolate fondant thingies are also delicious, if you want something a little smaller/more chocolatey.
chocolate.author: Valerie M.
chocolate.review:
Fisherman Santa*, I love you.

The best is the "eclair" with vanilla creme. Caramel is also good if they've got it. They're big enough to share, if you're feeling virtuous, and if not, well, just more deliciousness for you.

The only downside? Messy! Unless you have a giant mouth and devour it in one bite, chances are you're going to have to lick your fingers several dozen times. But it's worth it, I promise.

The chocolate fondant thingies are also delicious, if you want something a little smaller/more chocolatey.
 

*this is what my boyfriend calls the Beard Papa icon-man

excerpts: First time I went, all they had were vanilla and chocolate cream puffs available, the special flavors were "coming soon.
chocolate.author: Rolo T.
chocolate.review:
After reading about Beard Papa's on Daily Candy and Yelp, I was pretty excited about giving this place a try. 

Been there twice and was let down both times. First time I went, all they had were vanilla and chocolate cream puffs available, the special flavors were "coming soon." 

I went again about 6 weeks later and was excited to see that the special flavors were available. However, only one special flavor (out of 5 or so) for the week was available. I was so keen on trying the green tea but have not been able to because I wasn't there the right week. Why list all the flavors on the menu if you are not going to feature them until 3 weeks later?!!! 

Just really annoying each time I've gone with expectations of having a satisfying cream puff experience. With the ones I did try, average and not worth the wait in line. I think I made better cream puffs when I was 10 years old experimenting in my mom's kitchen. Give me the bulk cream puff package at Costco any day.

excerpts: But the chocolate puff, that is some seriously delicious puff goodness.
Subtle and light.
chocolate.author: saudade s.
chocolate.review:
Since Beard Papa's opened in San Francisco, all of my fellow hapa friends talked this place up.  I never could bring myself to make it a destination --  I'm not a huge sweet eater -- and never sought it out on trips to Japan, and still I heard I MUST try the cream puff.

Well finally, I did it.  

I wasn't blown away by the eclair, but I've never been one for chocolatey coating.  Hubby said it is the best eclair he's ever had though.  The vanilla puff -- just good.  But the chocolate puff, that is some seriously delicious puff goodness.  Subtle and light.  The keys are as with any Japanese sweet: not so sickly sweet like so many Western confections, and high quality ingredients. 

So, four stars instead of five, but only because I'm not a big sweet eater and it's not like if I'm in the neighborhood I NEED one.  Not like ice cream at Ici.

excerpts: I loved the hard chocolate on the outside.
We got the vanilla
and I was in heaven.
Tasted like a chocolate covered strawberry.
That is how good the cream is.
Not too sweet, just enough.
I wish I could have them shipped to me!!
chocolate.author: Kathy A.
chocolate.review: Now you are talking.  I am an eclair girl so I just had to try it and we got a cream puff too.  I loved the hard chocolate on the outside.  We got the vanilla and I was in heaven.  Until I tried it with strawberry.  Tasted like a chocolate covered strawberry.  That is how good the cream is.  Not too sweet, just enough.  I wish I could have them shipped to me!!

excerpts: I like the chocolate, my husband likes the vanilla...
we get one of each and share.
chocolate.author: Alicia W.
chocolate.review:
I originally tried Beard Papa in Singapore and I must say, that the San Francisco Shop may have done an even better job then the storefronts in Asia.  I like the chocolate, my husband likes the vanilla...we get one of each and share.  It's bliss.

The Puff is lite and has a good rich eggy feel.  The custards are well flavored, and just enough to satisfy.

The puffs are definitely the star of the show here. While they have other items on the menu (eclairs, cheese cake, etc..) they simply cannot compare to the cream puffs. 

The filling has a light creamy texture and the pastry shell is fluffy and flaky.  My favorite used to be vanilla but that pushed to second when I tasted the strawberry which has strawberry bits in the filling. Chocolate is a distant third, and the others I'm just not as fond of. 

I like to break mine apart and eat them that way, rather than trying to bite into the whole puff as it can get messy. Either way, Beard Papa is a guilty pleasure that I'm more than willing to indulge in when I get a craving. They just opened another location in Redwood City 3 minutes from where I work, so I can get my fix after work without having to pay for parking in SF.
