excerpts: The manager I spoke to didn't really have a good answer here, but at least they finally started serving chocolate puffs this week.
chocolate.author: Alexa M.
chocolate.review:
New here to yelp and still thinking of something witty for my profile. "

First of all just want to say...yes I am addicted to Beard Papa Cream Puffs hehe.  I've enjoyed BP in Japan, Singapore, Hollywood, Gardena, and now here in the Bay Area.  My opinion is purely my opinion and everyone is entitled to their own.  I'm just here to educate and answer questions raised on previous reviews.

FYI...this is a long post and yes I have too much time on my hands =).  I base all my info on a 15min chat session with the manager of the Yerba Buena store and my personal experiences.

1) Japanese vs French Puffs
Keep in mind this is a Japanese style cream puff.  Hence the crispy shell, softer dough inside, and semi-sweet japanese Nama custard (custard and whipped cream).  I believe this is what makes the taste and texture unique.  French style puffs are softer and have a heavier, sweeter cream.  See #2 below for puff size differences.

2) Napkins required?
First of all, these puffs are big and a good amount of japanese style custard cream is purposely injected into the crispy shells.  Thus the flaky shell, amt of cream, and dusted baker's sugar leads to quite a mess.  If you saw the CNN Anderson Cooper piece on BP, the messy eating experience was one of the funny things they mentioned.  **WARNING...my opinion here** I personally feel you get quality and quantity in this pastry.  Because of the larger size puff and extra room for cream, I feel like I'm getting my money's worth and don't experience the sugar sickness afterwards because of the lighter, semi-sweet custard.  I couldn't consume french style cream in equal amounts...hmm now that I think of it maybe that's why French cream puffs are smaller. 

3) Pricey?
Some may think $1.75 for a cream puff is expensive, but personally for me and my taste...I'd rather pay for a fresh, larger-than-norm BP puff than $3 for a Satura Cream Puff (decent, but not flaky...more bread like), $1.50 for a Ranch 99 Cream Puff, or $2+ for a behind-the-glass muffin/scone/danish at my local Starbucks.  But a BP puff does go perfectly with Starbuck's dark roast.

4) Are they really fresh?
Shells are baked every 20mins and custard made every 2-3hours.  The puffs are never served hot or piping from the oven.  They need to be cooled out of the oven to get that flaky texture.  If the shells are not cooled properly or if the custard is pumped in too soon...moisture will soften the shells prematurely.  

5) Why the lines?
Going back to #4 above, the lines primarily form when patrons are left waiting for the ovens to finish baking or when the puff are still in the cooling process.  Plus add in the marketing factor here.

6) What's up with all the workers?
Every BP I've visited has had a Cream Puff line of workers so its part of the experience whether you like it or not.  Keep in mind, if they had fewer workers things might move slower.  But there is a difference between BP bakeries ambiance...I'll explain.  Have your ever been to a sushi restaurant where they greet you loudly in Japanese, proceed to shout orders, bow to you while saying Domo (sp?).  Well some BP's have this same experience where they greet/shout in Japanese which makes it more "entertaining"...purely my opinion here.  The Yerba Buena store is bland in this sense, but at least the workers are nice and courteous.    

7) Other locations?
There are two more to be open this year...Redwood City and the SF Center a block away.  Is it just me or are the two SF stores a bit close?  Why not spread them out?  In any case, living in the Peninsula myself...I'll be a regular in the Redwood City spot.  After doing a bit of research with the Yerba Buena baker, the Redwood City BP will be bigger, have more coffee house style seating, and have a barista.

8) Why only vanilla?  Where's the fondant and cheesecake fingers?
The manager I spoke to didn't really have a good answer here, but at least they finally started serving chocolate puffs this week.  As for the fondant and cheesecake fingers...good news is that  they also are baked fresh daily, bad news is that they don't start selling these sweets until a month after grand opening...bah! 

9) Who is Beard Papa?
Well its kind of an entertaining story...I suggest you walk in and ask one of the workers.

Sorry for the Beard Papa thesis, hopefully you'll enjoy them as much as I do!

chocolate.review:
Puff of magic deliciousness......... It was  a Wednesday afternoon and my co-worker and I needed a little afternoon pick me up. I knew exactly what we needed. I can almost feel the rush of sugar flowing to my brain just thinking about it now. We left the office and walked the 6 blocks down Mission St. to Beard Papa's   (across from the Metreon). This is the second time I've been to this location and it still amazes me how the Beard Papa employees turn out these little cream puffs and cakes as fast as one of Willy Wonkas assembly line oompa loompas. I hope that's not un PC to say, woops. 
They have the expected flavors such as strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla. But for the slightly more adventurous they also have Green Tea and Coffee. With the first Beard Papa's locations opening in Japan in 1999, this chain seems to be catching on pretty quickly in the U.S. Us Americans do like us some sugar and fried goodness! And since Krispy Kreme is pretty much non-existent in the SF (except for the stale versions in Safeway), I think Beard Papa's will be a success.  And if you complain about enhaling the powdered sugar then you deserve to be eating a stale doughnut instead.
 
Oh and their slogan is "fresh and natural". How can you go wrong? Okay I believe the fresh part because I witnessed it with my own eyes, but how all of that scrumcious cream can be "natural" is beyond me. All I know is that these little suckers are darn tasty! Highly recommend them to perk up any workday.

I'm a little disappointed that the pat a choix is not made fresh but is pre-shaped and frozen so the workers simply put them on baking sheets.  However, the taste is unparalleled by any pastry shop I've visited.  The puff itself has a nice outer crunch and the inside is feathery light and moist.  The cream (I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, and green tea) has a perfect balance of creaminess, mouthfeel, sweetness, flavor, and body to make this delectable treat a success.  I highly recommend the vanilla flavor, no gimmicks, no fancy extras, just plain old pat a choix and vanilla cream...my mouth is watering...yum!

chocolate.author: Deb K.
chocolate.review:
At 3:30 p.m., the line was 25 people long for Beard Papa, the new cream puff shop owned by the Japanese corporation Muginoho. The San Francisco store on the new Yerba Buena Lane is one of a few U.S. franchises; the others are in New York, New Jersey, Boston, Hawaii and Los Angeles. 

After we'd waited for about 10 minutes, one of the staff came down the line, apologized, and told us it would be 30 minutes before another batch was ready. Because we were only ordering one, we decided to stay, in hopes it would be quicker. 

Beard Papa is quite the scene. Besides the long line winding out the door, there's a lot going on inside. When you first step over the threshold, you're hit with this delicious buttery scent. You can see the puffs baking in these industrial-looking, high-tech ovens. They start off the size of a hockey puck, and then rise into a much larger, 3-inch puff. The staff, dressed chef's whites, forms an assembly line when the puffs are done cooling, with one person injecting the custard into the puff, the second dusting it with powdered sugar and placing it in a bag, and the third packing them into carrying boxes.

This place inspires some kind of weird fanaticism, and after having a vanilla cream puff, I have to say it may be merited. The people in line were mostly all Asian, as were all of the staff. A family with four little boys was taking pictures with one of the staff. Overhead, on two flat screen TVs, news clips about Beard Papa played; at one point, I looked up and saw Anderson Cooper on CNN eating a cream puff. The store sells T-shirts with its mascot --- an old, bearded man in a cap, and the saying, "Who's Your Papa?" This is probably temporary, but there was a sign saying "Limit: One dozen per customer." 

The menu over the cream puff area had "Coming Soon" taped over all of the selections, except the vanilla cream puffs. Under coming soon: cream puffs of different flavors --- chocolate, caramel, green tea, pumpkin, milk tea and strawberry. With the exception of chocolate, the flavors will rotate on a weekly basis. There are also the curiously named cheesecake sticks, the fondant au chocolat and clairs. 

The puff itself is a marvel of choux pastry: flaky, buttery, and crunchy. The cream is also unique, and delicious. It is a not-too-sweet mixture of whipped cream and custard that the sign in Beard Papa's claims it takes two hours to make. You can see them scraping the vanilla bean pods, too, to extract the vanilla that flecks the cream in the vanilla cream puffs. I think this may be a new obsession for me.

The chocolate blows, because it's bitter, and not like a sweet mousse that it should be. I have tired the strawberry, and it's so-so, but better than the chocolate.
The thing that gets me the most is their terrible service. The line time is glacial, GLACIAL for some balls of dough with dairy inside. They don't have the chocolate fondant yet, and it's been months now. Perfecting the recipe my ass. Hurry it up so I can try the last thing on your menu that intrigues me and leave me be. Get your act together, or the locals will not return. Go down a couple of blocks to Grain D'Or and give their pastries a try. At least they taste sweet.

But anyway, I walked in and ordered myself a chocolate eclair, or excuse me, a double chocolate eclair. I waited until I got home to eat it, and for the love of me, I passed out from a sugar induced coma. Long story short: It was GOOD. Tasty, and the filling inside ... I can't describe it. It had a nice texture, went down smooth. Service was okay ... for maybe two minutes, the way they were talking to each other made it seem like they didn't know what an eclair was. Like it was such a travesty that someone didn't order their world famous holier-than-thou cream puff. Pfffffttt.

I don't know how the cream puff tastes though, and I don't care to know. I hate cream puffs.

i first tried beard papa cream puffs in nyc a few years ago, and was ecstatic when they opened a store at this location on yerba buena lane in san francisco. after a few visits, my elation slipped half a notch, but not because the cream puffs aren't excellent -- they're still quite tasty with the crisp outer shell that they fill with creamy custard when you order -- but because i think i've just kinda outgrown them or maybe realized that only occasional indulgence is a good thing and getting sick of beard papa's CAN happen. :P or maybe because i tried the chocolate one and it wasn't that good, weakly flavored and a bit grainy. i do wholeheartedly recommend the original vanilla flavor, as well as the pumpkin flavor and the strawberry. the green tea is good if you're a green tea fan, and caramel tastes like vanilla with a hint of caramel (which is good but not that caramelly). i also recently tried the royal milk tea flavor and it was okay, but not one of the better flavors. come to think of it, i guess i've tried pretty much all their flavors! the only thing is that they have vanilla and chocolate every day, but the rest of the flavors rotate on a weekly basis so they might not have the flavor you want the day you go.

i've also tried the cheesecake stick which wasn't very good. they also have an eclair (chocolate glazed version of the cream puff) and some kind of molten chocolate lava cake that i haven't yet tried.

i didn't know i had so much to say about beard papa's. the sad thing is that i could go on, but i won't. :P

chocolate.author: Jessica L.
chocolate.review:
These are really great cream puffs, but they're not as amazing as I thought they would be. But, talk about great marketing... and that custard aroma that wafts out of the cafe... enticing!
I used to eat Beard Papa's often when I was working in Asia (they're a lot cheaper there) and was thankfully a luxury I could afford but now that they've been translated into American dollars with the American price sting, I've reduced my love for Beard Papa's by a star (tear). But, when I'm in the city I 80% of the time make a stop here for two reasons: one, the menu has expanded and they have a "special" daily flavor, my favorite so far being pumpkin; two, it just smells soooo good and I always feel like I should be rewarded for my small life efforts so I'll dish out for one or two pastries. I'll buy more if I'm visiting family because they're absolute die hard fans of the original vanilla Beard Papa's cream puffs. Beyond the cream puffs and the eclairs (which are actually just the cream puffs dipped in chocolate) I haven't tried their other new offerings, but am planning on going back sometime to try cheesecake and fondant au chocolat. I hear they have mochi ice cream, but haven't seen/heard anything about them yet.
I have to say the 2 greatest selling point of Beard Papa's is that they use custard instead of cream, and it is definitely fresh. If you're willing to spend extra for sweets, Beard Papa would be your thing.

I look maniacally happy too because the photo was taken post-vanilla bean cream puff.

I am a dessert connoisseur. Fuck all that Death by Chocolate crap you get at chain restaurants or ginormous slices of waxy Lemon Chiffon pie... give me something relatively simple but wonderfully rich and tasty and I'll be your loyal customer for life.

I love this whole Japanese company - they have sister companies in Japan that are incredible - I'm waiting for Choco Cro to come to the states - they have the perfect ratio of chocolate to fluffy, warm puff pastry in their chocolate croissants.  Mmm.....

By the time we arrived at the front cashier, we were suckered into buying the 6 pieces of goodies.   You can mix and match the pieces too. chocolate.author: Howard G.
chocolate.review: 4pm sweet tooth got your tummy growling?  Make your way down to Bear Papa's, but beware.  Once you try the cream puff nothing else will be able to satisfy a sweet tooth craving again!  I've only been there once, but since then I've been dreaming of pastry puffs filled with a variety of creams.  I'm dying to try the Green Tea Puff (weekly special only offered on certain days).  I shared the chocolate puff, which I thought was decadent and delicious, but I hear the vanilla is better.  If you don't like puffs of cream they have a chocolate lava cake and I heard it's even better than the puffs!

excerpts: At $1.75 for a regular vanilla cream puff and nearly $2 for their specialty cream puffs (chocolate / caramel / strawberry, etc) Beard Papa is a once in a while sort of snack for me.
My bf just came back from Asia and was raving about the Beard Papas over there, so we decided to check out the new establishment in SF.
We each had a vanilla bean cream puff.
My first Beard Papa "experience.
After reading reviews on Yelp about this place,  I was so curious what the first bite would be like.
Light flaky pastry with a sweet but not too sweet creamy custard filling.
The little flecks of real vanilla bean were a nice touch.
While I thought the cream puff was tasty, I also didn't feel the urge to run back in the store and buy 12 more.
Plus by then, the line had grown, and I didn't love the cream puff enough to stand 30 min in the cold.
I give Beard Papa three stars...
I've had better cream puffs in my lifetime, albeit made homemade from French cooks, but Beard Papa's is good too.

chocolate.author: Royce L.
chocolate.review: Four stars for the product. I always like Beard Papas cream puffs. For me, it's hard to get  a cream puff wrong as long as the filling is yummy and the puff is fresh. Poor service is what took the star off my rating. An angry, impatient looking cashier with a lower lip piercing gave me this what-do-you-want-just-freakin-order-and-get-out kind of stare. Made me wonder what happened to customer service. I ordered my dozen cream puffs with great difficulty as the cashier was not very helpful and continued to give me a hateful stare. When I finished ordering, I realize I had forgotten to get a cup of coffee. But I decided against it because I didn't want to further upset the cashier. Instead, I went next door to the chocolate shop to get my java. I left Beard Papas disappointed that I had this kind of experience. I suppose it's a plus that I'm not usually in the area and I normally go to the SF shopping center one.

are 22$.

Their eclairs and chocolate cakes are ok, but the real stars are the cream puffs.
The coffee here is pretty good, the iced coffee is better.

excerpts: I've tried their daily special cream puffs, but the original and chocolate cream puffs are still the best.
The eclair is basically a cream puff covered with chocolate.
Must I say, this is DELICIOUS.
The chocolate lava cake is absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS.
They would ask you if you want to eat it right away, or would like to bring it home.
If you'd like to eat it right away, they would pop it into the microwave for 10 seconds and when you dive into the cake, the warm molten chocolate center oozes out in all its goodness.
It's just the perfect ending to a great meal or a night in the city.
chocolate.author: Fanny C.
chocolate.review: I happened upon this place when I was walking back towards downtown after having dinner at Thirsty Bear with a friend. The smell of this place drew me in and has had me since then. I've tried their daily special cream puffs, but the original and chocolate cream puffs are still the best. To top things off, I'd definitely go with an eclair if I'm in the mood to indulge (which I always do). The eclair is basically a cream puff covered with chocolate. Must I say, this is DELICIOUS. The cheese sticks aren't too impressive, but still not bad if you're in the mood (but then I'd just go to the cheesecake factory which is just a couple blocks away). The chocolate lava cake is absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS. They would ask you if you want to eat it right away, or would like to bring it home. If you'd like to eat it right away, they would pop it into the microwave for 10 seconds and when you dive into the cake, the warm molten chocolate center oozes out in all its goodness. It's just the perfect ending to a great meal or a night in the city.

chocolate.review: i'd like to share my experience along with the other 190 reviews here, not that's it's a fascinating experience at all.  i was walking over to a friend's place when i saw all the fun blue and yellow balloons out front.  i thought it was some kind of cal thing.  hah.  anyway, it turned out to be the very second day of opening for this place.  recognizing the fisherman guy logo and seizing the opportunity that there were hardly any people in line, i bought one dozen puffs on the spot.  i waited maybe 10 minutes tops.  the longest part was them actually filling the puffs, since no one else was buying a dozen.  i still have the cute box.  it was the vanilla flavored cream... and oh so good.  i must've ate one a day for the next four days (i like moderation).  i think the sweetness is just right, not too sweet and very delicate.  maybe even a tad too much filling cuz it just oozes in the middle.  even the crust has a nice amount of chew.  doesn't really last more than three days though.  later i tried the chocolate, but i like the vanilla better.  i have yet to try the other flavors.  i'd never wait 45 minutes for this place like my other crazy friends.

chocolate.review: i was looking around yelp and found that this was one of the most reviewed places. i HAD TO go and get me a cream puff. so on a time schedule i went to the bank got me some money and then went to beard papa's for some cream puffs. i have to say i wasn't so impressed. don't get me wrong they were good but they weren't great. i got there and the wait wasn't long but the people working there walked away from me as i was about to place my order. they finally gave me my puffs but i noticed for some reason they skipped over people who were behind me. not bad for me but i felt bad. the chocolate cream puffs were chalky and i kinda choked on the ovaltine like powder on top when i inhaled it a little. when i got home i realized that they forgot to put the powdered sugar on my vanilla puffs. so very disappointed. i expected more. the vanilla puff was good but could have been better with the powder. will try it again.

excerpts: I tried the green tea one and it tasted like an uncooked cake with runny matcha filling inside.
green tea.author: Vicky L.
green tea.review:
My go-to place for when I need a sweet fix in the area. A crispy pastry shell filled with custard cream? Oh hell yes. Choose the puff that you want--plain or dipped in chocolate(eclair) and filling flavor. Matcha and vanilla bean are the best flavaflavs. Not to sweet, cool and flavorful. My fave combo is a chocolate dipped puff with matcha filling. Bomb AF!

I've tried their Paris Brest (donut shaped pastry w/choice of filling), their Tiramisu pastry stick and they were just as tasty AF. The 'fondant' cakes on the other hand are a pass. I tried the green tea one and it tasted like an uncooked cake with runny matcha filling inside. Not a fan...

Overall, beard papa knows what's up in the cream puff dept. They're a little bit pricey ($3+ for 1?) but I say it's worth it...for SF lol. Service is whatever tho (don't expect exceptional service); tell them what you want, pay and wait off to the side for the goods. I'll keep coming back!

excerpts: The green tea (plus white chocolate) shell on top didn't particularly add any green tea flavor.
The filling was surprisingly somewhat strong on the green tea flavor.
Compared to last week's adventures in transplanted Asian dessert-land, this was certainly a larger dessert and lasted more bites.
Cream was not too sweet and definitely light.
In terms of would I come back though?
Hard to see myself doing that anytime soon, when a box of those Costco mini cream puffs (omg I love those things) would suffice.
green tea.author: Nicole H.
green tea.review:
"Do you want to go to Bearded Papa?" asked the bf. "It's Beard Papa," said I. "Beard Papa" is grammatically incorrect," said he. "It's an Asian transplant," said I. We then proceeded to go over this conversation with the newly opened Bake Cheese Tart (yup, it's not Baked Cheese Tart), but I digress....

In my mind's eye, Beard Papa's has always been an upscale sort of treat. Maybe it's specific to this particular store, but I left feeling like the spot had been knocked down a rung. The paint on the counters and walls was chipped in a number of places, the trash bins were overflowing, and the tables and chairs looked quite worn and cheap (not to mention dirty). We got a matcha cream puff (although they're marketed as eclairs now) with matcha filling. 

Perhaps it's because the shell wasn't fresh out of the oven, but it was very...normal. The green tea (plus white chocolate) shell on top didn't particularly add any green tea flavor. The filling was surprisingly somewhat strong on the green tea flavor. Compared to last week's adventures in transplanted Asian dessert-land, this was certainly a larger dessert and lasted more bites. Cream was not too sweet and definitely light. In terms of would I come back though? Hard to see myself doing that anytime soon, when a box of those Costco mini cream puffs (omg I love those things) would suffice.

green tea.author: Tammy P.
green tea.review:
I brought my friend here for a snack break during our time at a conference. Although I was bummed that they didn't have green tea that day, we tried the caramel and it was better than expected. The caramel filling wasn't super sweet and even had a slight tartness to it. As a Beard Papa first timer, my friend said it was really good; she even ordered one of each cream puff to take home. 

Customer service could be better.

excerpts: They only had the vanilla and chocolate fillings available; and as for the glazed puff itself: only strawberry, green tea, chocolate and vanilla were available.
green tea.author: Lauren K.
green tea.review:
I definitely looked like a bearded papa after eating three of these cream puffs...that wasn't necessarily the goal, but I was feeling ravenous and when that hunger hits, I just dig right into my food, mindless of the mess I will make.  I had actually bought these cream puffs and brought them back to my hotel so as to enjoy breakfast in bed...I thought it'd be all luxurious, but I ended up just making a big flaky, creamy mess for the hotel maids to clean up later.

These cream puffs are delicate little things - the cream will ooze out the minute you bite into it so be prepared to lick all the cream off before it falls to the floor.  Let's play a little game of, 'Don't drop the cream!'.  These things are not only delicate, but also fairly small.  They aren't so small in that it's not worth buying them; I would actually say that for their size, they are filled with cream!  What's great about this place is that you can actually choose which filling you want.  I had come on a day where there was a bunch of construction outside and I guess they were preparing to close down temporarily because of it so there were limited flavors available.  They only had the vanilla and chocolate fillings available; and as for the glazed puff itself: only strawberry, green tea, chocolate and vanilla were available.  I was so looking forward to trying all these other flavors, but that wasn't in the cards for me that day.

There was a selection of cream puffs already to go, but then you had the option of picking and choosing your puff and your cream.  For each cream puff, either created by yourself or pre-prepared, it was about $3-4, so I ended up walking away having spent about $12 on cream puffs.  I didn't blink too much of an eye at this because I do love cream puffs...in fact, these cream puffs made for a breakfast of champions.  They didn't hold me over for long and their sugary base probably wasn't good for my diet, but they tasted pretty good in the moment.

excerpts: I got almond, green tea, chocolate, and creme brulée.
They were all for myself lol.
They fill the puffs for you on the spot, according to your cream flavor selection (vanilla, caramel, green tea).
They also do ice cream filling for an extra charge.
Don't go right before closing, they won't let you in.
green tea.author: Liz H.
green tea.review: Service is poor but the cream puffs are so good you deal with it. I got almond, green tea, chocolate, and creme brulée. They were all for myself lol. They fill the puffs for you on the spot, according to your cream flavor selection (vanilla, caramel, green tea). They also do ice cream filling for an extra charge. Don't go right before closing, they won't let you in.

excerpts: Enjoy plain, chocolate, vanilla, green tea toppings.
They have a cup of minis too.
The crust is crunchy despite the fact that it is filled with cream.
I will definitely be coming back.
green tea.author: Misty W.
green tea.review:
Holy smokes. This is a little piece of heaven in earth. The cream puffs are the size of your fist they come with chocolate or vanilla filling. Enjoy plain, chocolate, vanilla, green tea toppings. They have a cup of minis too. 
The crust is crunchy despite the fact that it is filled with cream. I will definitely be coming back.

excerpts: We had the regular and the green tea ones.
green tea.author: Veg V.
green tea.review:
This scrumptious bakery is right across from Yerba Buena/Metreon and bascially next to the Comtemporary Jewish Museum. 

Their menu is small, but it's enough: mostly, it's different flavors of amazing cream puffs. We had the regular and the green tea ones.

Beard Papa is definitely not vegan, but I guess it's accidentally vegetarian. Regardless, it's a treat!

excerpts: They are Caramel, coffee, mango, green tea, strawberry, and pumpkin.
We always miss it when they have green tea and strawberry, but our to go filling is vanilla.
They are crunchy and soft.
Just make sure you eat it in the wrapping because eating the cream puff can get messy.
We always miss it when they have green tea and strawberry, but our to go filling is vanilla.
They are crunchy and soft.
Just make sure you eat it in the wrapping because eating the cream puff can get messy.
green tea.author: Michelle C.
green tea.review: This is the original location for beard papa's. It is not as busy as the one in Westfield, which is good because we actually have a place to sit down. Their daily flavors are vanilla and chocolate, but they have weekly flavors as well. They are Caramel, coffee, mango, green tea, strawberry, and pumpkin. We always miss it when they have green tea and strawberry, but our to go filling is vanilla. They are crunchy and soft. Just make sure you eat it in the wrapping because eating the cream puff can get messy.

excerpts: I got an original cream puff and two matcha green tea cream puff.
green tea.author: Michele G.
green tea.review:
Nice place. Right across the metreon.
This place has some seating if you want to dine in.
Menu is big and easy to read.
No one else was inside when I came in so I ordered right away.
I got an original cream puff and two matcha green tea cream puff. About $8 for 3 cream puffs which ok priced.

It was neat that the lady made the cream puff right in front of you. Got my order in about 5 mins or less.

They have a bathroom but it's out of order.

Cream puff was decently sized. Filling/cream was a little bit bland for the matcha one. It was not too sweet which was good. The sweetness was very subtle. Overall it was a ok and a bit better but not the best.

Friendly customer service!

excerpts: I stopped by with a couple friends and shared a green tea puff with the honey butter topping (we really just wanted a taste, and these things are HUGE, so that worked out great!) - and it was very yummy!
The pastry shell was quite hard, which I found odd, but it still tasted good.
Overall: would definitely go back!
green tea.author: Liz F.
green tea.review: Yum! I stopped by with a couple friends and shared a green tea puff with the honey butter topping (we really just wanted a taste, and these things are HUGE, so that worked out great!) - and it was very yummy! The pastry shell was quite hard, which I found odd, but it still tasted good. Overall: would definitely go back!

excerpts: One day I'm gunna stump in when they have green tea
green tea.author: Tiffany Z.
green tea.review:
Generally don't crave cream puffs but if I do I'd probably pick Beard Papa's... Actually I don't even know any other place that specializes in just cream puffs?

I remember when I was younger I used to love going to BP whenever I made my way into DTSF.. Now fast forward, working in DTSF, it's still pretty much the same for me.

Ordered half a dozen of cream puffs for me and my 4 coworkers.  I ended up eating 2 in 1 sitting, what the hell.  I was trying to have some self control & only eat 1 but damn, might as well eat 2 since it's already staring at me in the face.

HAHA anyways despite being a fatass, BP is really good for a cream puff. The shell is good and the cream texture is smooth and light.  BP keeps things interesting by having daily special flavors depending on when you go.  They always have the defaulted chocolate and vanilla flavors though.  One day I'm gunna stump in when they have green tea and I'll have a very happy soul. 

Oh also, the puffs are made to order! So the puff is not creamed til you order ;)

excerpts: Sometimes they have green tea if you're lucky!
green tea.author: Kathleen S.
green tea.review:
Love love LOVE their cream puffs here! I usually go to the Westfield location but happened to walk by this one during my lunch break yesterday. You can find a cheap sweet fix here for less than $5 a portion. I always stick with the original cream puff with some sort of fruity filling (I love their strawberry and mango flavors a lot! They are usually offered as the flavor of the day) since I'm not a huge fan of the vanilla or chocolate. Sometimes they have green tea if you're lucky! If anyone else happens to know other unique flavors, please send them my way!

One original cream puff is 2.90, and you can get a chocolate covered one for about 50 cents more if you're feeling extra sweet. Portion sizes here are decent and just the right amount of filling. They offer eclairs and vanilla slices here if you want something different, but trying their cream puffs here are a must at least once!

excerpts: Others in our group got the crispy caramel, the green tea and the vanilla/vanilla.
It was yummy and huge!
Will get it again for sure!
green tea.author: Milee S.
green tea.review: I've never had Beard Papa's cream puffs before and I didn't want anything heavy since we had an amazing brunch at Kitchen Story.  This hit the spot. I got the chocolate with vanilla inside and a black coffee. Others in our group got the crispy caramel, the green tea and the vanilla/vanilla. It was yummy and huge! Will get it again for sure!

excerpts: Having tried the vanilla before, I decided to try the green tea weekly special and it was amazing.
I am always hesitant at trying matcha in new places because it's always a hit or miss, but I'm glad I took the risk this time.
The cream filling wasn't too sweet, and it hit the spot after traveling around downtown.
green tea.author: Golden H.
green tea.review:
If your wallet isn't very deep like mine, then that price tag on the cream puffs might seem pretty intimidating. Let me assure you though that even though your wallet may feel emptier, your soul will be filled with happiness (and sugar too!). Having tried the vanilla before, I decided to try the green tea weekly special and it was amazing. I am always hesitant at trying matcha in new places because it's always a hit or miss, but I'm glad I took the risk this time. The cream filling wasn't too sweet, and it hit the spot after traveling around downtown. The line for ordering was short, and I received my cream puff seconds after I paid for it, which was great!

Would I come back again? I mean my wallet and maybe my pancreas my hate me, but hey at least my soul is satisfied.

excerpts: I ended up ordering the green tea and chocolate cream puff.
I have to say I was not impressed and was very disappointed.
The pastry was dry and tasteless.
It seemed like it had been sitting out a while after being baked.
The cream filling was close to flavorless with only hints of chocolate and green tea.
I would give this place a 2 star rating, but the staff was very friendly so I give it 3 stars.
The cream filling was close to flavorless with only hints of chocolate and green tea.
I would give this place a 2 star rating, but the staff was very friendly so I give it 3 stars.
green tea.author: Alyssa W.
green tea.review: Seeing as this was always a hot spot as I walked by, I had to try it. It smelled delicious when I walked in, that very buttery bakery smell. I ended up ordering the green tea and chocolate cream puff. I have to say I was not impressed and was very disappointed. The pastry was dry and tasteless. It seemed like it had been sitting out a while after being baked. The cream filling was close to flavorless with only hints of chocolate and green tea. I would give this place a 2 star rating, but the staff was very friendly so I give it 3 stars.

excerpts:
Eclair cream puff with green tea custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#9I1eafhGAWlh-JbwgGEh-A)
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling.
Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did!
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling.
Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did!
The silky green tea custard inside seemed to engulf everything in a sea of matcha, and I was pleasantly surprised at how "right" the green tea tasted.
My friend opted for tradition, and he did enjoy his cream puff as well, although he said that my green tea custard would be his first choice next time.
I had a quick bite and thought that while I could still taste the freshness of the cream puff itself, it was a little one-dimensional after enjoying my eclair one.
green tea.author: Maggie X.
green tea.review:
I have to say.. I'm not really a cream puff kind of gal. I'd much prefer cake or a cupcake or a (chocolate) croissant or.. more cake? But even I can tell when a dessert is freshly made, and I definitely appreciate both that and the fact that the custard cream inside isn't deathly sweet.

Located just a few steps from Bluestem Brasserie, it's a short walk from the crowded Market Street and surprisingly calm. There are a few tables situated inside the store, but more scattered outside. The mechanism is assembly line: choose a kind of cream puff, choose your filling, pay, and enjoy. Service was mediocre but efficient, and the prices are very reasonable. 

Eclair cream puff with green tea custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#9I1eafhGAWlh-JbwgGEh-A)
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling. Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did! The chocolate on the outside was smooth and rich, which paired very well with the fragrant cream puff. The silky green tea custard inside seemed to engulf everything in a sea of matcha, and I was pleasantly surprised at how "right" the green tea tasted. 

Vanilla cream puff with vanilla custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#QIj2Oz-kWXntstYnOTPfvQ)
My friend opted for tradition, and he did enjoy his cream puff as well, although he said that my green tea custard would be his first choice next time. I had a quick bite and thought that while I could still taste the freshness of the cream puff itself, it was a little one-dimensional after enjoying my eclair one. I think the added layer of chocolate or another ingredient really makes a difference. I did like that the vanilla custard was also not overly sweet, so the entire thing wasn't too heavy from start to finish.

If there were an option to have the cream puff heated up just a tad before pumping in the cool custard, I think I'd have trouble stopping myself from converting into a cream puff gal..

excerpts: I got wasn't all that different from other coffee pastries I got before; I bet their green tea would be something more unique.
green tea.author: Julia Z.
green tea.review: Bread papa offers cream puff that comes in a giant size(bigger than my fist) with speciality flavors --green tea, mango, pumpkin, etc. It's a cute idea and the end product is decent, but nothing amazing to me. I have to say I've had better. Perhaps it's because the coffee flavored puff I got wasn't all that different from other coffee pastries I got before; I bet their green tea would be something more unique.

excerpts: They even have a green tea glaze!
We dropped by around noon and it wasn't crowded at all
and there was prompt service.
Would recommend!
green tea.author: Caroline C.
green tea.review: Very tasty cream puffs for a reasonable price! They even have a green tea glaze! We dropped by around noon and it wasn't crowded at all and there was prompt service. Would recommend!

excerpts: I love how they have green tea cream puffs (I'm obsessed with anything green tea).
I love fresh warm tender cream puffs.
I love the rich heavy filling.
green tea.author: Vicki L.
green tea.review:
I love cream puffs. I love how Beard Papa's is conveniently located right in the middle of Downtown. I love how they have a special flavor every day. I love how they have green tea cream puffs (I'm obsessed with anything green tea). I love fresh warm tender cream puffs. I love the rich heavy filling. I love how they melt in your mouth and for a second, you get a taste of heaven.

I don't love how the cream puffs are left out on the counter. I don't love how stale they can become.

I guess the pros outweigh the cons. I'll be coming back more often whenever I have cravings, and boy do I have a lot!

excerpts: My current favorite is the green tea, it's not for everyone
but if you like green tea and cream puffs I think you will enjoy!
green tea.author: Sam M.
green tea.review: Creme puffs are always welcome at a party.  So besides bringing wine, I like to bring a big box of puffs to parties, and they are a hit (so am I when I bring them.) They are fresh and have a nice variety. I usually have a large order so I call ahead (usually a couple of days before a party) and they have never let me down. There is always a variety that are ready to go so if you are heading to a smaller party, you would be fine just stopping in after work.  My current favorite is the green tea, it's not for everyone but if you like green tea and cream puffs I think you will enjoy!

excerpts: Will need to check out the matcha green tea flavor next!
green tea.author: William V.
green tea.review:
It has taken me a while, but these beard papa's have been on my list of things to try since moving to SF 2 years ago. So good! I've had the eclairs with strawberry and with vanilla fillings. Both were excellent. The filling (I think) is the traditional pastry cream plus whipped cream and a flavoring agent (ie strawberry or chocolate). This is more of a diplomate cream instead of a thick pastry cream, which is really nice on a warm day. It tastes almost like an ice cream. 

Will need to check out the matcha green tea flavor next!

excerpts: I had one with a green tea glaze and vanilla filling.
Yum!
green tea.author: Paula H.
green tea.review: The cream puffs are amazing. I had one with a green tea glaze and vanilla filling. Yum!

excerpts: I always end up buying cream puffs at around the same time so I often get the green tea eclair.
Green tea cream goes great with the cookie one too!
green tea.author: Sofia R.
green tea.review:
I freaking LOVE cream puffs! 

I always end up buying cream puffs at around the same time so I often get the green tea eclair. Green tea cream goes great with the cookie one too! 

Just wanted to update my review to remind SFSU students to use their student discount and not let workers tell you they don't have it anymore. Integrity!

excerpts: Today's special was green tea.
Since I wasn't in the mood for an entire puff
Hub ordered his
and I had a taste.
We tried the cookie crumb puff with green tea filling ($2.50).
It didn't taste like much and wasn't sweet at all.
Basically it had no flavor.
I was glad I didn't order one for myself.
green tea.author: Amber S.
green tea.review:
Rolled over here for something sweet after having lunch. I haven't been to a Beard Papa's before but have heard all about it. 

The menu had 3 different puffs to choose from and 2 regular fillings and 1 special filling. Today's special was green tea. Since I wasn't in the mood for an entire puff Hub ordered his and I had a taste. There were a few other items on the menu that weren't puffs. 

If you haven't heard nor been here, you choose the puff and filling flavor and they stuff your puff. 

We tried the cookie crumb puff with green tea filling ($2.50). It didn't taste like much and wasn't sweet at all. Basically it had no flavor. I was glad I didn't order one for myself. The puff wasn't good and neither was the filling.

No future puffs for me. I will stay with cookies, cakes and pies.

excerpts: Their standard flavor is vanilla and chocolate but if you are lucky enough to get some seasonal flavors you could get mango, which is my favorite, or green tea.
I've also seen coffee and caramel but neither interests me.
I just wish they offered more flavors like they do on their website.
I would love to try TARO cream!
You also have 3 choices of puffs.
You can get original, cookie crunch, which is my favorite or chocolate.
I always ask no powered sugar because whenever I bite into these guys I end up inhaling the powdered sugar and start to cough like mad, so I always skip it
but you have to tell them in advance because they won't ask you.
green tea.author: Vinkin Ken T.
green tea.review: There is no other Bay Area bakery that can make cream puffs like Beard Papa's can! You get a fairly large cream puff with 2 pumps of cream filling. But recently I have been asking if I could get an extra pump and they happily did! How awesome is that? Their standard flavor is vanilla and chocolate but if you are lucky enough to get some seasonal flavors you could get mango, which is my favorite, or green tea. I've also seen coffee and caramel but neither interests me. I just wish they offered more flavors like they do on their website. I would love to try TARO cream! You also have 3 choices of puffs. You can get original, cookie crunch, which is my favorite or chocolate. I always ask no powered sugar because whenever I bite into these guys I end up inhaling the powdered sugar and start to cough like mad, so I always skip it but you have to tell them in advance because they won't ask you.

excerpts: I really want to try the Green Tea and Honey Cream Puff, but it wasn't available that day.
Don't worry Beard Papa.
I'll be back for those clouds of heavenliness!
green tea.author: Leslie L.
green tea.review:
After lunch at Wise Sons, we always have to finish with some sweets! Beard Papa is an international Japanese bakery known for their delicious cream puffs. As simple as they may seem, they are bursting in delicious, flavorful cream within...

See how the delicious cream just oozes with happiness?? We ordered the Cookie Crunch Cream Puff. On first bite, you get this cookie crunch on the outside, then the cold, sweet vanilla cream explodes in your mouth. It's really that delicious!

I really want to try the Green Tea and Honey Cream Puff, but it wasn't available that day. Don't worry Beard Papa. I'll be back for those clouds of heavenliness!

excerpts: Green tea?
Pleasantly refreshing.
Pumpkin?
A scrumptious way to celebrate the season.
green tea.author: Vincent L.
green tea.review:
Raji R. and Angela L. are right on the mark with their observations of the not-terribly-overwhelming puff / eclair shells.

But the cream itself is darn good and just right. Not bland, but not overpoweringly sweet. And there are several choices at any given time. Green tea? Pleasantly refreshing. Pumpkin? A scrumptious way to celebrate the season. The chocolate fondant is wholly satisfying too.

Overall, a sweet, yummy treat that's worth a quick stop if you're in the area.

excerpts: Green tea filling!!
I thought it was a weekly special
but I guess it's a daily special?
I got one with a regular puff and it was dusted with green tea powder, yum.
The filling has a relatively strong taste in flavor.
green tea.author: Virginia Y.
green tea.review:
Green tea filling!! I thought it was a weekly special but I guess it's a daily special? I got one with a regular puff and it was dusted with green tea powder, yum. The filling has a relatively strong taste in flavor. As usual, my face gets slobbered with cream.

I also tried the cheesecake stick, it was average compared to the cream puffs. The cheesecake was pretty creamy though. I'd say just stick to the cream puffs.

excerpts: Tried the Cookie Crunch with Green tea filling.
I personally like things sweet and this wasn't sweet =
It was heavy green tea taste for those who like.
The crunch wasn't crunchy.
green tea.author: Benita M.
green tea.review:
Tried the Cookie Crunch with Green tea filling. I personally like things sweet and this wasn't sweet =[. It was heavy green tea taste for those who like. The crunch wasn't crunchy. Kind of disappointed.

Plain with vanilla. Tastes a little like vanilla bean which I like :)

excerpts: Fan favorites are the strawberry and the green tea; I have yet to try any other ones.
green tea.author: Christina S.
green tea.review:
Beard Papa is a beautiful thing. There is also one in the Westfield basement, if you're already in the mall.

I like to take my vanilla filled eclair over to the gardens next door and eat the wonderful pastry while watching children chase pidgeons.

Another wonderful thing about Beard Papa is that there is a different special flavor every day! Fan favorites are the strawberry and the green tea; I have yet to try any other ones.

Also, Beard Papa the character was in Wreck-It Ralph!

excerpts: Trying this for the first time, I settled with the regular type of pastry and bought two to try both the classic  vanilla filling Beard Papa is known for and for the Filling of the Day, Green Tea.
I particularly enjoyed the vanilla more than the green tea, but it's personal preference at that point.
The green tea wasn't too heavy on the flavor either, the right amount.
green tea.author: Ann V.
green tea.review:
They offer different types of cream puffs filling and pastry type. Trying this for the first time, I settled with the regular type of pastry and bought two to try both the classic  vanilla filling Beard Papa is known for and for the Filling of the Day, Green Tea. The filling of the day changes, of course, so all the more reason to go back!

The pastry is delicious. They're the size of the palm of my hands!
 Every bite is full of filling. Not overly sweet but still fulfills any sweet tooth's craving. Seems dense but is so light. Extremely worth it.

I particularly enjoyed the vanilla more than the green tea, but it's personal preference at that point. The green tea wasn't too heavy on the flavor either, the right amount.

The location, as well, has very good service! I could tell the guy behind the counter was having a great day, just jamming out to everything on the music station, and sharing his joy. It's rare but great to see that kind of person working. :)

excerpts:
I ate green tea cream puff! 
I liked it! 
It wasn't so sweet and heavy!
green tea.author: Sachi S.
green tea.review:
I ate green tea cream puff! 
I liked it! It wasn't so sweet and heavy!
I want to try a different one next time!

I didn't know I could use my student ID for discount until I read someone's review....
I'll ask them next time!

excerpts: The next time I visited, I tried the Vanilla again along with the Green Tea.
While I still liked the Vanilla, the Green Tea one wasn't all that special.
I'll stick with the Vanilla!!
I'll definitely come here again to try their other creamy goodies.
green tea.author: Rodney H.
green tea.review:
Beard Papa is the first cream puff I ever had.  And it was good!!  Took me by surprise though, when I took that first bite into that Vanilla Cream Puff, it exploded in my mouth...and everywhere else.  Yeah I made a mess!!  Anyways, I wasn't expecting the cream to be cool, so that was a pleasant texture and it wasn't extremely sweet, so that complimented the puffy pastry very well.

The next time I visited, I tried the Vanilla again along with the Green Tea.  While I still liked the Vanilla, the Green Tea one wasn't all that special.  I'll stick with the Vanilla!!  I'll definitely come here again to try their other creamy goodies.

excerpts: I had the green tea and vanilla cream puffs.
Both had a good consistency that outdoes anything that you could buy at Costco, yet the flavor within the fillings were pretty bland.
green tea.author: Kevin T.
green tea.review:
Overall Impression: Came in with a sweet tooth, came out slightly disappointed.

Cost: About 3 for each cream puff, and 2 for each cheesecake stick.

Taste: This is a personal opinion, but I thought the cream puffs were mediocre at best. I had the green tea and vanilla cream puffs. Both had a good consistency that outdoes anything that you could buy at Costco, yet the flavor within the fillings were pretty bland. The cheesecake sticks were small and didn't leave a big impression on me. 

Customer Service: It seems like the cashiers were having a long day. They seemed to be in a rush irregardless of the fact that I was the only person in line.

Ambience/Atmosphere: A nice setting to have desserts, even though it didn't satisfy my sweet tooth.

excerpts: Favorite flavors include green tea, chocolate, strawberries & cream, dulce de leche and pumpkin.
green tea.author: Cece E.
green tea.review:
The puffs went poof and disappeared almost as soon as we got them into our greedy hands. Favorite flavors include green tea, chocolate, strawberries & cream, dulce de leche and pumpkin. The cheesecake sticks are also a delicious treat but compared to the cream puffs, I think are a little small for the price.

Right across the street from the Metreon. We usually stop by before or after a movie. We usually buy a few to eat while sitting on the lawn of Yerba Buena Gardens and enjoy their summer concerts.

excerpts: Also try their funky fillings like green tea every once in a while.
green tea.author: Leina K.
green tea.review: Walked in today with a friend that was craving some sweets and was greeted by two friendly guys who recommended their new tiramisu with chocolate oozing out. My friend said it was pretty amazing but I stuck to my favorite chocolate eclair with chocolate filling. Also try their funky fillings like green tea every once in a while.

excerpts: The filling is custardy with a hint of vanilla unless of course, you get the chocolate or green tea variations.
Personally I find the whole tasting experience rather generic.
It's not disgusting, just wholly unmemorable.

There is obviously some master plan to make this chain the next Krispy Kreme, but it seems inherently self-limiting to produce these cream-filled eclairs, disguise them as cream puffs and expect people not to get tired of them at some point.
Papa, can you serve it?
The service is efficient, and the lines are managed to the best of the staff's abilities.
I have only tried the place once, but once was enough.
I prefer my calories in a heartier form.
In fact, I think I'd rather see "Yentl" than have another puff.
Papa, watch me...pass this place by!!!
(...then the orchestra swells... and the end credits roll)
FOOD - 2 stars...
yawn

AMBIANCE - 2 stars...made little impression on me
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...efficient
OVERALL - 2 stars
green tea.author: Ed U.
green tea.review:
Papa, can you see it?

Leave it to the Japanese to come up with a unique way to mix their native ingenuity in packaging with some semblance of European old-world charm. In fact, the cream puff has a double-crusted shell --- the hard exterior is European, and the softer inside is Japanese. I imagine the combination makes it easier to package than the standard open-shell choux that real bakeries use. But honestly, it just looks like a molded fritter.

Papa, can you taste it?

The filling is custardy with a hint of vanilla unless of course, you get the chocolate or green tea variations. Personally I find the whole tasting experience rather generic. It's not disgusting, just wholly unmemorable. There is obviously some master plan to make this chain the next Krispy Kreme, but it seems inherently self-limiting to produce these cream-filled eclairs, disguise them as cream puffs and expect people not to get tired of them at some point.

Papa, can you serve it?

The service is efficient, and the lines are managed to the best of the staff's abilities. I have only tried the place once, but once was enough. I prefer my calories in a heartier form. In fact, I think I'd rather see "Yentl" than have another puff.

Papa, watch me...pass this place by!!! (...then the orchestra swells... and the end credits roll)

FOOD - 2 stars...yawn 
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...made little impression on me
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...efficient
OVERALL - 2 stars

excerpts: It was refreshing to get a green tea cream puff after so many years of not having one.
The service at this location was bad, but after few times telling them I didn't want sugar on my puff
I finally was able to enjoy it.
green tea.author: Vanessa S.
green tea.review: Oh I miss this place on the east coast since they have all seem to vanish. It was refreshing to get a green tea cream puff after so many years of not having one. The service at this location was bad, but after few times telling them I didn't want sugar on my puff I finally was able to enjoy it.

excerpts: Vanilla and green tea are my favorite flavors of creme puffs.
After ordering the creme puffs, it doesn't take long for them to come out with your order so you don't have to wait too long.
The outside is fluffy and flakey (but not hard) with the gooey creamy deliciousness on the inside.
green tea.author: Thomas N.
green tea.review:
Hands down this place makes the BEST creme puffs I've ever had. They have an amazing variety of flavors that you can choose from. Whenever I come here, I end up buying at least 6, solely for myself. :) Vanilla and green tea are my favorite flavors of creme puffs. After ordering the creme puffs, it doesn't take long for them to come out with your order so you don't have to wait too long. The outside is fluffy and flakey (but not hard) with the gooey creamy deliciousness on the inside. It's the perfect combination of textures and flavors! 

I would definitely recommend Beard Papa's if you're ever in the San Francisco area. Although street parking may be hard to find, there is a parking garage across the street that is fairly inexpensive.

excerpts: I order one French coffee, they gave me green tea!
I wanna change back my coffee, they didn't !
They think that it is my fault!
It is ridiculous !
Their waiter just can understand Spanish!
They don't understand English!
Really terrible!
Don't go this shop!
green tea.author: Angela D.
green tea.review: It is a terrible shop ! I order one French coffee, they gave me green tea! I wanna change back my coffee, they didn't ! They think that it is my fault! It is ridiculous ! Their waiter just can understand Spanish! They don't understand English! Really terrible! Don't go this shop!

excerpts: The cocoa puff choux with green tea cream was really good.
I can't wait to try the mango flavor.
green tea.author: Sherry L.
green tea.review: They have additional flavors and the cocoa puff choux here than the Westfield location. The cocoa puff choux with green tea cream was really good. I can't wait to try the mango flavor.

excerpts: Weekly Flavors are: Caramel, Coffee / Tiramisu, Green Tea, Pumpkin and Strawberry.
I  was debating on whether to try the Green Tea or the Vanilla Bean, but after a long tough decision, I've gone with the Vanilla Bean Cookie Ccrunch Puff.
Sooo good.
Crunchy exterior, and creamy and sweet interior.
Mmm~
green tea.author: Mona C.
green tea.review:
4.5 Stars

+ Yummy
+ Fresh Ingredients 
+ Friendly Service
+ Clean

- So Fatty :(

LOVE Beard Papas!!! Came here with 2 of my buddies while waiting for a movie to start which wasn't in another hour and half or so. There were no line when we got here. Yes!!

I've been to other Beard Papa locations, and I gotta say, this is the best one yet! There were so much to choose from but the first thing that caught my eyes were the cream puffs. The "Daily Flavors" are: Vanilla Bean and Chocolate. Weekly Flavors are: Caramel, Coffee / Tiramisu, Green Tea, Pumpkin and Strawberry. (1 for $2.25, 6 for $11.00, 12 for $22.00)

Everything looked so tasty! I  was debating on whether to try the Green Tea or the Vanilla Bean, but after a long tough decision, I've gone with the Vanilla Bean Cookie Ccrunch Puff. Sooo good. Crunchy exterior, and creamy and sweet interior. Mmm~ Kinda regret not ordering a dozen to go...

For mango lovers, my buddy Steph recommended me the Mango Ice Shower! Shaved ice, mango sauce, topped with fresh mangoes. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

Will be back to try all the other flavors! :D

excerpts: puff with green tea filling...
the puff was dusted with green tea powdered sugar too.
green tea.author: Sunny T.
green tea.review:
2.25 stars to be generous b/c that's the price of a cream puff.

I really wanted to like Beard Papa. It made me think of Papa Smurf... but I didn't like the cream puffs as much as I like the 1980s little blue cartoons. 

* FAB location next to Schoggi chocolates of Switzerland... and nice clean design, like a factory tour: video of how cream puffs are made and clear glass, so you can see the workers make your order. Chocolate and regular puffs sit on trays; the drill pump device injects cream into the puff.

* BEST aroma -- baked goody smell. Cool concept: vanilla, chocolate, or the cream flavor of the week (changed on Fridays). At the beginning of the week, I got a reg. puff with green tea filling... the puff was dusted with green tea powdered sugar too. OK taste, not too sweet -- but not addictive as other Yelpers make it seem.

* I visited on a second occasion to test consistency of the quality. Customer service was lacking both times. If workers are not pleasant, it dampens my enthusiasm for your treats. 

** BTW when you saw that I was NOT HAPPY (but DISAPPOINTED) with my order (b/c you didn't read it back to me and I got something different than what I intended -- and I didn't even bite into the puff) you SHOULD HAVE offered me what I wanted: a baked chocolate puff filled with coffee cream, the flavor of the week. 

What I got: a regular puff with chocolate cream filling. 

Note: There's a Beard Papa's in the food court of the Westfield San Francisco center at 5th Street and Market... but the mall setting really cramps the magical factory feeling. They sell the same widgets anyway.

They also sell "sticks" of cheesecake. Picture a slightly skinner stick of butter, but made of cheesecake -- not butter. It would be more cool if it was cheesecake on a stick. If you offer this, please send me royalty checks.

excerpts: Ive tried the vanilla, chocolate, green tea and something else
and they were all good.
A cream puff is basically like a sweet pie outside with flavored cream on the outside and topped with some powdered sugar.
On a hot day theyre real refreshing, but dont save them
green tea.author: Tim M.
green tea.review:
For the price of their cream puffs they may not seem worth it but they are dang good! I wish they had seasonal flavors which would be pretty cool but what they have now works well.

Ive tried the vanilla, chocolate, green tea and something else and they were all good. A cream puff is basically like a sweet pie outside with flavored cream on the outside and topped with some powdered sugar. On a hot day theyre real refreshing, but dont save them cause they'll get soggy.

Oh, they can be messy for children... eh and adults. The sugar will get on you and if you dont bite it right so will the cream... watch out!

excerpts: I love the green tea and the strawberry puffs!!
green tea.author: Angela K.
green tea.review:
I love the green tea and the strawberry puffs!! 

Vanilla are always a safe bet though, especially if its your first time. 

I like this location because it doesn't get as busy, it seems more clean and the staff is relatively friendly. 

The cheesecake and tiramisu sticks here are omg good too!

excerpts: So I have had the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, green tea....the eclair.
There have been so many flavors over the years that I can't keep track.
green tea.author: PNotHere E.
green tea.review:
I first had Beard Papa in Oahu when I went back about 10 or so years back.  It was longer than 10 years but who's counting?  Whenever I get into San Francisco close to the Metreon and Yerba Buena I usually at the very minimum go in the doors and look.  I sometimes don't purchase anything but usually I get at least one.  

So I have had the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, green tea....the eclair.  There have been so many flavors over the years that I can't keep track.  I'd venture to guess I have had all their flavors somehow in the past 10 years. 

This location is nice as it sits across the street from Yerba Buena where you can bring your cream puffs, find a place to sit and relax with your sinful treat.  They are light, fluffy and the cool to cold filling that is placed into the flaky ball really hits the spot.  The price seems a bit outrageous but these are pretty fresh and, in my opinion, well worth going to try and possibly bring home.  

They are sinfully good...so much that there is a church less than 100 feet away to confess your sins.  

Get one or three.  They won't last long.

excerpts: They have blueberry yogurt and green tea and mini ice cream filled puffs.
I met up with a friend who was in Hong Kong the week before and she told me the Beard Papa's there had fresh fruit flavors!
Ohhh man.
Why can't they have such flavors here?!?!?
WHY?!??
green tea.author: Tiffany V.
green tea.review:
The first time I had these, my grandma bought them for me. Sooo good.

Went there again with some friends in high school and I bought them cream puffs and their cheesecake thingie. The cashier guy was so nice and he gave me 3 beard papa cell phone charms for being so nice to my friends! They were the cutest things ever! I have no idea where they are now though and my cell phone at the time didn't have the little hook thingie to put charms on. 

I've been lucky enough to go to the Beard Papa's in Shanghai and let me tell you. HOLYCRAPA;DFA;DFAFMOSTAMAZINGCREAMPUFFFLAVORS EVER. 

They have blueberry yogurt and green tea and mini ice cream filled puffs. I met up with a friend who was in Hong Kong the week before and she told me the Beard Papa's there had fresh fruit flavors! Ohhh man. Why can't they have such flavors here?!?!? WHY?!??

excerpts: Flavors include vanilla and green tea.
green tea.author: Barbara B.
green tea.review:
I don't eat a lot of sweets, but I try to make a point of going to Beard Papa's at least once a year (I live 150 miles away). 

Crunchy, creamy, delicious... and so hard to decide which flavor to choose this time! I can never eat more eclair or cream puff  than one because they're so rich and messy. The cream puffs are unfilled - customers choose the filling they want, which is injected at the time. Flavors include vanilla and green tea. 

There are several locations in San Francisco, but this is the only one I've tried.

excerpts: First of all, I paid for two puffs and dared to try the green tea filling which is hit or miss with me.
Complete MISS on the green tea but liked the cookie crunch addition.
Whatever, fine.
green tea.author: Rachel C.
green tea.review:
Cream puffs are a delectable treat but the SERVERS ARE RUDE AND DON'T EVER COME TO THIS LOCATION AGAIN!

I was so excited to show off the place for a first-timer only to be talked shit about in a different language! First of all, I paid for two puffs and dared to try the green tea filling which is hit or miss with me. Complete MISS on the green tea but liked the cookie crunch addition. Whatever, fine. I'd give it four stars. 

However, the cause for losing stars is when the cashier "accidentally drops" my coin change by the tip jar and maybe I'm stretching this one part with her hand placed over the tip jar with a stare as she did the drop. Regardless, customer service is lacking in never apologizing about dropping the change nor phased about the exchange of money. It was an awkward moment but when she calls out the order in Spanish, literally translates to..."make these puffs for these assholes who don't tip!"

WHAT?!!  Yeah lady, while we may not look like who you'd expect to understand Spanish as my companion and I both looked at each other with the flabbergasted "did you catch that too?" look. I'm sure this isn't the first incident and it really annoyed me the rest of the day that after the whole ordeal, I wasn't excited about eating it. The place was also not busy at all to excuse the lack of overflowing creamy goodness from each bite.

I'm all for tipping people in the food industry because they work hard but sorry, talking shit about it and also not fulling the puff completely, wow! No wonder I had a "special order." Please be tactful and don't scam people, don't "drop hints" expecting to be tipped and then make the customer insulted for not getting their money's worth.

excerpts: They have vanilla and chocolate, strawberry whipped cream, green tea, cookie crumble.
They also have chocolate fondant, and they sell some pretty Asian things as well like Pocky, Hi Chews, and Calipco.
green tea.author: Grace Y.
green tea.review:
Hello!!! Addictingly good! The only downside to this place is the horrible amount of calories consumed because it's hard to just have one. Oh and also when you unwrap one of them and get it close to your mouth, if you choose to inhale before you bite, you get a nose full of powdered sugar. So beware! 

They have CUSTARD filled cream puffs. That's right. CUSTARD. Can you tell that I really like CUSTARD?! They have vanilla and chocolate, strawberry whipped cream, green tea, cookie crumble. They also have chocolate fondant, and they sell some pretty Asian things as well like Pocky, Hi Chews, and Calipco. 

I made the mistake of buying a dozen once. Guess who ate the dozen? 

Mainly me. I think I managed to give away 2, but the other 10 I inhaled over the next 3 days. Grumble.

excerpts: They have a great selection of flavors (when I was in: Vanilla, Chocolate, Pumpkin, Mango, Strawberry, Green Tea) as well as different shells (Original, Chocolate Covered and Cookie Crunch).
green tea.author: Amanda G.
green tea.review:
Let's be honest, as soon as I started writing this review I started drooling on my keyboard.  Let's think about it this way - do you like dessert? Mm, sure you do - it's amazing! Do you like your desserts made fresh to order? Well, you're in luck - Beard Papa's doesn't fill their crispy creme puffs until you order!  They have a great selection of flavors (when I was in: Vanilla, Chocolate, Pumpkin, Mango, Strawberry, Green Tea) as well as different shells (Original, Chocolate Covered and Cookie Crunch).

If you're visiting SF, put it on your to do list; and if you live in SF, you have absolutely no excuse not to go!

excerpts: Flavors I've tried are the vanilla, chocolate, coffee and matcha (green tea), and I really loved every single one of those, especially the matcha!
green tea.author: Valerie R.
green tea.review:
Whenever I'm hanging out around Downtown SF, I try to make a point to visit Beard Papa's!  Their cream puffs are so, so, soooo delicious! The play on textures with the crispy pastry and the velvety cream filling is such a win!combination.  Also, one cream puff is really filling, so the price, I think, is appropriate. Flavors I've tried are the vanilla, chocolate, coffee and matcha (green tea), and I really loved every single one of those, especially the matcha!

I've also tried the cheesecake sticks. A slice of cheesecake is usually a bit too heavy for me, so these sticks are the perfect size to fulfill a craving for cheesecake! They're not overly sweet, and they've got just the right amount of crust to filling.

In anycase, make sure to grab several napkins if you decide to just go for the cream puffs!! Tryin to eat a cream puff without spilling all over is an art I have yet to manage!

excerpts: "D" got a green tea cream puff and loved loved it.
green tea.author: Rinky N.
green tea.review:
I had to do an update of BP.  It was one of the first places I Yelped as a newbie Yelper.  

I returned to BP with my good bud, D,  She had never been there before!
We went there on a Friday afternoon and there wasn't a line!  

I got a cookie crust cream puff shell with chocolate mouseey filling (of course).......yum!

Sorry to hear some Yelpers had runny fillings...ugh! 

I just got one though I could have eaten more.

"D" got a green tea cream puff and loved loved it.

The people who work here are so nice.  It would have been easy for me to have ordered at least 100 more but since I am the only one in my household who would eat them, I restrained myself......this time.

I of course was completely mesmerized by the video of the whole cream puff process.  It's hard to believe that I haven't been brainwashed at some point in my life since I am so easily entranced by anything on video or tv or movie.  Or maybe I have......?

excerpts: GREEN TEA CREAM PUFF!
I've only ever been to beard papa once, so when I happened to end up here on an adventure and heard about the new green tea filling, I decided I wanted to try it.
green tea.author: Darren C.
green tea.review:
GREEN TEA CREAM PUFF! I've only ever been to beard papa once, so when I happened to end up here on an adventure and heard about the new green tea filling, I decided I wanted to try it.

Eating it was a delicious mess. I couldn't stop the cream from exploding everywhere after biting into it but the taste was amazing. Not too sweet with nice subtle flavors, I thought it was a fantastic cream puff. I only bought one this time, but it was good enough that I would probably buy multiple to bring home next time.

excerpts: I've tried the green tea, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla one.
I love all the flavors.
My favorite is the chocolate one because it's so delicious and flavorful.
It's very creamy and the family loves when I bring some back.
They taste even better the next day.
It's so refreshing for breakfast.
green tea.author: Natalie M.
green tea.review:
I LOVE Beard Papa's.

They are yummy yummy cream puffs. It's about $11 for half a dozen (or something like that) and $2.25 for one cream puff. A little pricey but they are sooo yummy. I've tried the green tea, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla one. I love all the flavors. My favorite is the chocolate one because it's so delicious and flavorful. It's very creamy and the family loves when I bring some back. They taste even better the next day. It's so refreshing for breakfast. Just writing about it makes me want to go out and get some!

Definitely recommend this place.

excerpts: But what I like about this place is that they have daily special flavors and when i came the flavor was GREEN TEA!
Woot woot :]
I love green tea flavored things
so i just had to order one.
Anyways, my green tea cream puff was good.
Not great but good.
It wasn't a really sweet green tea flavor but more like Matcha, sorta.
It was 'earthy' and mildly sweet.
green tea.author: Michael N.
green tea.review:
I was having a cream puff craving and had recently tried a different place for their puffs so i wanted to come here to try Papa's puffs. Again. 

I tried this place before and always thought the puffs were delicious but this time I was using Yelp and wanted to compare this place with another set of puffs i had recently tried.

Their puffs are BIG. The powdered sugar on top is good but could be a little too much for me. The original and chocolate are both delicious. But what I like about this place is that they have daily special flavors and when i came the flavor was GREEN TEA! Woot woot :] I love green tea flavored things so i just had to order one. There were no more COOKIE CRUNCH shells when i ordered but my friend, who came later, ordered a chocolate cream puff with the cookie crunch shell and it was yummy. The shell was hard and tasted a bit like cookies, not definitely. Anyways, my green tea cream puff was good. Not great but good. It wasn't a really sweet green tea flavor but more like Matcha, sorta. It was 'earthy' and mildly sweet. I cannot wait to try Caramel and Strawberry.

I am most def. coming back here and i recommend people to come here to try it out.

excerpts: I have tried the green tea, the chocolate, the vanilla, but this was my first time trying the strawberry.
green tea.author: Wendy L.
green tea.review:
I have discovered a new favorite flavor...strawberry. I have tried the green tea, the chocolate, the vanilla, but this was my first time trying the strawberry.

Here's something to be aware though...They have rotating flavors of the week. But I did not know their idea of a week runs from Friday through Thursday (not Monday through Saturday, not Sunday through Saturday...yes, their week starts on a Friday). So off I went today (Friday), because I knew their flavor of the week was mango, but I was disappointed when I was told "Oh that was last week. Yesterday was the last day." I was totally scratching my head thinking, Last week? Last week? But yesterday was Thursday?

So I ended up missing the mango flavor because I went on a Friday and they had rotated the next flavor of the week to strawberry already. I still wanna try the mango one...never had the opportunity, but the strawberry is my new favorite flavor now.

Oh, they have their special flavors of the week (for the entire year!) posted online. Check it out if you wanna plan accordingly.

excerpts: So I did not get the green tea filling.
They have daily filling different every day maybe.
And restroom is out of order.
Felt bad that cannot wash hands before eating.
And also worried about how their employees wash their hands.
green tea.author: Tina Q.
green tea.review: Not as fancy as I thought. $3.40 for a cookie crunch puff. Also, not all the fillings are available daily. So I did not get the green tea filling. They have daily filling different every day maybe. And restroom is out of order. Felt bad that cannot wash hands before eating. And also worried about how their employees wash their hands.

excerpts: I like that they have a few different varieties of puffs, you can get things like green tea and mango - but we opted just for chocolate and vanilla.
Watching them fill the pastry puffs was also fairly entrancing, perhaps indicative of the sugar coma that was to ensue.
They were tasty, to be sure.
I didn't, like, totally flip out over them, but perhaps I'm not a cream puff kinda gal.
Maybe I should go back...
green tea.author: Becca S.
green tea.review:
Working in SOMA, I had passed Bear Papa many times, unable to shake the dirty feeling I got from the term "mango ice shower."  One day, inevitably, it was time to stop in and try the puffs.

Beard Papa's is definitely your standard fast-food-type joint, and I wouldn't really advocate eating there unless you're feeling particularly insouciant about ambiance. (2/3 etymologically French words, go me!)  But nobody really does that.  They grab their loot, their dirty, dirty secrets, and go.  We did the same.

I like that they have a few different varieties of puffs, you can get things like green tea and mango - but we opted just for chocolate and vanilla.  Watching them fill the pastry puffs was also fairly entrancing, perhaps indicative of the sugar coma that was to ensue.  They were tasty, to be sure.  I didn't, like, totally flip out over them, but perhaps I'm not a cream puff kinda gal.  Maybe I should go back...

excerpts: Tried the green tea and thought it was strange.
I did enjoy the vanilla filling although the pastry part left me feeling a little plain.
Was too stuffed to eat anymore
