, so we gave the remaining 6 cream puffs along with my giant cup of coffee to a homeless guy outside of the establishment.
green tea.author: Bren C.
green tea.review:
Guess I'm not a cream puff kind of person. Was disappointed because we had a $22.00 Groupon and could not use it to buy their Beard Papa's bag. Could only spend it on food. 2 people buying $22.00 worth of cream puffs? 

Tried the green tea and thought it was strange. I did enjoy the vanilla filling although the pastry part left me feeling a little plain. Was too stuffed to eat anymore, so we gave the remaining 6 cream puffs along with my giant cup of coffee to a homeless guy outside of the establishment. He was quite grateful, so I felt good about the experience after all. 

The lady behind the counter who fills the cream puffs and brews the coffee and tea worked at an incredible rate, which was pretty impressive. Found it difficult to communicate with the person who took our order--a language barrier thing; however, we did keep chaning our order to maximize our Groupon and she remained patient.

excerpts: Next up to bat: green tea (if I was going to try Beard Papa's, I wasn't going to half-ass it).
Okay.
Not a fan of the green tea.
A little bitter.
Actually, a little too much like, well, green tea.
I mean, I like my green tea ice cream, but the cream puff definitely didn't do it for me.
green tea.author: Vic C.
green tea.review:
After hearing about the craze in NYC, I headed over to this joint a couple weeks after it hit SF. I sat there waiting, and waiting, and waiting as the aromas engulfed me. Man, I think right there, the waiting hypes these little guys up more than anything. 

I finally get my hands onto one of 'em and take a bite. Oh, what deliciousness. Soft and chewy. Yum. Okay, arguably, not worth the price tag. 

And... I'm a sucker for really, really sweet things (icing out of a can, anyone?). So maybe these weren't quite sweet enough. But still tasty. I mean, those Japanese know their desserts (mochi?). 

Except then I dig into a chocolate puff. Decent. But I'm not a huge chocolate flavor fan - so maybe I'm just not appreciating it all. Next up to bat: green tea (if I was going to try Beard Papa's, I wasn't going to half-ass it). Okay. Not a fan of the green tea. A little bitter. Actually, a little too much like, well, green tea. I mean, I like my green tea ice cream, but the cream puff definitely didn't do it for me. 

My rating out of 5: 
Taste: 3 overall (4 for vanilla)
Price: 1.5
Service: 3.5

Final thoughts? I wish SF had a Dunkin' Donuts.

excerpts: but there is always chocolate cream and a special flavor such as green tea or mango.
Buy two or you'll be sorry.
green tea.author: Kate N.
green tea.review: My teenagers' favorite pastry. We have to stop by for the world's best cream puffs whenever we are in the neighborhood. We will actually pay to park in the nearby garage if we have driven, but this location is near the BART (and the other one is down in the food court at the nearby shopping center practically in the BART station) so that's the best way to go.  Vanilla is the best- I don't need all the fancy stuff- but there is always chocolate cream and a special flavor such as green tea or mango. Buy two or you'll be sorry.

excerpts: I've tried these flavors: Vanilla (original), Chocolate, Caramel, and Green Tea.
All of us at work agree that the vanilla is the best, though.
The Green Tea isn't too bad, but it's more mild than the Vanilla (a little smoother, maybe a little less fat).
green tea.author: Helene K.
green tea.review:
My review is the 700th one for Beard Papa's (this listing, anyway). What more can I add to these other 699 reviews?

I don't go into the store much, but Beard Papa's is a favorite at work. My manager and I got a box of cream puffs on Administrative Professionals Day this year, and yesterday, our small staff split a dozen cream puffs amongst ourselves. Mmm mmm. It's safe to say we find the cream puffs quite enjoyable and rewarding!

I've tried these flavors: Vanilla (original), Chocolate, Caramel, and Green Tea. All of us at work agree that the vanilla is the best, though. The Green Tea isn't too bad, but it's more mild than the Vanilla (a little smoother, maybe a little less fat). 

Certainly, one of Beard Papa's cream puffs is best with a cup of black coffee. Beware of the oozing cream when you get towards the middle, though!

I wish I could say more about the actual storefront, but alas, I cannot. I assume their service is decent enough if my boss keeps going back there for more cream puffs.

excerpts: I've tried a few of their flavors, and all of them have been so very tasty (green tea, strawberry, chocolate, vanilla).
They even put real vanilla bean in the vanilla custard, a big plus!
green tea.author: Karen W.
green tea.review: Cream puffs= mmmm!  I've tried a few of their flavors, and all of them have been so very tasty (green tea, strawberry, chocolate, vanilla).  They even put real vanilla bean in the vanilla custard, a big plus!

excerpts: Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee.
green tea.author: Tadashi Y.
green tea.review:
Beard Papa's is owned & operated by the Japanese firm  Muginoho. Their slogan is "Fresh'n natural cream puffs." 

Beard Papa's was opened in 1999 by Yuji Hirota in Osaka, Japan w/ the motto "Pipin' Hot Cream Puffs". Beard Papa's has over 250 stores in Japan & 300 worldwide in countries including  China, Korea, Taiwan, Indonesia, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Canada, & the United States.

Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee. The different flavors are sold on a rotating schedule.

While I like trying each of their flavours, the vanilla original flavour is my favourite. They inject the creamy goodness into the yummy shells to order. The place is imaculately maintained & provide a restroom & outdoor seating. 

There is also another location a block over underneath the Westfield Bloomingdale's Mall, in the food court. 

The name Beard Papa was chosen because the cream puff reminded Yuji of a sailor's beard & he felt that the "Engrish" (disjointed & often unintentionally funny Japanese version of English) title of "Beard Papa" will give Japanese people an American touch, while giving Americans a Japanese touch.

excerpts: We did order the green tea, chocolate, and vanilla.
Green tea usually kind of tastes off when they make it into some other form than tea.
I suggest not trying this.
The chocolate is thick kind of like pudding and the vanilla had the best balance.
green tea.author: Andrew N.
green tea.review:
We were shown this place by some friends. First off, they just make creme puffs and the creme has different flavors. The puffs are already pre-made and just filled to order. There was a line and probably always is, but it moved fast.

I thought their puffs were light so that was a plus, but the creme wasn't super and didnt make up for the cost. They are expensive. I am glad to say I've tried it, but I would not come back.

I am a believe in cheap and good. I don't need all the other frills. This place is expensive and good. But in the end its just a creme puff. 

We did order the green tea, chocolate, and vanilla. They were out of strawberry. Green tea usually kind of tastes off when they make it into some other form than tea. I suggest not trying this. The chocolate is thick kind of like pudding and the vanilla had the best balance.

excerpts: The green tea and pumpkin are interesting, but nothing beats the classics.
green tea.author: Miffy Y.
green tea.review: If only strawberry was a regular flavor! Vanilla bean is a close second and suffices when I'm not feeling their "flavor of the week." The green tea and pumpkin are interesting, but nothing beats the classics.

excerpts: My fave. is the vanilla flavor but they have chocolate, green tea flavors etc.
green tea.author: C A.
green tea.review:
Oh dear vanilla cream puff! I love you. Period.
If you haven't had it, you are wasting your life ... I mean appetite!=)

Warm outside, cold creamy inside and it melts in your mouth. it is probably really bad for you but it tastes so freakin' good. i am a huge fan. i want one right now!..mmm.. maybe i should go get some...holidays as in never ending eating? sigh.

ok, pls. go try and you will see. My fave. is the vanilla flavor but they have chocolate, green tea flavors etc.

excerpts: I still want to try their green tea flavor but its never available when I have gone to the store.
The puffs are filled with your choice of cream when you order.
green tea.author: Alexander L.
green tea.review: These creme puffs are really good. The outside is nice and crisp and the inside is smooth and creamy. You have to eat them fresh or they will get soggy. I still want to try their green tea flavor but its never available when I have gone to the store. The puffs are filled with your choice of cream when you order.

excerpts: I wish they had Green Tea or Strawberry instead of Coffee, those sound yummy.
What I love about these treats that they are just so light and heavenly to indulge!!
The puff pastries are soft with a slight crunch, this is a good thing by adding some texture.
I'm not so fond of over-buttery and sweet custards.
green tea.author: Jing D.
green tea.review:
I love these little divine puffs of heaven!!

I've had Beard Papa one other time in the Westfields Shopping Mall on Market Street, and I remembered it was a delicious treat. So after visiting the Contemporary Jewish Museum and stumbling upon this location in the adjacent alleyway, my friend and I just HAAAD to stop in for some puffs!

The special flavor of the week was Coffee, in addition to your usual Vanilla and Chocolate choosing. I wish they had Green Tea or Strawberry instead of Coffee, those sound yummy. What I love about these treats that they are just so light and heavenly to indulge!! The puff pastries are soft with a slight crunch, this is a good thing by adding some texture. I'm not so fond of over-buttery and sweet custards. I find the cream fillings here to be on the light (and very fresh) side, which I prefer and love. 

I can't help but smile and be joyous when eating these, even as thoughts of them immediately adhering to my waistline creep up every now and then.

excerpts: Rest assured I will be back to try the green tea creme puffs.
green tea.author: Jessica T.
green tea.review: It's hard to say that an hour wait for a simple vanilla cream puff is worth it.....but honestly it was. Beard Papa's Cream Puffs are amazing. The vanilla cream is so rich and flavorful: almost like creme brulee in a delightful light puff pastry. Rest assured I will be back to try the green tea creme puffs.

excerpts: I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, and green tea before..
I think if I had to choose my favorite, it would be the vanilla.
I dig the vanilla cuz there were speckles of vanilla beans in there
green tea.author: Juliane N.
green tea.review:
I think just maybe I'll have to give this place another try. 

I haven't been back for awhile now because when I tried it both times, it wasn't really tasty..

You should NEVER, and I mean NEVER leave cream puff shells out like they do for more then a couple hours.. It gets soft and doesn't have much taste to it..

I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, and green tea before.. I think if I had to choose my favorite, it would be the vanilla. I dig the vanilla cuz there were speckles of vanilla beans in there so you know it was made with real vanilla instead of the extract stuff..

Maybe it would be better if I tried it when they had just finished baking those shells..? 

They are pretty expensive for something so mediocre.. I think now it's like $2.25 per piece!?

excerpts: Can't wait for the Green Tea version.
The shell was crisp and buttery and the filling was like a slightly gelatenous creme anglaise.
green tea.author: Njon W.
green tea.review:
Shatangi had 1. Can't wait for the Green Tea version. The shell was crisp and buttery and the filling was like a slightly gelatenous creme anglaise. I got the last one of a batch and the suckers behind me had to wait for the fresh ones to cool berfore being filled (Haha!).

Shatangi told you

excerpts: Pumpkin and Green Tea options =
Trouble with a capital T!
green tea.author: Mingus R.
green tea.review:
You've heard the phrase, "Tastes so good it makes you wanna slap your mama"? Sorry Moms! Pumpkin and Green Tea options = Trouble with a capital T! Hey ladies, round in the middle can be sexy too!

I didn't have to stand in line so we'll see.

excerpts: But my green tea puff had almost no flavor.
My friend agreed that it had no umph.
We actually threw out half of it because it was so unsatisfactory.
green tea.author: Katie S.
green tea.review:
I love sweet, puffy sugar things.  I love them so soooo much that typing this review I'm drooling.

But I don't love Beard Papa's.  It's cute.  And the puff flavors all sounded amazing.  But my green tea puff had almost no flavor.  My friend agreed that it had no umph.  We actually threw out half of it because it was so unsatisfactory.

excerpts: I tried the green tea.
For some reason, that green tea cream was too runny.
green tea.author: Lolia S.
green tea.review:
You know how some places are so good that you think about them all the time, but know that you shouldn't go all the time?  Beard Papa is one of those places.  In a perfect world, we could eat cream puffs every day.  In reality, no one should.

Beard Papa vanilla cream puffs represent cream puff perfection.  Oh, the double-layered shell is light, delicate and flaky.  You can taste the quality of the rich vanilla custard cream.  Piping in the cream keeps the shell crispy.  Beard Papa has cream puff making down.  The recipe is 200 years old and I imagine it has only gotten better and more consistent over time with the advances in cooking technology.   I know these puffs are not healthy, but they are fresh n' natural :-)

They have some seasonal flavors to keep things interesting.  I'd like to try pumpkin whenever that comes back.  I tried the green tea.  For some reason, that green tea cream was too runny.  I also tried the chocolate which was good, but vanilla (the original) is the best flavor.  

I love the Beard Papa mascot; he reminds me of Papa Smurf. Cute name too - very Japanese.  I loved the Beard Papa story: http://www.muginohousa.com/main.php?nav=the_beard_papas_story

It's cute how he smokes while he's baking.  He's never without his pipe.

Also, the puff doesn't keep well.  It gets soggy.  Eat it right after you purchase it.  This location is larger and better than the one inside the mall (Westfield Shopping Center).

excerpts: They rotate the specialty flavors each week and the ones I can remember off the top of my head are pumpkin and green tea.
Pumpkin flavor BTW was bleh.
I'd rather have a pumpkin pie.
green tea.author: Cindy P.
green tea.review:
A store that only sells cream puffs? I was intrigued. They must be super-amazing-orgasm good, right? Not really.

I went to the Bloomingdale's Beard Papa first--where they only sell vanilla, chocolate, and chocolate eclair flavors. But I noticed this location on Mission was bigger and had specialty flavors so I gave it a shot too.

They rotate the specialty flavors each week and the ones I can remember off the top of my head are pumpkin and green tea. Pumpkin flavor BTW was bleh. I'd rather have a pumpkin pie. Stick with the vanilla or chocolate.

As far as cream puffs go, I like that they are fresh but they are so big that eating them is a HUGE MESS. I guess this would be ok if you have that fetish where you like to be covered in food. I don't. The chocolate eclairs are even messier. I practically needed to take a shower after eating one of those.

In summary, good cream puffs but not good enough to crave. They're comparable to the frozen cream puffs that Trader Joe's sells.

excerpts: Other flavors will include caramel, green tea, and some others.
green tea.author: Michael M.
green tea.review:
A hidden little place near the Metreon.  I bought a half dozen vanilla, as other flavors are NOT AVAILABLE yet.  They told me the chocolate one will be available after Memorial Day.  Other flavors will include caramel, green tea, and some others.  Eclairs will be available soon too.

Anyway, they are a good size puff, and not too sweet.  I brought some to work only for my favorite women here.  Especially the one who will bring me my paycheck.  Gotta favor that one!  My roommate stole one from me in the middle of the night and was waiting as I exited the bathroom after my shower this morning.  Since I am the only one who knows where this place is, I have to bring them home more often ... yeah right.  

Anyway, enjoy them cold from the fridge.  They are maddeningly addicting, and very good!  Custard oozing out all over.  Great with a good strong cup of coffee!

excerpts: Blech, I would recommend avoiding the green tea cream puff.
It leaves a nasty, almost medicinal aftertaste.
green tea.author: DD B.
green tea.review:
Pre-Yelp, I was oblivious to the Beard Papa phenomenon, but having read so many reviews I made a note to try one the next time I was downtown.  Since my trip to Bloomingdale's coincided with a raging sweet tooth attack, today was the day.  Some of the flavors of the day looked interesting, but I went with a regular vanilla cream puff.  I wasn't blown away, but I wasn't disappointed, either.  It's a sweet treat - nothing more, nothing less.  I wouldn't cross town just for a cream puff, and I wouldn't wait longer than five minutes in line for one (OK, maybe ten minutes), but I liked it.  The pastry part was flakey, and the inside was very creamy.  You definitely want to eat them right away so they don't get soggy, but that's just as well, since the last thing I need is the temptation to take home a box of these puppies.

Update: Blech, I would recommend avoiding the green tea cream puff.  It leaves a nasty, almost medicinal aftertaste.

excerpts: I tried the green tea cream puffs and they are SO GOOD!
Tied with vanilla in my book.
green tea.author: Connie C.
green tea.review:
UPDATE 6/23/06: I tried the green tea cream puffs and they are SO GOOD! Tied with vanilla in my book. And if you're in the mood for chocolate, get the double chocolate eclair, much better than just getting the plain chocolate puff. In the span of 4 days, I've paid Papa 3 visits. I see him more than I see my own dad!

UPDATE 6/2/06: Chocolate cream puffs are now available, but the vanilla ones taste way better, and plus they're 20 cents cheaper.

I learned my lesson the first time I went here and had to walk away empty-handed because the wait was too long. This time, I called Beard Papa and asked them what their wait time was. 

"There's no one in line right now."

"What?! Ok, I'll be right there!" 

I hung up the phone and ran out of my office with my coworker, collecting money from others on the way. We practically ran over there, which was actually smart because when we got there, there was only 1 person in front of us. We placed our order and stepped aside. In seconds, 10 people had lined up behind us. When we got our yellow box of cream puffs, we brought them outside and proceeded to indulge in these heavenly puffs. We looked like 2 kids eating with powdered sugar all over our lips and chins. The puff was not warm, but I didn't mind the vanilla custard inside being chilled. It's probably not worth a wait longer than 10 minutes, but it's good enough that you can't just eat one in a sitting.

excerpts: No green tea or chocolate cream yet

, it says Coming Soon....

Update: Tried green tea, caramel but missed the strawberry.....

Hasta La Vista, Baby!

Update: I've tried green tea, caramel, pumpkin, vanilla and chocolate.

Hasta La Vista, Baby!

Update: I've tried green tea, caramel, pumpkin, vanilla and chocolate.
green tea.author: Yan M.
green tea.review:
He is my papa, ok nvm my dad does not have a beard. Beard Papa's is papa of cream puffs, they were delectable! I stood in line yesterday and had to turn away since it was taking too long so I diligently returned today and there was no line at 7:30pm. No green tea or chocolate cream yet, it says Coming Soon....

Update: Tried green tea, caramel but missed the strawberry.....I will be back! Hasta La Vista, Baby!

Update: I've tried green tea, caramel, pumpkin, vanilla and chocolate. Will have to try strawberry and Milk tea to complete the quest! :)

excerpts: Vanilla is my favorite; Chocolate and Green Tea come in second.
Beard Papa's Cream Puffs are probably the Best Commercial made that I have eatten.
I would indulge myself more if it wasn't so rich in calories and fat (about 220 each) I can tell you if you love Cream Puffs
- you need to try Beard Papa.
green tea.author: David H.
green tea.review:
Beard Papa is a chain operation originally from Osaka, Japan (BTW the original location in Osaka is Five Stars). They franchise their locations all over the world. 

Because it is a franchise some locations are better than others and some have more variety of flavors. Depending on how well capitalized the franchisee is the quality of the location, decor and freshnest of the Cream Puffs. In addition to the Osaka location I have been to the few in San Francisco and Los Angeles. This one in on Yerba Buena Lane is one the best out of the LA and San Francisco. 

The original flavor Vanilla is my favorite; Chocolate and Green Tea come in second. Beard Papa's Cream Puffs are probably the Best Commercial made that I have eatten. I would indulge myself more if it wasn't so rich in calories and fat (about 220 each) I can tell you if you love Cream Puffs - you need to try Beard Papa.

excerpts: 'cause I'll be back to place the green tea puff on my tongue very soon. . .
green tea.author: Kia B.
green tea.review:
I was excited!
I wanted to fall head-over-heels in love & return again & again.
I wanted to be S P R U N G!
I waited in line(not long).
I breathed in the enticing aroma.
I watched repeatedly the stupid "sf beard papa arrival" loop were the man of large girth gets a cream shot of goodness all over his face.
But alas,
I am lactose intolerant and the yummy vanilla puff was murder on my tummy.
Hmmm, maybe it was the that+the 2 pints of Hefeweizen  vying for supremacy in a vat of gastric juices.
Whatever! pack the peptol bismol 'cause I'll be back to place the green tea puff on my tongue very soon. . .

excerpts: I love Beard Papa's cream puffs - green tea, vanilla, and chocolate being my top favorites.
Another is the Fondant Au Chocolate - though delicious - was also not as delicious as it could have been.
green tea.author: Nina M.
green tea.review:
I don't know what to say that would be different than anyone else.

Beard Papa originated from Osaka, Japan in 1999 that expanded internationally because of its popularity.

I love Beard Papa's cream puffs - green tea, vanilla, and chocolate being my top favorites.  

I would rate it 5, except I'm not a huge fan of its other products.  The cheesecake is adorable and good to eat, but not as great as the cream puff.  Another is the Fondant Au Chocolate - though delicious - was also not as delicious as it could have been.

excerpts: My favorite is green tea and milk tea.
The milk tea puff is available in San Francisco only.
green tea.review:
I walked by one day and noticed the bright yellow writing on the glass in front. I waited anxiously for opening day to come. Opening day was crazy!!! The line was out the door and down the block. They were handing out samples. I wasn't about to wait in line for that long and decided to come back when things died down a bit. 

They had a promotion going on that first week. Buy 20 cream puffs and get a free thermos. I asked about the thermos and they ran out. I was a lil' disappointed so the guy gave my girlfriend and I a charm for our cell phone. That was nice of him to do that.  

When I tasted that first puff.....oh my!!!! It was sooooo good. It wasn't too sweet. It was perfect!!!! I went back each week to taste all the other flavors. Their flavored cream puffs are "Rotating on a weekly basis". I like all of them except the chocolate one. It tasted funny to me. My favorite is green tea and milk tea. The milk tea puff is available in San Francisco only. The coffee one is available in Redwood City only. 

They have cheesecake sticks for $1.25. It was good but not as good as a regular cheesecake. 

The Fondant Au Chocolat ($2.25) is mouthwatering!!! It's not too sweet either. 

The eclairs cost a little bit more than the cream puffs. I'm not very fond of them. To me, they look exactly like a cream puff except the puff part of the eclair is more dry. And the taste is.....bleh.  This may be only me though.

They had really long lines during the day time and after work for about 6 months. After that, you can just walk in any time of day and wait in line for a few minutes. 

On their website you can see the flavors of the week for San Francisco. I've included a link below.

http://www.beardpapasf.com/flavors_sf.htm 

Go get your puff on!!!!!

EDIT 8/8/07: Just went in and saw they have gotten rid of the milk tea flavor cream puff and replaced it with tiramisu. NOOOO!!!! I really liked the milk tea one. *sob*

excerpts: Funnily enough, I actually really liked the green tea flavour, but then again, I'm one of those people who tries the japanese food that scares my friends silly.
Next time, though, I need to go on the week they have caramel.
MMMMMmmmmmm!!!!
green tea.author: Paula W.
green tea.review:
Just what I need, yet another way to avoid being healthy and slim and all. 

But color me happy, with powered sugar all over my chin, and sticky custard cream all over my fingers.

Funnily enough, I actually really liked the green tea flavour, but then again, I'm one of those people who tries the japanese food that scares my friends silly. Next time, though, I need to go on the week they have caramel. MMMMMmmmmmm!!!!

excerpts: Bring on the Green Tea Puffs!!!!!
THEY HAVE GREEN TEA PUFFS!!!!
They're damn good too!!!!
green tea.author: Marco M.
green tea.review:
Good Lord these are good!!!! Bring on the Green Tea Puffs!!!!! To commemorate my experience, here is a Haiku:

Heavenly Cloud Puffs
How you flow with sweet goodness
My soul is complete.

Update 6/25/06:  THEY HAVE GREEN TEA PUFFS!!!!  They're damn good too!!!!

excerpts: Green tea cream puff - puffalicious.
And messy.
green tea.author: Kate M.
green tea.review:
Green tea cream puff - puffalicious.  And messy.  Good messy, though.  

I like that they've got more than just vanilla now as I heard was the case when they opened - there's a different flavor every day of the week.  What's life without variety?

excerpts: I'm not giving Beard Papa's 5 stars because they never have green tea cream puffs when I am there.
People complain that they don't like the pudding texture of the cream
but I like it just fine.
I think that it tastes healthier and not as sweet as most cream puffs.
The pudding recipe is actually common in Japan.
green tea.author: becky s.
green tea.review:
If it wasn't for Beard Papa's I would never ever go to that boring ass mall. The line here doesn't get horribly long b/c the workers are very efficient at this location. They got this place set up like an assembly line but then again how hard is it to fill cream puffs with the right flavor?

My favorites are the vanilla and pumpkin flavored cream puffs. Chocolate and tiramisu are not all that. I felt that they were bland. The cheesecake sticks are not that great either. They were kinda dry and the taste was off somehow.

I'm not giving Beard Papa's 5 stars because they never have green tea cream puffs when I am there. People complain that they don't like the pudding texture of the cream but I like it just fine. I think that it tastes healthier and not as sweet as most cream puffs. The pudding recipe is actually common in Japan. I had similar cream puffs when I went to Sunshine City. 

Beard Papa is creepy.

excerpts: Van's Must tries : Green tea & pumpkin cream puffs
green tea.author: Van N.
green tea.review:
Quite possibly the best cream puff in the world.  I had a chance to try a few out this past weekend.  The smell of the bakery was enough to get me excited over tasting these delicious pastries.  You have to try!

Van's Must tries : Green tea & pumpkin cream puffs

excerpts: I had a vanilla and a green tea (the flavor of the week) puff less than 5 minutes from when I entered the shop.
Both scrumptious.
Pick one thing (in this case, the titular creampuffs) and do it properly.
Five dreamy stars.
green tea.author: Jeremy W.
green tea.review:
Pulled the pins on this truly whimsical Japanese import tonight and didn't have to wait long. About 6:15/6:20 on a Tuesday night. So it seems like everybody waiting 1/2 hr + for these just needs to plan a visit during off-peak hours. I had a vanilla and a green tea (the flavor of the week) puff less than 5 minutes from when I entered the shop. Both scrumptious. Pick one thing (in this case, the titular creampuffs) and do it properly. 

Five dreamy stars.

EDIT: I have since tried the chocolate and strawberry creampuffs and the eclair. The eclair is just a vanilla creampuff topped with a shell of chocolate, served cold. Not the best eclair I've had, but a tasty when graded as a creampuff. The chocolate creampuff was magic. The strawberry was kind of a drag actually. I mean I finished it and all, but it tasted not really of strawberries and the filling seemed thinner, more watery than the others .

excerpts: it was green tea when I was there.
They're filled/injected with the cream after you order them, so they're fresh & not soggy.
Luckily, when I got there, the line wasn't too long, but while we were sitting outside enjoying our cream puffs, the line grew to twice the length it was when I got there!
green tea.author: Linda T.
green tea.review:
They're like the cream puffs my mom made when I was a kid (except she only made vanilla)!  They offer vanilla, chocolate, & rotate a flavor...it was green tea when I was there.  They're filled/injected with the cream after you order them, so they're fresh & not soggy.  Luckily, when I got there, the line wasn't too long, but while we were sitting outside enjoying our cream puffs, the line grew to twice the length it was when I got there!  They need to open one in the South Bay/Silicon Valley.

This place is basically across the street (Mission) from the Metreon.

excerpts: I'm still waiting for the green tea flavor, but seem to never catch it when I do get that chance..
green tea.author: Wilson L.
green tea.review:
You have to find the time when it's NOT busy to go.. otherwise, expect 30-40 mins for your $2 cream puffs... 

You have to eat it within an hour after they inject the puffs with the creme, otherwise the contrast of crunchyness and creme gets screwed up...

Each week there is a special flavor, like this weeks is Caramel... I'm still waiting for the green tea flavor, but seem to never catch it when I do get that chance..

Just make sure you kick down a dozen of them ans share em with your friends ;)

excerpts: I have tried all the flavors: Green tea (the best ever), chocolate, strawberry, vanilla, pumpkin, milk tea, and caramel.
The vanilla and chocolate flavors are always there, but the other special flavors are weekly specials.
When the week of the green tea puffs came out, I went about three times, and bought more to take home.
Seriously, these creme puffs are fresh, creamy, and each flavor is so delectable.
Each time I bite down, the cream would slowly drip because it is so soft and
Also, try the chocolate fondant too...and tell them to warm it up first :)
green tea.author: Emily P.
green tea.review:
For those who gave Beard Papa's a low score, they went on a bad day, and did not fully enjoy these savory, heavenly cream puffs.  I have tried all the flavors: Green tea (the best ever), chocolate, strawberry, vanilla, pumpkin, milk tea, and caramel.  The vanilla and chocolate flavors are always there, but the other special flavors are weekly specials.  When the week of the green tea puffs came out, I went about three times, and bought more to take home.  Seriously, these creme puffs are fresh, creamy, and each flavor is so delectable.  Each time I bite down, the cream would slowly drip because it is so soft and fresh~~~

Also, try the chocolate fondant too...and tell them to warm it up first :)

Prices: Ranges from $1.75 to $2.10

excerpts: I hope they'll catch up soon, making more creative puffs, like chestnut puffs or at least green tea puffs.
Now there is a new one in Blooming dale on Market.
green tea.author: Yoko S.
green tea.review: I thought it was just average. Cream puffs are extremely popular in Japan, I've eaten so many different puffs better than that. I hope they'll catch up soon, making more creative puffs, like chestnut puffs or at least green tea puffs. Now there is a new one in Blooming dale on Market.

excerpts: Flavors include chocolate, vanilla, green tea, camel-toe, split beaver...
green tea.author: Gracie-C Y.
green tea.review:
Someone once said their favorite food in this world was bearded clams... 

Speaking of beards, if you can't get enough of the above, you'll certainly find these cream puffs an adequate substitute.  Light, creamy, not too sweet, and very erotic.

Flavors include chocolate, vanilla, green tea, camel-toe, split beaver...

excerpts: They have weekly flavors - green tea is a must.
green tea.author: Edgar G.
green tea.review: When I first had Beard Papa's I was blown away. Who would have thought these little desert treats would be such a delicacy? I had to ask where this Beard Papa's was located when a parent at my work brought some for the employees. I've since been here a few times to grab some cream puffs. They have weekly flavors - green tea is a must.

excerpts: I think the green tea is definitely on the list to try sooner than later.
green tea.author: Erin O.
green tea.review:
It's all about the puff here.  No trappings, no nothing.  I mean, it's clean, nothing really wrong, but go in, order, and walk away before you try and buy more.  

These are lovely. I've always enjoyed a good cream puff, not the Chinese weird overly fatty, super sweet, no soul puffs.  I love a Japanese cream puff.  Now note:  for those not of the Asian persuasion, this probably seems weird. I mean, aren't your people lactose intollerant?  Maybe, but we love the French baking, and some things we have elevated to a new level.  White bread for toast, and cream puffs are two of them.  The French have nothing on these.

I got to have a vanilla bean (my favorite thus far), chocolate, and caramel puff.  The chocolate is good, but I'm not a chocolate person.  A touch pudding-like in the middle even.  The caramel was sweet, rich, and buttery in flavor.  The vanilla bean was very vanilla, light, sweet, but not cloyingly so, and just lovely.  The pastry itself was perfectly cooked, and they make them to order in front of you. How cool is that?  They never sit and get soggy.

That's the mark of a good puff, and I'll do it again.  I think the green tea is definitely on the list to try sooner than later.

excerpts: The special green tea cream puffs sent me on a culinary high which lasted a few hours!
I must now wait another five weeks or so for their return.   :D
green tea.author: Daniel C.
green tea.review:
The vanilla cream puffs will enter the hall of pastry fame.  If you try just one of the puffs, vanilla is the port of entry for you.  Few establishments can make divinity out of vanilla, but this bakery has done it.

The chocolate cream puffs, however, look as though someone dumped an ashtray on top of them, and the cocoa is hardly at par with lowly brands such as Hersheys.   The chocolate eclairs should be removed from the menu as well.  

Beard Papa also offers weekly specials, and it is important to do your own taste test once per week.  The special green tea cream puffs sent me on a culinary high which lasted a few hours!   I must now wait another five weeks or so for their return.   :D

excerpts: The guy that helped me told me that they were going to have the green tea flavor next week.
So FYI to anyone that's reading this review right now!
green tea.author: Pippi L.
green tea.review:
After hearing about this place so much, I decided to go ahead and give it a try. Luckily, when I got there, there was no line. I wanted to try the milk tea flavor but since it was not the weekly special, I went for the original vanilla custard. I was debating to myself whether or not I should just get one or buy 6 and take them home. And then, the little voice in my head told me that if i bought the 6, i probably would've just eaten it all by myself and would've regretted it for the day. More like I would've had to force myself on the treadmill for 2 hours to burn all those unwanted calories off. So I just got one.

I have to say, it wasn't anything special. It was good and the pastry was crunchy and it was airy and gooey inside. It took me less than 2 minutes to eat the whole thing. It's like the krispy kreme of cream puffs. Small and not so filling, but good enough to have more. But I'd rather have a more filling cream puff so I wouldn't want to eat any more. I sat out in front and then as I was about to leave a line started forming. I'm glad I got there when I did.  Of course, since it was a windy day I had to take a look in the mirror to make sure I didn't have any gooey gunk on my face. 
The guy that helped me told me that they were going to have the green tea flavor next week.  So FYI to anyone that's reading this review right now! (8/23/06)

excerpts: My favorite is the green tea and vanilla.
The pumpkin is wonderful in the fall too.
I have not ventured into their other treats though since the cream puffs are so yummy.
Not too sweet but very satisfying.
green tea.author: Glenn G.
green tea.review:
Freshly made cream puffs - yum! Need I say more?

Simple and delicate yummy cream puffs. My favorite is the green tea and vanilla. The pumpkin is wonderful in the fall too. I have not ventured into their other treats though since the cream puffs are so yummy. Not too sweet but very satisfying.

excerpts: ... say, green tea?
green tea.author: Desdemona C.
green tea.review:
At first, when this shop opened and there was all this crazy hype, I was like, "what's the big deal?  It's JUST a cream puff."

Well, yes and no.  On some level--yes, it's just a cream puff.  But the shell is crisper than most cream puffs, and although I like my fillings with a touch more custard, this is still pretty good.

The cream puffs are $1.75 good, but not wait-in-line-for-an-hour good.

I might bump it up a star once I try the more novel flavors... say, green tea?

excerpts: I can attest that after experiencing the pumpkin, green tea, strawberries and chocolate flavors, one can literally just "die and go to heaven".
green tea.author: Miles G.
green tea.review:
I sure would be curious to read the other reviews where the creampuffs are likened with great sex. 

I can attest that after experiencing the pumpkin, green tea, strawberries and chocolate flavors, one can literally just "die and go to heaven".

excerpts: I've tried the vanilla and the green tea puffs.
Both were absolutely phenomenal.
The green tea custard took me to heaven and back.
It tasted like the highest quality green tea ice cream in a warmer creamy goodness form with detectable hints of vanilla bean.
They have five rotating flavors of the week - green tea, milk tea, pumpkin, caramel and strawberry.
I just wish I could know the flavor in advanced of arrival.
green tea.author: Sharon R.
green tea.review:
Cream puffs weren't even on my radar before Beard Papa.  But dang people, honestly, the praise for this Japanese cream puff chain could never be played out.  For real.  And their trademark "Beard Papa" (yellow hatted, fluffy gray bearded pipe smoker) is totally cute even if it is the most random.

I've tried the vanilla and the green tea puffs.  Both were absolutely phenomenal.  The green tea custard took me to heaven and back.  It tasted like the highest quality green tea ice cream in a warmer creamy goodness form with detectable hints of vanilla bean.

They have five rotating flavors of the week - green tea, milk tea, pumpkin, caramel and strawberry.  I just wish I could know the flavor in advanced of arrival.  But I guess the suspense is part of the experience.

And they use quality dairy products -- I know, like you can't taste it.  But evidence was had as I was waiting in line for my puff last Friday as the milk man was wheeling in carton upon carton of Clover milk and cream.

excerpts: I especially LOVE the GREEN TEA flavor, 1 out of 5 of their "flavor of the week".
Call ahead to find out what week is the green tea week.
green tea.author: A T.
green tea.review:
This "Cream Puffs" filled with CUSTARD brings me back some childhood memories of my grandma's chocolate custard filled puffs.  I especially LOVE the GREEN TEA flavor, 1 out of 5 of their "flavor of the week".  Call ahead to find out what week is the green tea week.

Note:  Puffs generally made with loads of yolks.  Those watching your cholesterol levels beware.

excerpts: After a pot-luck lunch with some work friends (pork ribs, shrimp patties, meatloaf, stuffing, lentils with sausage), we decided the appropriate ending was a green tea cream puff from Beard Papa.
It's wonderful: some light choux pastry with cream, all dusted over with some green tea powder sugar.

vanilla
green tea
double chocolate
green tea.author: Sooj O.
green tea.review:
Just adding to the chorus here.

After a pot-luck lunch with some work friends (pork ribs, shrimp patties, meatloaf, stuffing, lentils with sausage), we decided the appropriate ending was a green tea cream puff from Beard Papa.  Besides, the few blocks of walking would aid our digestion.

It's wonderful: some light choux pastry with cream, all dusted over with some green tea powder sugar.  And it's a joy to watch the puff pastry move down the short assembly line, anticipating the puff pastry that will land in my grubby clutching hand.

Here's an anomaly: the green tea cream puff is perfect with strong coffee.

So, my favorites would be:
vanilla
green tea
double chocolate

Stay away from Milk Tea.  It's floury.

And there's even more good food for me later in the day.  Yelp Korean Chicken Night!  Yay, gluttony!

excerpts: I'm waiting for something more exciting like green tea... until then green tea cream puff....
green tea.author: Aromy X.
green tea.review:
The little man with the beard and pipe can't help but lure me in... 

Why must I lose every time? I simply can't help it. 

I don't think their "weekly" flavors are really "weekly." I walk by all the time and it's the SAME flavor. PUMPKIN. Why pumpkin? I don't know. I thought pumpkin was only in season in the fall. But they ALWAYS have pumpkin when I walk by. I'm waiting for something more exciting like green tea... until then green tea cream puff....

excerpts: Green tea (a seasonal flavor in San Francisco) or vanilla cream puffs definitely hit the spot after a day of shopping or walking in the city.
green tea.author: Jennifer Y.
green tea.review:
Green tea (a seasonal flavor in San Francisco) or vanilla cream puffs definitely hit the spot after a day of shopping or walking in the city.  One star taken off for the flakiness of the puff, but perhaps I'm biased after having the ultimate cream puff (a creamy, thick cream puff that only has about 2000 calories per puff) at a Vietnamese pho place in Seattle for years.  

I'd say Beard Papa hits the spot in terms of puffs!. :D

excerpts:
My friend purchased half a dozen specialty cream puffs -- green tea -- for about $12.

The green tea puffs had a much more pronounced flavor in the custard.
green tea.author: Michelle N.
green tea.review:
When I first heard Beard Papa was coming to San Francisco, I was very excited. By all accounts, their cream puffs were supposed to be the best cream puffs around, with the Japanese tailored taste improving the already yummy European cream puff. I'd heard stories about people who'd brave the lines in New York to bring home a container of Beard Papa's for their friends.

I had not gotten a chance to get out to Beard Papa when it opened. Then last night, I found myself in the city and my friend asked me if we wanted to stop by Beard Papa's. I immediately said yes and we found ourselves at Yerba Buena Lane. The line wasn't too long -- only four or five people in front of us on a Thursday night. I got myself a cream puff and then purchased a box of 6 ($10) for my husband and friend who were at home. My friend purchased half a dozen specialty cream puffs -- green tea -- for about $12.

Truthfully, I found the puff a bit wanting. The fabled double-layer pastry -- choux and pie crust -- didn't live up to my expectations. For something so highly touted, I would have expected a more delectable crust, slightly chewy from the choux with a little bit of bite and body from the pie crust. I don't know if mine weren't as fresh out of the oven but they were lacking in the flavor and the texture category, with the pie crust adding an unexpected bit of salt which really threw me off. The sprinkling of powdered sugar did very little to enhance the flavor.

The whipped cream custard, so proudly advertised as having lots of vanilla beans in it, was similarly lacking. The taste of the custard was not too sweet and tasted more like sweet cream with the body of a very light custard. I found it much "flatter" than I normally like my cream puffs. I found very few vanilla beans but moreover, I couldn't taste them at all. The green tea puffs had a much more pronounced flavor in the custard.

Don't get me wrong -- the cream puffs are good and there are certainly MUCH worse cream puffs to be had in the Bay Area. But don't believe the hype. These cream puffs are NOT godlike and they certainly are NOT worth a special trip into the city.

excerpts: I come there, it's always "Green Tea week
" and I'm like, "Really?
REALLY?
I wonder if anyone ever orders that flavor.
I mean, come on...why not just MAKE the caramel an everyday flavor.
green tea.author: Nicolas H.
green tea.review:
An ode to Beard Papa's Cream Puffs...

YOU FUCKING ROCK!!!

Ok...I'm obviously not good at writing ode's...though in all honesty, I'm not sure what makes an ode...well, an ode.

Anyways, it's good. I wish that they had more flavors though. I mean, EVERYTIME I come there, it's always "Green Tea week" and I'm like, "Really? REALLY?" I wonder if anyone ever orders that flavor. I mean, come on...why not just MAKE the caramel an everyday flavor. Now that would be all out goodness.

This place is wonderful though. I don't think there was ever a time when I left here disappointed. I mean, it's that good. If you've never bearded your papa...you're missing out on an orgasmic experience.

Orgasmic people...come on...you can't beat that...well, you could...but not with cream puffs...

excerpts: They did have green tea and chocolate but decided against it.
Anyways, the puffs were nice and dense, very light with a baked crunch.
They fill the filling in as you order.
I ate one as soon as my ride came around.
It was gooood!!!
You have to be a dairy person, cause you do feel the dairy effects afterwards.
green tea.author: Leslie Y.
green tea.review: I have been wanting to try this for the longest time.  So I rewarded myself for my birthday yesterday.  2.25 for one puff and 11.00 for six.  I ordered 6 with vanilla.  They did have green tea and chocolate but decided against it.  Anyways, the puffs were nice and dense, very light with a baked crunch.  They fill the filling in as you order.  I ate one as soon as my ride came around.  It was gooood!!!  You have to be a dairy person, cause you do feel the dairy effects afterwards.  I think next time I will try the other few cake slices they have, like the cheesecake and tiramisu.  I think I had enough puffs for the rest of the year,  I ate the last two today!!!  lol

excerpts: I have tried the Pumpkin, Chocolate and Green Tea
(all good) but hands down the Vanilla Bean is the BEST.
green tea.author: Sarah S.
green tea.review:
I don't understand why all these Yelpers are writing about Beard Papa's other deserts. Obviously they are famous for their cream puffs and eclairs... so why would you go there and have anything else? Its like going to Italy and only eating Chinese food, it just doesn't make sense.

Their cream puffs are pretty good. I tried the Yerba Buena location first. But once Beard Papa's came to the mall I decided that they would be my treat to myself every time I made it through a long day of shopping (sometimes I end up buying two then going home and trying on my clothes again and not fitting into them, I suspect, because I had two).

Get the Vanilla Bean. I have tried the Pumpkin, Chocolate and Green Tea (all good) but hands down the Vanilla Bean is the BEST. They are super good on a hot day, or a cold winter day with a cup of coffee. 

I would give them 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't operate that way so I am erring on the side of generosity and giving them four stars. Stick to the cream puffs (specifically the vanilla ones).

-----------------------------------------------------------------
So I changed my mind, despite being good I have demoted them to three stars until the can prove to me that they really want that fourth.

excerpts: I had the chocolate and the vanilla, and i CANNOT wait to try the green tea and the cheesecake sticks, and whatever other goodies they have.
green tea.author: Janet R.
green tea.review:
I LOVE cream puffs.  I used to love when I went to my mom's house and she had the big tubs of the one from Costco, I would sit there and eat them until i felt like puking.  Then half an hour later, I wanted more.
WIth Beard Papas, I LOVE them, and I think I kept eating them until I passed out from sugar overload.  I had the chocolate and the vanilla, and i CANNOT wait to try the green tea and the cheesecake sticks, and whatever other goodies they have.

excerpts: So I got Caramel (when I was actually craving Green Tea) and BF got Vanilla Bean (when he was craving Strawberry).
Filling in each cream puff can be overwhelmingly sweet and may be messy when eating due to the quantity of cream injected into the puff.
They inject the cream from a machine right in front of you,too!
green tea.author: Lisa C.
green tea.review:
Pros: Place is modernly designed with friendly and efficient service, and not busy when we went around opening hours (10AM-ish). 
Cons: Limited to flavor selections. Keep in mind they always have one special flavor per week. So I got Caramel (when I was actually craving Green Tea) and BF got Vanilla Bean (when he was craving Strawberry). 
** Filling in each cream puff can be overwhelmingly sweet and may be messy when eating due to the quantity of cream injected into the puff. They inject the cream from a machine right in front of you,too!

excerpts: They offer  3 types of cream filling (green tea, vanilla, chocolate) in the puffs or eclairs.
I only realized this when the cashier asked.
green tea.author: Aileen A.
green tea.review:
Best Chocolate Eclair (with Vanilla filling) I've ever eaten. However, that's if you wait 5-10 minutes for it to "thaw" out a little. I got it a little cold, didn't get it fresh from the oven. They should seriously consider changing the fridge temperature or think about making less puffs so that there's not a lot of excess to chill up. 

Despite that, the eclair was delicious!

Cream puffs were just okay, puff too crunchy (tasted like crackers for a sec)-not flakey like most-but super generous with the filling.

They offer  3 types of cream filling (green tea, vanilla, chocolate) in the puffs or eclairs. I only realized this when the cashier asked. I'm not sure I saw these choices on the menu.

Other desserts they offer are cheesecake sticks-if you're on the go and don't want cream filling dripping all over, and chocolate au fondant. Other locations offer mango ice shower, mochi, and Mont Blanc. 

For beverages: tea, coffee, vitamin water (no formula fiddy though!), etc. I wish they had some iced mocha-chocolate frappes to go down with my eclairs...

Not worth the travel, but worth the two block walk if you happen to be around the neighborhood...

excerpts: Hopefully the next time I'm there, I can try the pumpkin and green tea!
YUM!
green tea.author: Denise L.
green tea.review:
Every time I'm in NYC, Beard Papa's is always WAY too crowded. Now I understand why! These cream puffs are DELICIOUS!!! As I was heading towards Union square for some shopping, I walked right past the shop and noticed that the line wasn't long at all! I immediately walked in and stood in a line that lasted maybe 2 minutes. As I was waiting, the aroma of buttery puff pastry put me in a trance dreaming about my first bite. I decided to go with the vanilla bean cream puff. The pastry was so crispy on the outside and perfectly soft in the inside. So light and good. The vanilla cream was yummy, not to creamy and more custard like. I'm not a huge fan of cream puffs, but these were heavenly. 

I'm definitely going back to try the chocolate and their weekly specials. Hopefully the next time I'm there, I can try the pumpkin and green tea! YUM! OOOOhHHH.. they also have chocolate fondant cake too, but it's still under "coming soon." Can't wait!

excerpts: Green tea cream puffs.
That is where it's at!
It was so absolutely delicious.
This is the original location in SF, I was told, but it's so small and there isn't much room to sit in here.
green tea.author: Jessica C.
green tea.review:
Green tea cream puffs. That is where it's at! It was so absolutely delicious. This is the original location in SF, I was told, but it's so small and there isn't much room to sit in here. I can't imagine this place when it was uber crowded and busy, that must have been insane.

I also tried their cheesecake sticks. It was interesting. Not traditionally like cheesecake, but still good. The dough for the crust could have been flakier however.

excerpts: I have to try the other flavors like green tea next time.
green tea.author: Jim C.
green tea.review:
I finally succumbed to trying these flaky puffs of pleasure that everyone's been talking about... and the only disappointment was that I could not try all the flavors on my one visit.

Enough has been said about them so won't elaborate. The puffs pastries themselves were surprisingly light, flaky and perfectly balanced between crisp and crewy. And then the creme in the diff flavors - I tried vanilla and chocolate - were delicious altho I liked the chocolate more. I have to try the other flavors like green tea next time.

Bottom line: I'm a fan. Lucky I don't live near this place - otherwise I'd be 300 pounds easily.

excerpts: I heard the green tea isn't good either.
green tea.author: Michael H.
green tea.review:
Yeah they're good.

Only get the vanilla cream filled puffs.  They have the most pronounced flavor.  The vanilla works well because it has a lot of vanilla beans put into it.  The chocolate isn't as luscious.  I heard the green tea isn't good either.

I'm always apprehensive when buying one.  Because I know that once i finish a single cream puff, it will most likely lead to another one.  Not as jaw dropping as I thought it would be, but oh so satisfying.  The hype is partly correct.

I tried the warm chocolate cake.  It's a small little cake that they heat up in the microwave.  It's very reminiscent of Mrs. Fields' Cookies, but in cake form.  Super good but I bet it's super crazy in terms of nutrition facts.

(They used to show a video of how they make the cream puffs.  A lot of milk, butter, and all the good things that make your pig blush.  They don't show it anymore because I think they realized that it's anti-marketing for the healthies.)

excerpts: Like green tea, thai ice tea.. strawberry..
green tea.author: Judi K.
green tea.review:
This is the place to come to if you want to have different fillings.... 
Like green tea, thai ice tea.. strawberry.. 
But the basic ones are vanilla bean and chocolate. 

YUMMY!! My best bribe dessert. 

There's also one in the mall that's open later.

excerpts: Actually, any of the flavors (except maybe the Green Tea) are absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS.
green tea.author: Buster B.
green tea.review:
If I had a pumpkin cream puff today and died tomorrow, I'd die a happy person.

Actually, any of the flavors (except maybe the Green Tea) are absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS.

It's hard for me to get just one...I usually get a half dozen or a full dozen! I'm glad the store is kind of far from me, otherwise I'd go broke (and be fat).

green tea.review: I HATE that Beard Papa's is sooOOoo GOOD, I HATE that the bf LOVES Beard Papa's, I HATE that I go to Beard Papa's at least once a week and what I HATE even more than all of the above is that it's located sooOOOo close to my work and I mean like 2 minute walk CLOSE!!! excerpts: But in a few weeks they'll have chocolate, green tea, caramel and strawberry cream puffs and a few other pastries.
I'll definitely be coming back to try the other flavors and this might also replace birthday cakes for a few people.
****Ok, so I had the chocolate cream puff last week and it was...disappointing.
It was good as desserts go but in comparison to the vanilla cream puff?
Not good.
The chocolate filling was gritty and the batch of cream puffs that mine was from were very misshapen and, in my opinion, should not have been used and just tossed.
Aren't choux supposed to be a roundish shape?
The one I had was lumpy.
Maybe I should try another 2 to see if it has improved but for now the vanilla was hands down much better.
I've now also had the green tea flavored puff.
Let's just say that's going to be the only time I try it.
The thing about green tea is that it's fairly subtle flavor.
The custard was so rich that I didn't really detect the green tea until after I was finished.
Which if you didn't know what you were eating you would just think that the taste was off.
Also?
The green powdered sugar that was dusted on top was a turn off.
It was not an appetizing color.
green tea.author: cyndi L.
green tea.review:
After finding out about their opening this past weekend, I took a stroll over. Why the heck not? It's just a half block away. Which is a bad, bad thing.

These cream puffs are fantastic! The vanilla bean custard is not too sweet and the texture is just heavenly. The choux is nicely crispy on the outside. I love that these are made to order. 

There's not much of a selection right now. Just vanilla cream puffs. But in a few weeks they'll have chocolate, green tea, caramel and strawberry cream puffs and a few other pastries. 

I'll definitely be coming back to try the other flavors and this might also replace birthday cakes for a few people.

****Ok, so I had the chocolate cream puff last week and it was...disappointing. It was good as desserts go but in comparison to the vanilla cream puff? Not good. The chocolate filling was gritty and the batch of cream puffs that mine was from were very misshapen and, in my opinion, should not have been used and just tossed. Aren't choux supposed to be a roundish shape? The one I had was lumpy. Maybe I should try another 2 to see if it has improved but for now the vanilla was hands down much better.

*****I've now also had the green tea flavored puff. Let's just say that's going to be the only time I try it. The thing about green tea is that it's fairly subtle flavor. The custard was so rich that I didn't really detect the green tea until after I was finished. Which if you didn't know what you were eating you would just think that the taste was off. Also? The green powdered sugar that was dusted on top was a turn off. It was not an appetizing color.

excerpts: Update: tried the green tea puff today.
It is worthy.
The fondant was amazing.
green tea.author: Pat T.
green tea.review:
The pumpkin cream puff (today's special) was delicious - the filling tasted like pumpkin pie filling and vanilla ice cream. The pastry was a nice compliment, but at Beard Papa's, it's really the filling that's the thing.

Compared to the pumpkin, the vanilla creampuff was a letdown -- the filling was too sweet and rich.

Update: tried the green tea puff today. It is worthy.

The fondant was amazing. I popped it in the microwave for 12 seconds and was rewarded with essentially a chocolate cake with a core of warm melted chocolate filling. Very good.

The prices seem high but are not outrageous considering these are not some little dainty single bite dealies but instead a whole body pudding-all-over-the-face, powdered sugar down the front of your shirt experience. Imagine jelly donuts designed by the French for the Japanese export market, and you have a reasonable approximation of what you're going to get. 

$1.75 for a puff, $11 for a half-dozen. I'll be back

excerpts: We couldn't have green tea, which was our first choice.
green tea.author: Bruce S.
green tea.review:
We visited Beard Papa's Cream Puffs on a Thursday at about 3pm or so.  No line!  So, our curiosity was satisfied more quickly than I anticipated.  

I was disappointed to find that only a few flavors are available at any given time.  Why is this?  I've heard that in the east coast locations more flavors are always available.  We couldn't have green tea, which was our first choice.  We had to settle for one chocolate and one vanilla.

I don't really like pate a choux, but this was quite good.  Nice and crunchy, with plenty of air space inside to be filled with cream.  And, the pastry cream was quite good.  I liked the vanilla the best-- smooth and creamy with a good sweet vanilla flavor.  I found the chocolate pastry cream to be a bit grainy, but still enjoyable.

Over all, very enjoyable.  Give them a try!

excerpts: After their much anticipated arrival with said puffs, I inhaled the "classic" custard puff, before working on the green tea puff that was malkjsldkjfsldkjd --- too good for words.
green tea.author: Antoi C.
green tea.review:
Monstrous cream puffs! Gall bladders beware!

My sisters came to visit last Summer, and knowing they were picking up a car rental from the hotel around the corner from Beard Papa, I forced them to pick up some cream puffs to-go. After their much anticipated arrival with said puffs, I inhaled the "classic" custard puff, before working on the green tea puff that was malkjsldkjfsldkjd --- too good for words. Alas, there was only a bit left for the sisters to enjoy.

I admit, my mistake was not slowly enjoying the rich custard over a cup of stringent tea or coffee -- which I highly recommend, btw (at Yerba Buena park perhaps?). These suckers are big, so don't have a huge meal beforehand, or better yet, share them with a loved one.

excerpts: My boyfriend has had the green tea flavor and said it was good as well.
green tea.author: Tori C.
green tea.review:
Yummmm.. I don't ever normally purchase or make cream puffs. Just not my preferred dessert.. but something about these particular cream puffs makes me crave them whenever I'm within about 6 blocks of their vicinity. (Ok, and sometimes even when I'm not even in the city at all!) 

Restraint is definitely necessary to eat just one. Sometimes I give in and eat one there, and get a second one to take home. :) Don't bother to look up the calories. Why would you do that? It's a cream puff, obviously it's not going to be full of vitamins and other healthy nutrients. But who cares, it's a treat!

So far I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, and strawberry (favorite! with bits of chopped strawberry in it! mmmm.. too bad it's not a regular flavor), and the cookie crumble puff. I could give or take the cookie crumble, I think the regular puff is satisfying enough. My boyfriend has had the green tea flavor and said it was good as well.

The only downside to this place? I'm on a college student budget, and they happen to be 'conveniently' close enough for me to just stop by on my way to BART after class is done... ;)

excerpts: Unless it also had red bean filling and green tea essence in it too.
And one prerequisite tapioca bean.
green tea.author: O K.
green tea.review:
MMMMM! I had checked Beard Papa's website a couple months ago to see if they were ever coming to SF after I had a heavenly taste of their cream puffs in Hollywood. Today I checked again to see if they had opened yet, and lo and behold the opening day was yesterday! My friend and I rushed downtown and each bought 3 delicious cream puffs. Not too sweet, wonderful vanilla flavor in the sublimely textured cream, and a crispy-crunchy shell. MMMMMMMMMMMM!!! Apparently yesterday Beard Papa sold more cream puffs than any other California Beard Papa did on their first day. Good job San Francisco! I can't wait to try PUMPKIN cream puff!!!

Edit: I tried the pumpkin cream puff. It was really delicious. It had the slight sweet tang of pumpkin. PUMPYKIN. Does anyone else pronounce the word "pumpykin" like me? Well I also tasted the chocolate cream puff, which is a little too much choklad (pronounced hwoo-klohd, that's chocolate in Swedish) for me. Yay I have to try the "milk tea" probably the most Asian flavored cream puff you could get.. Unless it also had red bean filling and green tea essence in it too. And one prerequisite tapioca bean.

excerpts: I haven't been able to stray away from the vanilla, but they do have tempting flavors such as Green Tea, Chocolate, and Strawberry.
Go out on a limb if you dare, but I just can't seem to think of a reason to choose anything but vanilla.
green tea.author: Rick V.
green tea.review:
Ok.  Not sure about the name and what it has to do with cream puffs, but damn, Bearded Papa makes one fine cream puff.  I can't say that I am an expert as I admittedly have not had many elsewhere, but the mouth and tummy don't lie--Yum!

Crispy on the outside, somewhat airy and elastic on the inside with the upper cut of  vanilla custard--body blow, body blow, knock him out, knock him out.  

I haven't been able to stray away from the vanilla, but they do have tempting flavors such as Green Tea, Chocolate, and Strawberry.  Go out on a limb if you dare, but I just can't seem to think of a reason to choose anything but vanilla.

(Yes, Milk Tea.

It's not too sweet and tastes like a little puff of heaven! 
Chocolate and Green Tea: Great! but not as awesome as Vanilla bean!
Milk Tea: I thought this would be very strange, but it was delightfully yummy!
I would absolutely get one again!

Chocolate and Green Tea: Great! but not as awesome as Vanilla bean!
Milk Tea: I thought this would be very strange, but it was delightfully yummy!

green tea.author: Sally A.
green tea.review:
What's better after a long day of shopping or just a simple break from shopping than a nice Vanilla Cream Puff from Beard Papa's?

Nothing!

I've tried the Vanilla, Chocolate, Green Tea, and Milk Tea Cream Puffs (Yes, Milk Tea. I'm Taiwanese and felt like I owed it to my heritage to try one). 

Vanilla Bean: I have to say this is still my favorite! It's not too sweet and tastes like a little puff of heaven! 
Chocolate and Green Tea: Great! but not as awesome as Vanilla bean!
Milk Tea: I thought this would be very strange, but it was delightfully yummy! I would absolutely get one again! The milk tea flavor wasn't overpowering, but you could definitely taste it.

All of them are delicious depending on your personal choice of flavor and definitely worth it. Can't wait to go back!

excerpts: I was so keen on trying the green tea but have not been able to because I wasn't there the right week.
green tea.author: Rolo T.
green tea.review:
After reading about Beard Papa's on Daily Candy and Yelp, I was pretty excited about giving this place a try. 

Been there twice and was let down both times. First time I went, all they had were vanilla and chocolate cream puffs available, the special flavors were "coming soon." 

I went again about 6 weeks later and was excited to see that the special flavors were available. However, only one special flavor (out of 5 or so) for the week was available. I was so keen on trying the green tea but have not been able to because I wasn't there the right week. Why list all the flavors on the menu if you are not going to feature them until 3 weeks later?!!! 

Just really annoying each time I've gone with expectations of having a satisfying cream puff experience. With the ones I did try, average and not worth the wait in line. I think I made better cream puffs when I was 10 years old experimenting in my mom's kitchen. Give me the bulk cream puff package at Costco any day.

My favorite is always vanilla for sure, but have also tried and liked Milk tea, pumkin and strawberry. Next one down my list is going to be green tea. 

This place is good as a cafe, and to hang out for a lil bit. For better/ fresher puffs, try the one in Westfield Center.

green tea.author: Deb K.
green tea.review:
At 3:30 p.m., the line was 25 people long for Beard Papa, the new cream puff shop owned by the Japanese corporation Muginoho. The San Francisco store on the new Yerba Buena Lane is one of a few U.S. franchises; the others are in New York, New Jersey, Boston, Hawaii and Los Angeles. 

After we'd waited for about 10 minutes, one of the staff came down the line, apologized, and told us it would be 30 minutes before another batch was ready. Because we were only ordering one, we decided to stay, in hopes it would be quicker. 

Beard Papa is quite the scene. Besides the long line winding out the door, there's a lot going on inside. When you first step over the threshold, you're hit with this delicious buttery scent. You can see the puffs baking in these industrial-looking, high-tech ovens. They start off the size of a hockey puck, and then rise into a much larger, 3-inch puff. The staff, dressed chef's whites, forms an assembly line when the puffs are done cooling, with one person injecting the custard into the puff, the second dusting it with powdered sugar and placing it in a bag, and the third packing them into carrying boxes.

This place inspires some kind of weird fanaticism, and after having a vanilla cream puff, I have to say it may be merited. The people in line were mostly all Asian, as were all of the staff. A family with four little boys was taking pictures with one of the staff. Overhead, on two flat screen TVs, news clips about Beard Papa played; at one point, I looked up and saw Anderson Cooper on CNN eating a cream puff. The store sells T-shirts with its mascot --- an old, bearded man in a cap, and the saying, "Who's Your Papa?" This is probably temporary, but there was a sign saying "Limit: One dozen per customer." 

The menu over the cream puff area had "Coming Soon" taped over all of the selections, except the vanilla cream puffs. Under coming soon: cream puffs of different flavors --- chocolate, caramel, green tea, pumpkin, milk tea and strawberry. With the exception of chocolate, the flavors will rotate on a weekly basis. There are also the curiously named cheesecake sticks, the fondant au chocolat and clairs. 

The puff itself is a marvel of choux pastry: flaky, buttery, and crunchy. The cream is also unique, and delicious. It is a not-too-sweet mixture of whipped cream and custard that the sign in Beard Papa's claims it takes two hours to make. You can see them scraping the vanilla bean pods, too, to extract the vanilla that flecks the cream in the vanilla cream puffs. I think this may be a new obsession for me.

i've also tried the cheesecake stick which wasn't very good. they also have an eclair (chocolate glazed version of the cream puff) and some kind of molten chocolate lava cake that i haven't yet tried.

i didn't know i had so much to say about beard papa's. the sad thing is that i could go on, but i won't. :P

green tea.review: It has been a year since I went to Beard Papa's and I still dream and talk about this place.  I wandered in here after a visit to the SFMOMA with a friend.  Now I can't say that I have ever been a big creme puff fan.  You usually get some slightly chewy flavorless pastry puff with boring whip creme inside.  But this-this is on a whole other level.  This was a perfectly crispy but soft on the inside puff with perfect light whipped creme inside and powdered sugar on the outside.  It was perfection.  And they have flavors, green tea, strawberry, chocolate, they rotate them, so you never get bored.  I dream of the day we get one here in Seattle!

green tea.review: At $1.75 for a regular vanilla cream puff and nearly $2 for their specialty cream puffs (chocolate / caramel / strawberry, etc) Beard Papa is a once in a while sort of snack for me.  My bf just came back from Asia and was raving about the Beard Papas over there, so we decided to check out the new establishment in SF.  We each had a vanilla bean cream puff.  My first Beard Papa "experience."  After reading reviews on Yelp about this place,  I was so curious what the first bite would be like.  Light flaky pastry with a sweet but not too sweet creamy custard filling.  The little flecks of real vanilla bean were a nice touch.  While I thought the cream puff was tasty, I also didn't feel the urge to run back in the store and buy 12 more.  Plus by then, the line had grown, and I didn't love the cream puff enough to stand 30 min in the cold.  I give Beard Papa three stars...I've had better cream puffs in my lifetime, albeit made homemade from French cooks, but Beard Papa's is good too.   I'm curious what their green tea and pumpkin cream puffs taste like and would go back to check it out.

earl grey tea.author: Tadashi Y.
earl grey tea.review:
Beard Papa's is owned & operated by the Japanese firm  Muginoho. Their slogan is "Fresh'n natural cream puffs." 

Beard Papa's was opened in 1999 by Yuji Hirota in Osaka, Japan w/ the motto "Pipin' Hot Cream Puffs". Beard Papa's has over 250 stores in Japan & 300 worldwide in countries including  China, Korea, Taiwan, Indonesia, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Canada, & the United States.

Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee. The different flavors are sold on a rotating schedule.

While I like trying each of their flavours, the vanilla original flavour is my favourite. They inject the creamy goodness into the yummy shells to order. The place is imaculately maintained & provide a restroom & outdoor seating. 

There is also another location a block over underneath the Westfield Bloomingdale's Mall, in the food court. 

The name Beard Papa was chosen because the cream puff reminded Yuji of a sailor's beard & he felt that the "Engrish" (disjointed & often unintentionally funny Japanese version of English) title of "Beard Papa" will give Japanese people an American touch, while giving Americans a Japanese touch.

strawberry.author: Lauren K.
strawberry.review:
I definitely looked like a bearded papa after eating three of these cream puffs...that wasn't necessarily the goal, but I was feeling ravenous and when that hunger hits, I just dig right into my food, mindless of the mess I will make.  I had actually bought these cream puffs and brought them back to my hotel so as to enjoy breakfast in bed...I thought it'd be all luxurious, but I ended up just making a big flaky, creamy mess for the hotel maids to clean up later.

These cream puffs are delicate little things - the cream will ooze out the minute you bite into it so be prepared to lick all the cream off before it falls to the floor.  Let's play a little game of, 'Don't drop the cream!'.  These things are not only delicate, but also fairly small.  They aren't so small in that it's not worth buying them; I would actually say that for their size, they are filled with cream!  What's great about this place is that you can actually choose which filling you want.  I had come on a day where there was a bunch of construction outside and I guess they were preparing to close down temporarily because of it so there were limited flavors available.  They only had the vanilla and chocolate fillings available; and as for the glazed puff itself: only strawberry, green tea, chocolate and vanilla were available.  I was so looking forward to trying all these other flavors, but that wasn't in the cards for me that day.

There was a selection of cream puffs already to go, but then you had the option of picking and choosing your puff and your cream.  For each cream puff, either created by yourself or pre-prepared, it was about $3-4, so I ended up walking away having spent about $12 on cream puffs.  I didn't blink too much of an eye at this because I do love cream puffs...in fact, these cream puffs made for a breakfast of champions.  They didn't hold me over for long and their sugary base probably wasn't good for my diet, but they tasted pretty good in the moment.

I might just not be a cream puff person - I've known about Beard Papa's for a loooooong time since my family is from HI. 10 years later, I finally decided to try it - but as things usually are 10 years down the road, it wasn't as good as I imagined in my head.

Don't get me wrong, the cream puffs were good - we had a strawberry glazed one and a matcha glazed one, both with vanilla cream. They had a good balance of sweetness (not terribly sweet), and found their size a little amusing. They're HUGE compared to the ones I've had elsewhere.

That said, maybe I'm just not a cream puff person. I'd much rather eat a good brownie, cookie, or even slice of cake. I didn't care for the cream puffs at Odette in Paris (which is supposed to be known for their cream puffs) either. So I'd say - if you're the kind of person that likes cream puffs, it's worth a try! I haven't seen anything like it.

You can find a cheap sweet fix here for less than $5 a portion. I always stick with the original cream puff with some sort of fruity filling (I love their strawberry and mango flavors a lot! They are usually offered as the flavor of the day) since I'm not a huge fan of the vanilla or chocolate. Sometimes they have green tea if you're lucky! If anyone else happens to know other unique flavors, please send them my way!

One original cream puff is 2.90, and you can get a chocolate covered one for about 50 cents more if you're feeling extra sweet. Portion sizes here are decent and just the right amount of filling. They offer eclairs and vanilla slices here if you want something different, but trying their cream puffs here are a must at least once!

We got chocolate dipped with vanilla filling and couldn't get enough. The cream is luscious and thick and was full of vanilla flavor. Overall, the puffs were a little pricey but worth it for the size. Wonderful spot for a quick dessert!
