strawberry.review:
It's amusing to me how some bored workers like to talk in another language in front of customers, thinking that nobody can understand what they are saying. She was complaining in Spanish to her 2 co-workers that I was taking too long to order. It wasn't even 5 seconds, Sheez! and I was her only customer at the time too.

Normally bakeries/ pastry shops that sell sweet products, hire cheerful people to match the food they sell. The manager of this branch didn't get that memo. The employees looked unhappy, with a deadpan, monotone voice and blank facial expressions, like if either they were inside a jail or they thought that they're too cool to work in that job, not sure. Definitely a disincentive to buy more stuff.

I just came here to try the new mini-croissants, available in 3 flavors: butter (regular), chocolate and cheese (cream cheese). Sold by 3 for $2.95/$3.45, 1/2 dozen for $5.25/$6.25, or one dozen for $10/$12. I bought a mix to try every flavor. The "Petit-cro" looked nice and tasted okay, but the inside is a little dry. Perhaps better when eaten while sipping on a cup of hot coffee or tea. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/fO4nmPfUwyyzLDRxOIwuVg/l

The "Fondant au chocolat" are little cupcake size chocolate cakes filled with chocolate that melts after they warm it in a microwave. Nothing to rave about. If u still want something similar, go to TJ's instead for a cheaper version in the frozen foods aisle. The "Cheese cake stick" (regular, strawberry and tiramisu) is another disappointing item, it's a small layer of cheesecake sliced into strips. I'd rather have a slice of dense NY-style or Zanze's light cheesecakes instead.

I'm not a fan of the cream puffs at this store (maybe I got poorly made ones, don't know), although I really liked the ones I tried at Beard Papa's in Waikiki, inside the Food Pantry market. Also I don't know why the Cupertino location has lower prices than the SF store.

strawberry.author: Arron E.
strawberry.review: Finally ventured out of my comfort zone and tried the Fruit Cream Puffs... And I must say it's amazing! They use actual fruit so it taste both fresh and delicious. strawberry.author: Elaine N.
strawberry.review:
Just perfect. Though, almost perfect. I just found another competitor for beard papa's and it's called Pacific puffs. I can't tell which is better! 

Beard papa's has a variety of flavored creams such as strawberry, blueberry, chocolate, vanilla, and etc. In which makes their cream puffs very unique. 

Price range is I think 3.50 per puff? And is a little bigger than a baseball. 
Try it, you won't regret it... And try Pacific puffs too. *drool *

And of course the pastry itself is made from scratch.
In other words this place is freaking great.
If you are busy shopping in the area and need a quick, $2 pick me up sweet treat you need to come here.

strawberry.review:
A place that sells homemade cream puffs??  Yes, please.

Only in San Francisco (and a few other cities) can you order a cream puff made with strawberry filling that USES REAL STRAWBERRIES.  And of course the pastry itself is made from scratch.  In other words this place is freaking great.  If you are busy shopping in the area and need a quick, $2 pick me up sweet treat you need to come here.

I would definitely order that again.
It wasn't the artificial strawberry flavor you're expecting

sweet, tart, and oh so yum.

strawberry.author: Hannah F.
strawberry.review:
I am in love with these cream puffs! They are not your average puff! I tried both the vanilla and strawberry puffs, both were good but the strawberry was EXCELLENT. I would definitely order that again. It wasn't the artificial strawberry flavor you're expecting, it's literally tastes like they crushed up strawberries in the cream. sweet, tart, and oh so yum.

Stop in for a treat!

excerpts: Their strawberry puff are good.
strawberry.author: Learnee L.
strawberry.review:
I'm giving them 4 stars for the consistency, the service and being the first (that I know of) cream puff place in the city.
I've heard of this place before they opened the store in the city and was excited to try them.  I don't go here all the time but am always to have a good cream puff.

Their strawberry puff are good. Vanilla and chocolate were good as well.

I  was debating on whether to try the Green Tea or the Vanilla Bean, but after a long tough decision, I've gone with the Vanilla Bean Cookie Ccrunch Puff.

Crunchy exterior, and creamy and sweet interior.

strawberry.author: Mona C.
strawberry.review:
4.5 Stars

+ Yummy
+ Fresh Ingredients 
+ Friendly Service
+ Clean

- So Fatty :(

LOVE Beard Papas!!! Came here with 2 of my buddies while waiting for a movie to start which wasn't in another hour and half or so. There were no line when we got here. Yes!!

I've been to other Beard Papa locations, and I gotta say, this is the best one yet! There were so much to choose from but the first thing that caught my eyes were the cream puffs. The "Daily Flavors" are: Vanilla Bean and Chocolate. Weekly Flavors are: Caramel, Coffee / Tiramisu, Green Tea, Pumpkin and Strawberry. (1 for $2.25, 6 for $11.00, 12 for $22.00)

Everything looked so tasty! I  was debating on whether to try the Green Tea or the Vanilla Bean, but after a long tough decision, I've gone with the Vanilla Bean Cookie Ccrunch Puff. Sooo good. Crunchy exterior, and creamy and sweet interior. Mmm~ Kinda regret not ordering a dozen to go...

For mango lovers, my buddy Steph recommended me the Mango Ice Shower! Shaved ice, mango sauce, topped with fresh mangoes. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

Will be back to try all the other flavors! :D

Caramel is meh.

strawberry.author: C. Z.
strawberry.review:
I love Beard Papa's. So soft. So fluffy. All the layers. Heaven.

If you're gonna get Beard Papa's, come to this store and not the location in the nearby mall food court. 

There's the regular puff, eclair puff, or my favorite, the cocoa puff. All the creams are great as well. They have the usual vanilla and chocolate creams as well a special flavor each week like coffee, strawberry, or caramel. Strawberry is awesome. Caramel is meh. If you're going to visit somewhere, bring a dozen of these and you'll be so loved. 

My favorite flavors for the cream are: Mango, strawberry, chocolate, and gool ol' vanilla.

I wish they would have a facebook page like the cupertino store to advertise weekly specials/flavors.

excerpts: I love the green tea and the strawberry puffs!!
strawberry.author: Angela K.
strawberry.review:
I love the green tea and the strawberry puffs!! 

Vanilla are always a safe bet though, especially if its your first time. 

I like this location because it doesn't get as busy, it seems more clean and the staff is relatively friendly. 

The cheesecake and tiramisu sticks here are omg good too!

strawberry.review:
I've had beard papa's back in so-cal, but never realized that they had other flavored cream fillings.  Came here after lunch at Bucca's just around the corner and had a little snack.  

What I like about Beard Papa's cream puffs is that the cream fillings are never too sweet.  And the strawberry filling was pretty awesome; it had bits of fresh strawberries in it.  Being the non-dessert guy I am, these types of items appeal to me more when they're not too sweet, which was perfect for me, cuz these were just the right amount of non-sweetness vs sweetness :)  Again, it's hard for me to get a good gauge on dessert places; so take my dessert reviews at your own discretion.  HOWEVER, I was with the Finz and a few friends who ARE dessert gals, and they loved them.  So there!  ha ha ha.  You can get them in multiples or just by singles, and they are a little big, so I just wish there were like mini-puffs...Muffs...um maybe not... we'll just stay with mini-cream puffs, he he he.

Nothin too different about this place than the others tho - the lady behind the counter was gettin mad at the kiddies(my friends have kids) that were playing w/ the blinds.  Well more concerned than mad, but the way she expressed herself showed she was leaning more towards the side of mad than concerned - but other than that, nothin special service-wise, get your puff on and puff outta there :)

excerpts: They have vanilla and chocolate, strawberry whipped cream, green tea, cookie crumble.
They also have chocolate fondant, and they sell some pretty Asian things as well like Pocky, Hi Chews, and Calipco.
strawberry.author: Grace Y.
strawberry.review:
Hello!!! Addictingly good! The only downside to this place is the horrible amount of calories consumed because it's hard to just have one. Oh and also when you unwrap one of them and get it close to your mouth, if you choose to inhale before you bite, you get a nose full of powdered sugar. So beware! 

They have CUSTARD filled cream puffs. That's right. CUSTARD. Can you tell that I really like CUSTARD?! They have vanilla and chocolate, strawberry whipped cream, green tea, cookie crumble. They also have chocolate fondant, and they sell some pretty Asian things as well like Pocky, Hi Chews, and Calipco. 

I made the mistake of buying a dozen once. Guess who ate the dozen? 

Mainly me. I think I managed to give away 2, but the other 10 I inhaled over the next 3 days. Grumble.

excerpts: They have a great selection of flavors (when I was in: Vanilla, Chocolate, Pumpkin, Mango, Strawberry, Green Tea) as well as different shells (Original, Chocolate Covered and Cookie Crunch).
strawberry.author: Amanda G.
strawberry.review:
Let's be honest, as soon as I started writing this review I started drooling on my keyboard.  Let's think about it this way - do you like dessert? Mm, sure you do - it's amazing! Do you like your desserts made fresh to order? Well, you're in luck - Beard Papa's doesn't fill their crispy creme puffs until you order!  They have a great selection of flavors (when I was in: Vanilla, Chocolate, Pumpkin, Mango, Strawberry, Green Tea) as well as different shells (Original, Chocolate Covered and Cookie Crunch).

If you're visiting SF, put it on your to do list; and if you live in SF, you have absolutely no excuse not to go!

excerpts: When I die and Jesus is about to high five me as I rollerblade into heaven, Beard Papa is going to greet me with his strawberry cream puff.
I'm sure the other flavors are good, but when strawberry is the flavor of the week, it's very hard to not buy a dozen of those heavenly treats and not devour them in one day.
strawberry.author: Felicia R.
strawberry.review:
These cream puffs are heaven sent. When I die and Jesus is about to high five me as I rollerblade into heaven, Beard Papa is going to greet me with his strawberry cream puff. 

I'm sure the other flavors are good, but when strawberry is the flavor of the week, it's very hard to not buy a dozen of those heavenly treats and not devour them in one day. The cookie crunch is a nice addition.

VIVA BEARD PAPA!

excerpts: Strawberry filling:  fresh strawberries enveloped with a whip cream like filling.
strawberry.author: Angel N.
strawberry.review:
This location is ideal for an nice afternoon stroll through the Yerba Buena gardens.  I prefer going to the store and buying my cream puffs to go and take the bag to the garden and sit in the grass and people watch.  It's so relaxing!

Puffs:  The pastry shell is a oversized puff that is soft but has a crusty top that you can just tear into. You can just smell the pastry when you first walk in if they are still baking in the oven that is location right behind the counter. 

Vanilla custard filling:  has specks of vanilla bean, the custard is not sweet and does not have the egg smell or after taste.  The puffs normally include 3 pumps of the custard which is way to much for me, so I always get half the amount.

Strawberry filling:  fresh strawberries enveloped with a whip cream like filling.  The consistency is light.

And of course all of the puffs are topped off with powered sugar.  So if you don't like having powdery sugared lips/ mouth, then you should request for non.  I always look like Tyrone the crack head from the Dave Chappelle's show when I finish eating..  :)

I wouldn't recommend anyone ever getting the eclairs or the other bake goods, they are either made way in advance or pre-made.

excerpts: I was savoring a strawberry cream puff in no time...
4 minutes later, I gobbled up a vanilla cream puff too.
strawberry.author: Celeste M.
strawberry.review:
I puff, YOU puff, we all scream for cream puff :-)!

Light, flaky, airy and oh so tasty.  The fresh baked aroma is incredible.  It wasn't at all crowded at 1:30pm on a Wednesday afternoon and the service was quick.  I was savoring a strawberry cream puff in no time... 4 minutes later, I gobbled up a vanilla cream puff too. I stopped myself from eating the chocolate cream puff (I got for my b/f), even though I really wanted to.  

A great place for a delicious, sweet snack.  Next time I see a movie at The Metreon, I will make sure to stop by Beard Papa's so I can enjoy a cream puff or two while watching a movie.

excerpts: I cannot wait to try Caramel and Strawberry.
strawberry.author: Michael N.
strawberry.review:
I was having a cream puff craving and had recently tried a different place for their puffs so i wanted to come here to try Papa's puffs. Again. 

I tried this place before and always thought the puffs were delicious but this time I was using Yelp and wanted to compare this place with another set of puffs i had recently tried.

Their puffs are BIG. The powdered sugar on top is good but could be a little too much for me. The original and chocolate are both delicious. But what I like about this place is that they have daily special flavors and when i came the flavor was GREEN TEA! Woot woot :] I love green tea flavored things so i just had to order one. There were no more COOKIE CRUNCH shells when i ordered but my friend, who came later, ordered a chocolate cream puff with the cookie crunch shell and it was yummy. The shell was hard and tasted a bit like cookies, not definitely. Anyways, my green tea cream puff was good. Not great but good. It wasn't a really sweet green tea flavor but more like Matcha, sorta. It was 'earthy' and mildly sweet. I cannot wait to try Caramel and Strawberry.

I am most def. coming back here and i recommend people to come here to try it out.

excerpts: I just don't get the strawberry and chocolate fillings.
strawberry.author: Matt B.
strawberry.review:
I first had Beard Papa's in Singapore, and on every visit, I would go and indulge by having a just a few, say five at a time.  

These days, I am hostage to my car whose navigation system identifies the nearest Beard Papa, and gives me false directions until I arrive at one of their stores.  My New Year's resolution since 2001 has been no more than 3 at a time, and I've broken that promise only every time.  

I only choose the custard cream puff.   While I've tried the other flavors and other menu items, it is the custard filled puff that has a special place in my stomach. If they only sold my item, it would be a five star review.  I just don't get the strawberry and chocolate fillings.

excerpts: I have discovered a new favorite flavor...strawberry.
I have tried the green tea, the chocolate, the vanilla, but this was my first time trying the strawberry.
and they had rotated the next flavor of the week to strawberry already.
I still wanna try the mango one...never had the opportunity, but the strawberry is my new favorite flavor now.
strawberry.author: Wendy L.
strawberry.review:
I have discovered a new favorite flavor...strawberry. I have tried the green tea, the chocolate, the vanilla, but this was my first time trying the strawberry.

Here's something to be aware though...They have rotating flavors of the week. But I did not know their idea of a week runs from Friday through Thursday (not Monday through Saturday, not Sunday through Saturday...yes, their week starts on a Friday). So off I went today (Friday), because I knew their flavor of the week was mango, but I was disappointed when I was told "Oh that was last week. Yesterday was the last day." I was totally scratching my head thinking, Last week? Last week? But yesterday was Thursday?

So I ended up missing the mango flavor because I went on a Friday and they had rotated the next flavor of the week to strawberry already. I still wanna try the mango one...never had the opportunity, but the strawberry is my new favorite flavor now.

Oh, they have their special flavors of the week (for the entire year!) posted online. Check it out if you wanna plan accordingly.

excerpts: I've tried a few of their flavors, and all of them have been so very tasty (green tea, strawberry, chocolate, vanilla).
They even put real vanilla bean in the vanilla custard, a big plus!
strawberry.author: Karen W.
strawberry.review: Cream puffs= mmmm!  I've tried a few of their flavors, and all of them have been so very tasty (green tea, strawberry, chocolate, vanilla).  They even put real vanilla bean in the vanilla custard, a big plus!

excerpts: They had tiramisu, cheesecake and strawberry.
strawberry.author: Christina C.
strawberry.review:
I had plenty of misgivings about Beard Papa's.   I've seen it in Southern CA but avoided it probably due to its name and logo.  I mean, its name sounds like a Smurf-themed sex shop or gay Bear bar.  I'm also not attracted to the Gordon Fisherman meets Chef Boyardee logo of an old man puffing on a pipe while I'm eating.

This Japanese-based pastry shop I guess started out in Osaka (where my mom used to live) and I love Japanese food so I figured I should give it a try.  According to their website (best watched after you've ingested said cream puffs) the original inspiration of the cream puffs came from the original Beard Papa's .... shockingly, from his facial hair.  He also seemed to be smoking while baking these "World's Best Cream Puffs".  I'm not sure what the most disturbing part of those sentences are, but I'll leave that up to you to decipher.

Regardless, the cream puffs are pretty damn amazing. I'm not normally a fan of puffed pastry seeded in custard and whipped cream, but stopping in was an unexpected treat.  I had the cookie crumb pastry with vanilla bean filling.  It was... awesome.  They also serve treats in stick form which is a form I am fond of.  They had tiramisu, cheesecake and strawberry.  They also have eclairs and chocolate fondant.  Thankfully, no beard hair or what ever Beard Papa is smoking makes its way into these delightful lessons in diabetes and obesity.

excerpts: The special flavor of the day was strawberry, which we didn't get because the pretty girl at the register said their regular vanilla are their best sellers, so we got that plus a chocolate one for me.
strawberry.author: Fancypants X.
strawberry.review:
Beard Papa & I have crossed paths many times in the past: at Christmas last year, my auntie & uncle brought a whole box to dinner, but at the time I was "dieting." I see it every time I go for Peete's Coffee or pick up something at Bristol Farms downtown. And most recently, I've been reading all my fellow YELPers rave reviews about it.

The BFF & I stopped in at the Yerba Beuna location, at my urging, to try Beard Papa's for the first time (*record scratch* "i love it when you call me beard papa's...") The special flavor of the day was strawberry, which we didn't get because the pretty girl at the register said their regular vanilla are their best sellers, so we got that plus a chocolate one for me.

We ordered & they pump the little empty puffs full of filling right there in front of you. We took our first bites & didn't get any filling. Three bites in, we finally taste the custard & it is oozing out everywhere. I don't think I will eat another Beard Papa cream puff ever again. It's just not my stee-lo, ya heard? It's tastes & smells kinda "eggy" (ewww) & it's too many calories for something I just don't enjoy. The cream, the puff, the whole cream puff... is pretty bland. As my friend put it, "it's pretty hallow in the middle & when you eat it, thats how it will make you feel- HALLOW & a little fatter!"

excerpts: I would love to try the strawberry and caramel!
strawberry.author: Dina V.
strawberry.review:
YUM! What's not to like? Vanilla custard. Yum! And even though I'm never really a fan of chocolate, I had to taste it and damn I liked it. Probably b/c it wasn't an overpowering chocolate taste. The flavor of the day was the milk tea and I wasn't brave enough to try it. I would definitely go back. Thankfully we popped in on a Sunday afternoon and surprisingly the line wasn't ridiculous. 

Does anyone know how they determine what the special flavor will be? Like does that menu rotate? I would love to try the strawberry and caramel!

excerpts: Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee.
strawberry.author: Tadashi Y.
strawberry.review:
Beard Papa's is owned & operated by the Japanese firm  Muginoho. Their slogan is "Fresh'n natural cream puffs." 

Beard Papa's was opened in 1999 by Yuji Hirota in Osaka, Japan w/ the motto "Pipin' Hot Cream Puffs". Beard Papa's has over 250 stores in Japan & 300 worldwide in countries including  China, Korea, Taiwan, Indonesia, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Canada, & the United States.

Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee. The different flavors are sold on a rotating schedule.

While I like trying each of their flavours, the vanilla original flavour is my favourite. They inject the creamy goodness into the yummy shells to order. The place is imaculately maintained & provide a restroom & outdoor seating. 

There is also another location a block over underneath the Westfield Bloomingdale's Mall, in the food court. 

The name Beard Papa was chosen because the cream puff reminded Yuji of a sailor's beard & he felt that the "Engrish" (disjointed & often unintentionally funny Japanese version of English) title of "Beard Papa" will give Japanese people an American touch, while giving Americans a Japanese touch.

excerpts: They were out of strawberry.
strawberry.author: Andrew N.
strawberry.review:
We were shown this place by some friends. First off, they just make creme puffs and the creme has different flavors. The puffs are already pre-made and just filled to order. There was a line and probably always is, but it moved fast.

I thought their puffs were light so that was a plus, but the creme wasn't super and didnt make up for the cost. They are expensive. I am glad to say I've tried it, but I would not come back.

I am a believe in cheap and good. I don't need all the other frills. This place is expensive and good. But in the end its just a creme puff. 

We did order the green tea, chocolate, and vanilla. They were out of strawberry. Green tea usually kind of tastes off when they make it into some other form than tea. I suggest not trying this. The chocolate is thick kind of like pudding and the vanilla had the best balance.

excerpts: If only strawberry was a regular flavor!
Vanilla bean is a close second and suffices when I'm not feeling their "flavor of the week.
strawberry.author: Miffy Y.
strawberry.review: If only strawberry was a regular flavor! Vanilla bean is a close second and suffices when I'm not feeling their "flavor of the week." The green tea and pumpkin are interesting, but nothing beats the classics.

excerpts: vanilla and strawberry filling are my favorites!
it really tastes like strawberry...
strawberry.author: Jessica C.
strawberry.review:
i love this place! these are seriously the best cream puffs ive ever had, and theyre huge! 
theres not only cream puffs, there are also sometimes cheese cake sticks and tiramisu sticks.. they fill the puff right in front of you which is pretty cool, the one at the mall is always crowded so this one is the best way to get it and go! 

vanilla and strawberry filling are my favorites! it really tastes like strawberry...

excerpts: Today I tried a strawberry mousse cheesecake strip and it was a delightful set of contrasts.
Diced bits of dark red strawberry sat next to chopped green pistachios atop a foamy sea of pale pink mousse, all resting on a bed of off-white cheesecake.
Diced bits of dark red strawberry sat next to chopped green pistachios atop a foamy sea of pale pink mousse, all resting on a bed of off-white cheesecake.
The density of the cheesecake emphasized the airiness of the mousse, while the crunch of the nuts gave a satisfying counterpoint amidst the soft, sweet joy in my mouth.
strawberry.author: Bill B.
strawberry.review:
Today I tried a strawberry mousse cheesecake strip and it was a delightful set of contrasts. Diced bits of dark red strawberry sat next to chopped green pistachios atop a foamy sea of pale pink mousse, all resting on a bed of off-white cheesecake. The density of the cheesecake emphasized the airiness of the mousse, while the crunch of the nuts gave a satisfying counterpoint amidst the soft, sweet joy in my mouth. 

I've had the cream puffs, too, and yes, they are sinfully good. Seriously, you should go to confession at the historic church next door after you eat one. Then go to the gym for an hour. Or more.

excerpts: I wish they had Green Tea or Strawberry instead of Coffee, those sound yummy.
What I love about these treats that they are just so light and heavenly to indulge!!
The puff pastries are soft with a slight crunch, this is a good thing by adding some texture.
I'm not so fond of over-buttery and sweet custards.
strawberry.author: Jing D.
strawberry.review:
I love these little divine puffs of heaven!!

I've had Beard Papa one other time in the Westfields Shopping Mall on Market Street, and I remembered it was a delicious treat. So after visiting the Contemporary Jewish Museum and stumbling upon this location in the adjacent alleyway, my friend and I just HAAAD to stop in for some puffs!

The special flavor of the week was Coffee, in addition to your usual Vanilla and Chocolate choosing. I wish they had Green Tea or Strawberry instead of Coffee, those sound yummy. What I love about these treats that they are just so light and heavenly to indulge!! The puff pastries are soft with a slight crunch, this is a good thing by adding some texture. I'm not so fond of over-buttery and sweet custards. I find the cream fillings here to be on the light (and very fresh) side, which I prefer and love. 

I can't help but smile and be joyous when eating these, even as thoughts of them immediately adhering to my waistline creep up every now and then.

excerpts: The flavor of the week was pumpkin and strawberry.
Score, and score!
So I went up to the counter and the woman behind the counter
My happy thoughts of pumpkin and strawberry cream puffs were being swallowed up in the cogs of--er, excuse the pun--cognition like Chaplin's Tramp in "Modern Times."
Before I knew it, I heard myself saying "THIRTY MINUTES?!?!??"
But it probably sounded like Scooby Doo going "Rrrraaurwhrrr?"
The woman confirmed, yes, it's a 30 minute wait for the next batch of puffs.
strawberry.author: maiko h.
strawberry.review:
Here is a play by play of my last attempt to get cream puffs here.  I strolled in because there was no line.  Score!  The flavor of the week was pumpkin and strawberry.  Score, and score!  So I went up to the counter and the woman behind the counter said something to me.  

My brain, addled by the divine eggy-vanilla aroma, could not digest what she said immediately.  The heavy machinery of thought churned slowly, with much creaking and grunting.  My happy thoughts of pumpkin and strawberry cream puffs were being swallowed up in the cogs of--er, excuse the pun--cognition like Chaplin's Tramp in "Modern Times."  Before I knew it, I heard myself saying "THIRTY MINUTES?!?!??"  But it probably sounded like Scooby Doo going "Rrrraaurwhrrr?"  The woman confirmed, yes, it's a 30 minute wait for the next batch of puffs.  I was so incredulous that I blurted out "Not worth the wait." and ran out, rejected, and ran straight to BART and went home.  

Forgive me, I didn't mean to be so rude, but I was just so taken aback by the wait time.  The wait to get a cream puff shouldn't be so disproportionate compared to the time it takes to scarf one down.  I'm surprised they don't try harder to stagger the production so there is a constant turnover of choux going in and out of the ovens.  I mean, I can make double batches of four different cookies in my podunk home oven for Xmas in one afternoon.  Papa really needs to come up with a new system to keep the choux coming!!

I do like this location better than the Westfield one because the wait is usually not as ridiculous, and on nice days, I can trot over to Yerba Buena and eat my puffs in the sun.  The cream puffs are pretty good, mostly because they're warm and fresh when you bite into it.  But I think I actually prefer the $1 giant choux creme I can get in the bread section of Niji-Ya and other Japanese markets.

excerpts: I think my underbaked ones filled with strawberry cool whip tasted better.
A couple of times their cream tasted like flour.
Not that I'm a cream puff chef extraordinaire, but in a cream puff its supposed to feel poofy.
The shell is supposed to hold the delicious goodness and feel like a cloud.
The exetrior of the shell is supposed to be crisp and not hard - and the inside should be airy fluff, not chewy or breadlike.
The inside filling is not supposed to be heavy and make the shell droop to one side, but not taste like whipped cream
(beard papa's do not taste like whipped cream).
strawberry.author: Cheryl D.
strawberry.review:
Have you ever had home made cream puffs? These suck almost as much as the ones in the frozen section. I think my underbaked ones filled with strawberry cool whip tasted better. 
A couple of times their cream tasted like flour. 
Not that I'm a cream puff chef extraordinaire, but in a cream puff its supposed to feel poofy. The shell is supposed to hold the delicious goodness and feel like a cloud. The exetrior of the shell is supposed to be crisp and not hard - and the inside should be airy fluff, not chewy or breadlike. The inside filling is not supposed to be heavy and make the shell droop to one side, but not taste like whipped cream (beard papa's do not taste like whipped cream).  Well that's how I like them.

I do appreciate the creative new-school flavors, they are delicious.

strawberry.author: Kim N.
strawberry.review:
I knew this stuff was good when my boyfriend and I were fighting over who would get the last bite. I even went as far as to suck some of the vanilla cream out of the puff before I passed it over to him.

I told him to buy a dozen cream puffs...but nooooo! He thought we wouldn't be able to finish it all so we ended up with 1 chocolate, 1 strawberry, and 2 vanillas. We split a vanilla  when we got back to the car because we didn't want to eat too much before having dinner at House of Prime Rib and I wanted to enjoy my meat. 

The first bite was luscious! It was crispy on the outside and smooth and creamy on the inside. It wasn't too sweet--just the way I liked it. Unfortunately, I did inhale some of that powdered sugar. I wanted to save the cream puffs for the next day, but my boyfriend peer pressured me into eating them all with him. 

Now, 5 days later, he is still talking about those blasted cream puffs. He laments that he didn't get the dozen that I originally wanted. I can't even sleep at night anymore because he wakes me up and whispers "Beard Papa's" in my ear. Darn you Beard Papa's--you and your puffy, creamy, heavenly goodness.

Minus 1 star for being not hot and fresh out of the oven like I expected.

strawberry.author: Sharon R.
strawberry.review:
Cream puffs weren't even on my radar before Beard Papa.  But dang people, honestly, the praise for this Japanese cream puff chain could never be played out.  For real.  And their trademark "Beard Papa" (yellow hatted, fluffy gray bearded pipe smoker) is totally cute even if it is the most random.

I've tried the vanilla and the green tea puffs.  Both were absolutely phenomenal.  The green tea custard took me to heaven and back.  It tasted like the highest quality green tea ice cream in a warmer creamy goodness form with detectable hints of vanilla bean.

They have five rotating flavors of the week - green tea, milk tea, pumpkin, caramel and strawberry.  I just wish I could know the flavor in advanced of arrival.  But I guess the suspense is part of the experience.

And they use quality dairy products -- I know, like you can't taste it.  But evidence was had as I was waiting in line for my puff last Friday as the milk man was wheeling in carton upon carton of Clover milk and cream.

I was hesitant when a friend first gushed to me about this place. I was all - dude, a cream puff is a cream puff. There's no way you're getting me to pay that much for a dinky little pastry with some vanilla cream in the middle.

But, I've been put in my place. A cream puff is certainly not a cream puff. Beard Papa's is on a plane all its own. They are not dinky or little. And its not just vanilla, you can go crazy with chocolate, strawberry, or one of the seasonal flavors.

The only thing that bothers me is the name. Shouldn't it be "BeardED Papa's"? I know they're Japanese cream puffs but the name is in English. Proof read people.

Also, they opened a location at the new mall in the food court where the lines aren't nearly as bad. Pick up a box when you're out shopping. Your family/ roommates will love you for it.

Yummmm.. I don't ever normally purchase or make cream puffs. Just not my preferred dessert.. but something about these particular cream puffs makes me crave them whenever I'm within about 6 blocks of their vicinity. (Ok, and sometimes even when I'm not even in the city at all!) 

Restraint is definitely necessary to eat just one. Sometimes I give in and eat one there, and get a second one to take home. :) Don't bother to look up the calories. Why would you do that? It's a cream puff, obviously it's not going to be full of vitamins and other healthy nutrients. But who cares, it's a treat!

So far I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, and strawberry (favorite! with bits of chopped strawberry in it! mmmm.. too bad it's not a regular flavor), and the cookie crumble puff. I could give or take the cookie crumble, I think the regular puff is satisfying enough. My boyfriend has had the green tea flavor and said it was good as well.

The only downside to this place? I'm on a college student budget, and they happen to be 'conveniently' close enough for me to just stop by on my way to BART after class is done... ;)

strawberry.author: Alson L.
strawberry.review:
Sure there is a lot of hype behind this place, but they sure do back it up.

The decor inside the place can be best described as fun/kiddy as it is pretty bright and colorful. 

The puffs are definitely the star of the show here. While they have other items on the menu (eclairs, cheese cake, etc..) they simply cannot compare to the cream puffs. 

The filling has a light creamy texture and the pastry shell is fluffy and flaky.  My favorite used to be vanilla but that pushed to second when I tasted the strawberry which has strawberry bits in the filling. Chocolate is a distant third, and the others I'm just not as fond of. 

I like to break mine apart and eat them that way, rather than trying to bite into the whole puff as it can get messy. Either way, Beard Papa is a guilty pleasure that I'm more than willing to indulge in when I get a craving. They just opened another location in Redwood City 3 minutes from where I work, so I can get my fix after work without having to pay for parking in SF.

strawberry.author: jenna s.
strawberry.review:
Puff of magic deliciousness......... It was  a Wednesday afternoon and my co-worker and I needed a little afternoon pick me up. I knew exactly what we needed. I can almost feel the rush of sugar flowing to my brain just thinking about it now. We left the office and walked the 6 blocks down Mission St. to Beard Papa's   (across from the Metreon). This is the second time I've been to this location and it still amazes me how the Beard Papa employees turn out these little cream puffs and cakes as fast as one of Willy Wonkas assembly line oompa loompas. I hope that's not un PC to say, woops. 
They have the expected flavors such as strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla. But for the slightly more adventurous they also have Green Tea and Coffee. With the first Beard Papa's locations opening in Japan in 1999, this chain seems to be catching on pretty quickly in the U.S. Us Americans do like us some sugar and fried goodness! And since Krispy Kreme is pretty much non-existent in the SF (except for the stale versions in Safeway), I think Beard Papa's will be a success.  And if you complain about enhaling the powdered sugar then you deserve to be eating a stale doughnut instead.
 
Oh and their slogan is "fresh and natural". How can you go wrong? Okay I believe the fresh part because I witnessed it with my own eyes, but how all of that scrumcious cream can be "natural" is beyond me. All I know is that these little suckers are darn tasty! Highly recommend them to perk up any workday.

strawberry.author: Deb K.
strawberry.review:
At 3:30 p.m., the line was 25 people long for Beard Papa, the new cream puff shop owned by the Japanese corporation Muginoho. The San Francisco store on the new Yerba Buena Lane is one of a few U.S. franchises; the others are in New York, New Jersey, Boston, Hawaii and Los Angeles. 

After we'd waited for about 10 minutes, one of the staff came down the line, apologized, and told us it would be 30 minutes before another batch was ready. Because we were only ordering one, we decided to stay, in hopes it would be quicker. 

Beard Papa is quite the scene. Besides the long line winding out the door, there's a lot going on inside. When you first step over the threshold, you're hit with this delicious buttery scent. You can see the puffs baking in these industrial-looking, high-tech ovens. They start off the size of a hockey puck, and then rise into a much larger, 3-inch puff. The staff, dressed chef's whites, forms an assembly line when the puffs are done cooling, with one person injecting the custard into the puff, the second dusting it with powdered sugar and placing it in a bag, and the third packing them into carrying boxes.

This place inspires some kind of weird fanaticism, and after having a vanilla cream puff, I have to say it may be merited. The people in line were mostly all Asian, as were all of the staff. A family with four little boys was taking pictures with one of the staff. Overhead, on two flat screen TVs, news clips about Beard Papa played; at one point, I looked up and saw Anderson Cooper on CNN eating a cream puff. The store sells T-shirts with its mascot --- an old, bearded man in a cap, and the saying, "Who's Your Papa?" This is probably temporary, but there was a sign saying "Limit: One dozen per customer." 

The menu over the cream puff area had "Coming Soon" taped over all of the selections, except the vanilla cream puffs. Under coming soon: cream puffs of different flavors --- chocolate, caramel, green tea, pumpkin, milk tea and strawberry. With the exception of chocolate, the flavors will rotate on a weekly basis. There are also the curiously named cheesecake sticks, the fondant au chocolat and clairs. 

The puff itself is a marvel of choux pastry: flaky, buttery, and crunchy. The cream is also unique, and delicious. It is a not-too-sweet mixture of whipped cream and custard that the sign in Beard Papa's claims it takes two hours to make. You can see them scraping the vanilla bean pods, too, to extract the vanilla that flecks the cream in the vanilla cream puffs. I think this may be a new obsession for me.

marketing flaws aside, the pastry was sort of hard, like a stale croissant, and they were very large and messy, what with the powdered sugar (enough to choke a person - two of us almost died!) and oozing cream... which was quite dense and heavy, and not like any cream puff i've had before. i would've prefered to eat this sort of item with a fork on a plate out of the wind and not wearing black.

i might go back if i am at the metreon with someone who hasn't been before and we need some sugar, but then again, we could just go to starbuck*s.

strawberry.author: Jessica S.
strawberry.review:
You know, I've been here several times, and as a girl who loves her sweets, I simply cannot figure out why the line keeps snaking out the door. 
First off, I will hand it to them that their puffs, when fresh, are pretty darn good, aside from the weird (you know what I'm talking about, dammit) wheat-y aftertaste one gets after ingesting. 
The pastry cream sucks in all forms that I have had it in so far. The vanilla is not very vanilla-y, despite the specks of "vanilla bean" they so firmly claim they use in their custard. The chocolate blows, because it's bitter, and not like a sweet mousse that it should be. I have tired the strawberry, and it's so-so, but better than the chocolate.
The thing that gets me the most is their terrible service. The line time is glacial, GLACIAL for some balls of dough with dairy inside. They don't have the chocolate fondant yet, and it's been months now. Perfecting the recipe my ass. Hurry it up so I can try the last thing on your menu that intrigues me and leave me be. I have had three orders come out of this place that were wrong. 
Get your act together, or the locals will not return. Go down a couple of blocks to Grain D'Or and give their pastries a try. At least they taste sweet.

strawberry.author: Clara K.
strawberry.review:
i first tried beard papa cream puffs in nyc a few years ago, and was ecstatic when they opened a store at this location on yerba buena lane in san francisco. after a few visits, my elation slipped half a notch, but not because the cream puffs aren't excellent -- they're still quite tasty with the crisp outer shell that they fill with creamy custard when you order -- but because i think i've just kinda outgrown them or maybe realized that only occasional indulgence is a good thing and getting sick of beard papa's CAN happen. :P or maybe because i tried the chocolate one and it wasn't that good, weakly flavored and a bit grainy. i do wholeheartedly recommend the original vanilla flavor, as well as the pumpkin flavor and the strawberry. the green tea is good if you're a green tea fan, and caramel tastes like vanilla with a hint of caramel (which is good but not that caramelly). i also recently tried the royal milk tea flavor and it was okay, but not one of the better flavors. come to think of it, i guess i've tried pretty much all their flavors! the only thing is that they have vanilla and chocolate every day, but the rest of the flavors rotate on a weekly basis so they might not have the flavor you want the day you go.

i've also tried the cheesecake stick which wasn't very good. they also have an eclair (chocolate glazed version of the cream puff) and some kind of molten chocolate lava cake that i haven't yet tried.

i didn't know i had so much to say about beard papa's. the sad thing is that i could go on, but i won't. :P

Now I can't say that I have ever been a big creme puff fan.  You usually get some slightly chewy flavorless pastry puff with boring whip creme inside.  But this-this is on a whole other level.  This was a perfectly crispy but soft on the inside puff with perfect light whipped creme inside and powdered sugar on the outside.  It was perfection.  And they have flavors, green tea, strawberry, chocolate, they rotate them, so you never get bored.  I dream of the day we get one here in Seattle!

excerpts: At $1.75 for a regular vanilla cream puff and nearly $2 for their specialty cream puffs (chocolate / caramel / strawberry, etc) Beard Papa is a once in a while sort of snack for me.
My bf just came back from Asia and was raving about the Beard Papas over there, so we decided to check out the new establishment in SF.
We each had a vanilla bean cream puff.
My first Beard Papa "experience.
After reading reviews on Yelp about this place,  I was so curious what the first bite would be like.
Light flaky pastry with a sweet but not too sweet creamy custard filling.
The little flecks of real vanilla bean were a nice touch.
While I thought the cream puff was tasty, I also didn't feel the urge to run back in the store and buy 12 more.
Plus by then, the line had grown, and I didn't love the cream puff enough to stand 30 min in the cold.
I give Beard Papa three stars...
I've had better cream puffs in my lifetime, albeit made homemade from French cooks, but Beard Papa's is good too.

I'd never heard of a place that specializes in cream puffs so this was an exciting day for me. 

You choose what kind of puff and cream you want inside. My two coworkers got the original with vanilla filling. I had the eclair puff with hazelnut cream. Once I saw it, I was worried the cream would be more like frosting but it did have the creamy, custard texture. It was delicious. I ate mine super fast and tried my coworker's. 

I wish they had been a bit fresher but overall very tasty and price was reasonable for the size. Would go back.
