Definitely would return again!
eclair.author: Michelle L.
eclair.review: Bear Papas was lovely. Cream puffs....AMAZING There's is so many combinations and it was hard for me to choose. I got the strawberry eclair filled with ice cream and it was everything I'd hope it to be. Definitely would return again!

excerpts: My bf got the Chocolate (eclair) puff with caramel inside.
I got my sister a Matcha (eclair) puff with vanilla ice cream filling (extra $.75 for ice cream filling).
We all agreed that it only tasted alright - not flavorful.
Honestly there wasn't much flavor to the fillings at all.
They also didn't really fill the puffs up so half of it was empty.
I remember last time we were here the fillings were oozing out of the puffs.
My sister said she couldn't taste the matcha on the outside of the puffs.
All this for $11.25.
Pretty pricy tbh.
We were pretty disappointed and probably wouldn't come back.
eclair.author: Trang T.
eclair.review: My bf and I have tried Beard Papa's about 4 times in total. First time at this location, one time in Milpitas, one time in Vietnam, and today. We came here because we were hanging out in SF and we're craving the cream filled yummyness that we remembered from summer '16. I remember back then they had other filling flavors like cookies and cream but this time they have matcha instead. I was excited to try the matcha filling. So I got the Honey and Butter puff with matcha inside. My bf got the Chocolate (eclair) puff with caramel inside. I got my sister a Matcha (eclair) puff with vanilla ice cream filling (extra $.75 for ice cream filling). We all agreed that it only tasted alright - not flavorful. Honestly there wasn't much flavor to the fillings at all. They also didn't really fill the puffs up so half of it was empty. I remember last time we were here the fillings were oozing out of the puffs. My sister said she couldn't taste the matcha on the outside of the puffs. All this for $11.25. Pretty pricy tbh. We were pretty disappointed and probably wouldn't come back.

excerpts: I got the eclair puff and my friend got a cream filled with green tea.
Next time I come, I am going to get the eclair puff with green tea filling.
Must try!
Next time I come, I am going to get the eclair puff with green tea filling.
Must try!
eclair.author: Sonia A.
eclair.review:
I love this place for it's cream puffs! Best cream puffs I have ever had! This last time I went I got the eclair puff and my friend got a cream filled with green tea. We also got a chocolate fondant as well. They were all amazing. 
Next time I come, I am going to get the eclair puff with green tea filling. Must try!

excerpts: We got regular, chocolate, and eclair puffs, all with vanilla filling.
Made fresh daily, these puffs were quite big, but what I liked was that they were not overly sweet or overpowering.
They were an almost refreshing and filling pastry that are definitely best when freshly filled with cream.
Excellent visit!
eclair.author: Thuan T.
eclair.review:
I, for one, have never had fresh cream puffs.. but these ones got me HOOKED.
At first the prices on the puffs seem a bit steep, but that's also partially because I was expecting small pastries... what I got on the other hand were behemoth cream puffs that are filled right up with either chocolate or vanilla filling right in front of you!
We got regular, chocolate, and eclair puffs, all with vanilla filling. Made fresh daily, these puffs were quite big, but what I liked was that they were not overly sweet or overpowering. They were an almost refreshing and filling pastry that are definitely best when freshly filled with cream. Excellent visit!

excerpts: I admit, I ordered an eclair but let me tell you...
It tasted exactly like a cream puff.
They are definitely not suppose to taste the same.
The cream filling was too fluffy and not dense enough.
The only difference between the two are that the "eclair" had chocolate on its shell.
I did see cheesecake sticks but honestly after a subpar eclair I couldn't bring myself to continue.
They reassured me that I'm not a psycho eclair critic and that it was a less than average eating experience.
eclair.author: Breanna P.
eclair.review:
These cream puffs are made fresh daily but still are not up to par. This sounds really rude but honestly I think I've had better at Whole Foods. I hate comparing businesses but I don't mess around when it comes to dessert! 

I admit, I ordered an eclair but let me tell you... It tasted exactly like a cream puff. They are definitely not suppose to taste the same. The cream filling was too fluffy and not dense enough. The only difference between the two are that the "eclair" had chocolate on its shell. 

They are in a great location that is a prime touristy spot. Maybe that's all that's going for them? I did see cheesecake sticks but honestly after a subpar eclair I couldn't bring myself to continue. 

Dessert is my favorite type of indulgence. I don't mess around when it comes to that portion of the menu. I was really disappointed in the turnout. I thought I might have been too harsh so I had two friends also taste it. They reassured me that I'm not a psycho eclair critic and that it was a less than average eating experience.

excerpts: I ordered a chocolate eclair with vanilla filling but was disappointed.
The eclair had a very hard outer layer.
I would have preferred a cake like texture instead.
Also, it did not seem very fresh and the cream filling was okayish.
eclair.author: Aanchal G.
eclair.review: I visited this place on an evening to try out eclairs as a friend of mine raved about them. I ordered a chocolate eclair with vanilla filling but was disappointed. The eclair had a very hard outer layer. I would have preferred a cake like texture instead. Also, it did not seem very fresh and the cream filling was okayish.

excerpts:
Eclair cream puff with green tea custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#9I1eafhGAWlh-JbwgGEh-A)
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling.
Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did!
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling.
Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did!
The silky green tea custard inside seemed to engulf everything in a sea of matcha, and I was pleasantly surprised at how "right" the green tea tasted.
My friend opted for tradition, and he did enjoy his cream puff as well, although he said that my green tea custard would be his first choice next time.
I had a quick bite and thought that while I could still taste the freshness of the cream puff itself, it was a little one-dimensional after enjoying my eclair one.
eclair.author: Maggie X.
eclair.review:
I have to say.. I'm not really a cream puff kind of gal. I'd much prefer cake or a cupcake or a (chocolate) croissant or.. more cake? But even I can tell when a dessert is freshly made, and I definitely appreciate both that and the fact that the custard cream inside isn't deathly sweet.

Located just a few steps from Bluestem Brasserie, it's a short walk from the crowded Market Street and surprisingly calm. There are a few tables situated inside the store, but more scattered outside. The mechanism is assembly line: choose a kind of cream puff, choose your filling, pay, and enjoy. Service was mediocre but efficient, and the prices are very reasonable. 

Eclair cream puff with green tea custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#9I1eafhGAWlh-JbwgGEh-A)
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling. Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did! The chocolate on the outside was smooth and rich, which paired very well with the fragrant cream puff. The silky green tea custard inside seemed to engulf everything in a sea of matcha, and I was pleasantly surprised at how "right" the green tea tasted. 

Vanilla cream puff with vanilla custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#QIj2Oz-kWXntstYnOTPfvQ)
My friend opted for tradition, and he did enjoy his cream puff as well, although he said that my green tea custard would be his first choice next time. I had a quick bite and thought that while I could still taste the freshness of the cream puff itself, it was a little one-dimensional after enjoying my eclair one. I think the added layer of chocolate or another ingredient really makes a difference. I did like that the vanilla custard was also not overly sweet, so the entire thing wasn't too heavy from start to finish.

If there were an option to have the cream puff heated up just a tad before pumping in the cool custard, I think I'd have trouble stopping myself from converting into a cream puff gal..

excerpts: The eclair with vanilla (traditions) filling was my favorite.
eclair.author: Alejandro R.
eclair.review:
Super duper amazing cream puffs. If they had espresso coffee it would have been 5 stars.... That and the fact that they don't take Discover (thumb down)
The freshness can be tasted in every bite. No still cream puffs like in many other places. The eclair with vanilla (traditions) filling was my favorite. I really wanted to try the coffee and the pumpkins filling but today they only had vanilla, chocolate and strawberry. 
I would have been ok w/o the tiramisu stick (average at best)...

excerpts: I always end up buying cream puffs at around the same time so I often get the green tea eclair.
Green tea cream goes great with the cookie one too!
eclair.author: Sofia R.
eclair.review:
I freaking LOVE cream puffs! 

I always end up buying cream puffs at around the same time so I often get the green tea eclair. Green tea cream goes great with the cookie one too! 

Just wanted to update my review to remind SFSU students to use their student discount and not let workers tell you they don't have it anymore. Integrity!

excerpts: I like to get the eclair puff with vanilla cream.
eclair.author: Semuteh F.
eclair.review:
Love this place! They make one thing and make it well--cream puffs! I didn't think I was a fan of cream puffs until a had a Beard Papa cream puff. It's life changing. They fill them to order and you should eat it right away. The filling is delicious--not too sweet and slightly chilled. I like to get the eclair puff with vanilla cream. 

So so good! There's a location in the mall too but I like this one because you can get your puff to go and sit out in Yuerba Buena to eat it. It's a little messy and you can't really look cute eating it but it's worth the sticky fingers and face.

excerpts: We stuck to the basics, each getting either a vanilla or chocolate cream puff, or an eclair.
You can pick your filling - so there are lots of combinations of flavors to try.
eclair.author: Rob N.
eclair.review:
Our family stopped in here for a mid-afternoon snack after going to an event at the Moscone Center. We stuck to the basics, each getting either a vanilla or chocolate cream puff, or an eclair. You can pick your filling - so there are lots of combinations of flavors to try.  Everything was fresh tasting, and the fillings were very creamy and smooth.

Great place to drop in for an affordable treat.

excerpts: Raji R. and Angela L. are right on the mark with their observations of the not-terribly-overwhelming puff / eclair shells.
eclair.author: Vincent L.
eclair.review:
Raji R. and Angela L. are right on the mark with their observations of the not-terribly-overwhelming puff / eclair shells.

But the cream itself is darn good and just right. Not bland, but not overpoweringly sweet. And there are several choices at any given time. Green tea? Pleasantly refreshing. Pumpkin? A scrumptious way to celebrate the season. The chocolate fondant is wholly satisfying too.

Overall, a sweet, yummy treat that's worth a quick stop if you're in the area.

excerpts: NOT a big fan of the eclair, as I don't care for the hard crispy shell.
eclair.author: Scott G.
eclair.review:
I saw another reviewer list the price as $3.50 per puff, but I thought I paid $5 for 2. In any case, definitely worth the money. I'm a huge fan of both vanilla and chocolate creme filling. Haven't tried some of the newer iterations with chocolate shell instead of traditional pastry shell. 

NOT a big fan of the eclair, as I don't care for the hard crispy shell. I'd prefer it if the chocolate were softer.

I'll continue to hit this place when I'm in town!

excerpts: I made it a point to go after lunch and grab an eclair shell filled with vanilla custard.
It was just as delicious as I remembered!
And just as messy to boot.
Lots of tasty bits of custard shooting out every which way as I took bite after bite.
So good
I scooped that shit up with my fingers and licked it clean.
but I ain't mad at the eclair!
eclair.author: Annette J.
eclair.review:
Ooooh, Beard Papa's! I've missed you!!

I used to have one of these down the street from my office in Chicago and it was my favorite afternoon treat on a crappy work day. So imagine my excitement when I walked by it right down the street from the Yelp offices today on my way to lunch. OH HAPPY DAY! I made it a point to go after lunch and grab an eclair shell filled with vanilla custard. It was just as delicious as I remembered! And just as messy to boot. Lots of tasty bits of custard shooting out every which way as I took bite after bite. So good I scooped that shit up with my fingers and licked it clean. YES!

My only complaint is that they don't have quite the same selection as the Chicago location. My favorite treat there was the Paris Breast, a ring of cinnamon and sugar pastry stuffed with custard. I could have really gone for one of those today but I ain't mad at the eclair! :)

excerpts: I like to take my vanilla filled eclair over to the gardens next door and eat the wonderful pastry while watching children chase pidgeons.
eclair.author: Christina S.
eclair.review:
Beard Papa is a beautiful thing. There is also one in the Westfield basement, if you're already in the mall.

I like to take my vanilla filled eclair over to the gardens next door and eat the wonderful pastry while watching children chase pidgeons.

Another wonderful thing about Beard Papa is that there is a different special flavor every day! Fan favorites are the strawberry and the green tea; I have yet to try any other ones.

Also, Beard Papa the character was in Wreck-It Ralph!

excerpts: but I stuck to my favorite chocolate eclair with chocolate filling.
eclair.author: Leina K.
eclair.review: Walked in today with a friend that was craving some sweets and was greeted by two friendly guys who recommended their new tiramisu with chocolate oozing out. My friend said it was pretty amazing but I stuck to my favorite chocolate eclair with chocolate filling. Also try their funky fillings like green tea every once in a while.

excerpts: My favs are the Original Vanilla and Eclair.
eclair.author: Elena N.
eclair.review: I don't think you can tell by the website, but they only have Original Vanilla and Chocolate on a day to day basis.  They add a flavor of the month which I believe is one of the other flavors listed on their site.  My favs are the Original Vanilla and Eclair.  I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.  The Chocolate needed more chocolate flavor and the Coffee needed more coffee flavor.  I like my chocolate and coffee flavors strong so these were both a little too light for me.  Other than that, this is definitely a great place to go if you're craving a cream puff!

excerpts: We tried the eclair, original (vanilla), and chocolate.
eclair.author: Carolyn H.
eclair.review:
Tasty cream puffs and great service.  This was our first time at Beard Papa, which serves Japanese cream puffs, which have cream that is less viscous than what you would find in a classic profiterole.  We tried the eclair, original (vanilla), and chocolate.  They were tasty, made with fresh ingredients.  

Separate from the quality pastry, I would like to give a shout out to the service.  In addition to being kind and efficient, they are honest and incredibly helpful.  We left a nondescript messenger bag at the shop, but did not realize our error for over three hours.  When we called the store, they immediately confirmed that they had the bag.  Relieved, we ran over to retrieve our bag, which they had kept safe for us.  We wanted to tip them for their kindness and integrity, and they refused.  Thank you, Beard Papa at Yerba Buena!

excerpts: I actually went for the chocolate covered eclair with a vanilla bean center. '
eclair.author: Abby S.
eclair.review:
I'll say it once again: there's always room for dessert! 

After enjoying a healthy lunch over at Samovar, my companions and I decided to mix it up a little bit and order some cream puffs. Uh huh! I actually went for the chocolate covered eclair with a vanilla bean center. 'Twas delish!

Although I will say that my mom makes a DAMN good cream puff herself... so I can't give Beard Papa too many stars. Or she'll come get me and I'll be in trouble :)

excerpts: He got a Chocolate eclair.
The vanilla cream was not too sweet which complemented & softened the sweetness of the chocolate on top.
I got a Coffee cream puff.
The pastry was delicate & the cream filling had a good deal of coffee flavor.
eclair.author: Karen S.
eclair.review:
Why have I never had Beard Papa's before this; especially when there used to be 1 blocks away from my apartment?

He got a Chocolate eclair.  The vanilla cream was not too sweet which complemented & softened the sweetness of the chocolate on top.  I got a Coffee cream puff.  The pastry was delicate & the cream filling had a good deal of coffee flavor.  Unfortunately, my cream puff was already filled.

These are not your usual cream puffs from the bakery or freezer sections.  $2.25 for a pillow of air & cream is a bit of a luxury but it is a great little treat for those special days (or just when you feel like).

excerpts: There's the regular puff, eclair puff, or my favorite, the cocoa puff.
All the creams are great as well.
eclair.author: C. Z.
eclair.review:
I love Beard Papa's. So soft. So fluffy. All the layers. Heaven.

If you're gonna get Beard Papa's, come to this store and not the location in the nearby mall food court. 

There's the regular puff, eclair puff, or my favorite, the cocoa puff. All the creams are great as well. They have the usual vanilla and chocolate creams as well a special flavor each week like coffee, strawberry, or caramel. Strawberry is awesome. Caramel is meh. If you're going to visit somewhere, bring a dozen of these and you'll be so loved. 

My favorite flavors for the cream are: Mango, strawberry, chocolate, and gool ol' vanilla.

I wish they would have a facebook page like the cupertino store to advertise weekly specials/flavors.

excerpts: So I have had the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, green tea....the eclair.
There have been so many flavors over the years that I can't keep track.
eclair.author: PNotHere E.
eclair.review:
I first had Beard Papa in Oahu when I went back about 10 or so years back.  It was longer than 10 years but who's counting?  Whenever I get into San Francisco close to the Metreon and Yerba Buena I usually at the very minimum go in the doors and look.  I sometimes don't purchase anything but usually I get at least one.  

So I have had the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, green tea....the eclair.  There have been so many flavors over the years that I can't keep track.  I'd venture to guess I have had all their flavors somehow in the past 10 years. 

This location is nice as it sits across the street from Yerba Buena where you can bring your cream puffs, find a place to sit and relax with your sinful treat.  They are light, fluffy and the cool to cold filling that is placed into the flaky ball really hits the spot.  The price seems a bit outrageous but these are pretty fresh and, in my opinion, well worth going to try and possibly bring home.  

They are sinfully good...so much that there is a church less than 100 feet away to confess your sins.  

Get one or three.  They won't last long.

excerpts: The eclair is my favorite and I killed one while driving away.
eclair.author: Mymy N.
eclair.review: These cream puffs sure beat those costco ones! They're HUGE and the vanilla bean cream inside is smooth and not too sweet. The pastry is light and airy and perfectly balances that sweet cream. Too bad you can't taste the calories in these things! The eclair is my favorite and I killed one while driving away.

excerpts: Only downfall of my otherwise pleasant experience was that cashier had messed up my friend's order ( we ordered a coco puff with mango filling and cookie crunch (?) with mango filling but instead received an eclair and cookie crunch).

When my friend noticed it ( immediately after the server handed it to her) the server gave my friend attitude and yelled at her, saying it was OUR fault the cashier got it wrong and that she couldn't do anything about it because she already made the order.
Uhhh wtf.
Why don't you eat the damn eclair then and give us the coco puff we ordered (which btw was CHEAPER than the eclair).
If it weren't for the workers I'd give this place 4 stars!
eclair.author: Jess s.
eclair.review:
Best cream puffs hands down. 
The mango cream puff was smooth and silky ! And even had tiny chunks of mango pieces in it! 

Even though it's probably super fattening, I couldnt help myself to two because it was THAT good! 

Only downfall of my otherwise pleasant experience was that cashier had messed up my friend's order ( we ordered a coco puff with mango filling and cookie crunch (?) with mango filling but instead received an eclair and cookie crunch). When my friend noticed it ( immediately after the server handed it to her) the server gave my friend attitude and yelled at her, saying it was OUR fault the cashier got it wrong and that she couldn't do anything about it because she already made the order. Uhhh wtf. Why don't you eat the damn eclair then and give us the coco puff we ordered (which btw was CHEAPER than the eclair). If it weren't for the workers I'd give this place 4 stars!

excerpts: I can never eat more eclair or cream puff  than one because they're so rich and messy.
The cream puffs are unfilled - customers choose the filling they want, which is injected at the time.
eclair.author: Barbara B.
eclair.review:
I don't eat a lot of sweets, but I try to make a point of going to Beard Papa's at least once a year (I live 150 miles away). 

Crunchy, creamy, delicious... and so hard to decide which flavor to choose this time! I can never eat more eclair or cream puff  than one because they're so rich and messy. The cream puffs are unfilled - customers choose the filling they want, which is injected at the time. Flavors include vanilla and green tea. 

There are several locations in San Francisco, but this is the only one I've tried.

excerpts: We ordered three puffs in all --- one chocolate, one vanilla, one vanilla eclair.
Each was cold.
I always imagined my puffs would arrive warm.
The chocolate lacked any depth of flavor whatsoever.
The vanilla was significantly better but the temperature just turned me off.
As a result, my cream puff collaborator was forced to eat most of our order himself.
eclair.author: Miriam W.
eclair.review:
In my imagination I'd walk into Beard Papa, place my order and at the other end of the counter find heaven waiting for me in a clearly branded bag. Not unlike my daydreams of unicorns and Prince Charming, Beard Papa failed miserably to live up to the heights I had built it to in my mind. 

We ordered three puffs in all --- one chocolate, one vanilla, one vanilla eclair. Each was cold. I always imagined my puffs would arrive warm. The chocolate lacked any depth of flavor whatsoever. The vanilla was significantly better but the temperature just turned me off. As a result, my cream puff collaborator was forced to eat most of our order himself.

excerpts: the chocolate eclair with vanilla, and the cookie crunch cream puff with the vanilla filling.
Stick with the original cream puff with vanilla or make it a chocolate eclair for the extra decadence!
eclair.author: Maggie W.
eclair.review: What's better than watching big, fluffy cream puffs being filled with the custard of your choice right before your eyes? Why - eating them, of course. I've been to Beard Papa's several times now, and I've tried the original cream puff with both the vanilla bean and chocolate custards, the chocolate eclair with vanilla, and the cookie crunch cream puff with the vanilla filling. The chocolate filling is a little too rich for my taste (I never thought I would say such a thing), and the cookie crunch shell doesn't amaze me enough to justify the extra costs. Stick with the original cream puff with vanilla or make it a chocolate eclair for the extra decadence!

excerpts: Next time I have to go back for an eclair...or that crunchy vanilla creme puff.
eclair.author: Dawn D.
eclair.review:
We were walking back to our car after having lunch in celebration of completing the Nike Women's  (half) marathon,  when we spotted this Beard Papa's..We couldn't help but go in.  

Next time I have to go back for an eclair...or that crunchy vanilla creme puff.

I had the coffee creme puff and it was tons yummy!! It wasn't too sweet, just right and a lil messy  - or may be that was me. :)

excerpts: I had the Chocolate eclair with Vanilla filling.
It was really tasty and the chocolate top was breaking away from the bottom part as I was eating it.
It was really messy and I had chocolate all over my fingers and yellow custard all over my mouth.
eclair.author: James H.
eclair.review:
I had the Chocolate eclair with Vanilla filling.  It was really tasty and the chocolate top was breaking away from the bottom part as I was eating it. It was really messy and I had chocolate all over my fingers and yellow custard all over my mouth.

It was pretty good.  I think I may have to work out at the gym for 3 days straight to make up for it.  They probably should not make these places so convenient that you can just bump into them while your walking down the street.

excerpts: Next time I'm going back for the eclair...
eclair.author: Wendy L.
eclair.review:
Beard Papa, Beard Papa.  That's all I hear when people talk about cream puffs...

I know I'm a meat girl by birth, but I always love me a good cream puff.  I like light desserts, airy, tiny, tasty.  My sister and I splurged and split a single vanilla cream puff (I had no idea that the "standard" cream puff "flavor" was vanilla).  These cream puffs were some of the biggest I've ever seen before, so I'm glad we split them.  The cream/custard was DELICIOUS - airy, creamy, light.  So many cream puffs go wrong with that dense, icky, overly-lardy/buttery heaviness, but Beard Papa's cream filling was perfect.

I was a little less than thrilled with the "puff" (I guess that's what they are when you disaggregate them) - it was just a little doughy and standard - I was expecting the contrasting flavors and tastes of cold cream and warm puff.  Oh well.  

Next time I'm going back for the eclair...

excerpts: As a true eclair junkie, i must say this place is pretty increadible!
I have only been there once, but I guarantee it will become a weekly regular form me.
eclair.author: The Man M.
eclair.review:
Whoa! - As a true eclair junkie, i must say this place is pretty increadible!  I have only been there once, but I guarantee it will become a weekly regular form me. There goes the waist line... 


Update: This place SUCKS! - i have been there 27 times in the last two weeks and now all my clothes don't fit! Thaks a lot PAPA - jack ass! 

Update: no! Wait! - i'am sorry - i didn't mean it, please let me back in......

excerpts: I definitely would have HAD to try each cream puff and each eclair.
What I tried was OMG SO amazingly delicious, a pure party in my mouth; I got it all over myself so it must have been good, right?
eclair.author: Me H.
eclair.review:
I'm so glad I didn't try Beard Papa's until a few hours before I headed home.  If I did I'm sure I would have gained five pounds instead of losing five pounds while on vacation.  I definitely would have HAD to try each cream puff and each eclair.  What I tried was OMG SO amazingly delicious, a pure party in my mouth; I got it all over myself so it must have been good, right?  I was cursing you all the way to the airport over the sadness of knowing it will be a long time before I could become one with the Beard Papa cream puff once again...

Lo and behold when I arrived back in Seattle I checked their website http://www.beardpapa.com/main.php?nav=locations) to see where the closest Beard Papa's was to me and found out that sometime this month there is going to be one in Uwajimaya and at Safeco Field, this just made things so much more exciting for me!  Cream puffs and baseball can it get any better than that people?  I don't think so.

excerpts: I went to the Bloomingdale's Beard Papa first--where they only sell vanilla, chocolate, and chocolate eclair flavors.
But I noticed this location on Mission was bigger and had specialty flavors
Stick with the vanilla or chocolate.
The chocolate eclairs are even messier.
eclair.author: Cindy P.
eclair.review:
A store that only sells cream puffs? I was intrigued. They must be super-amazing-orgasm good, right? Not really.

I went to the Bloomingdale's Beard Papa first--where they only sell vanilla, chocolate, and chocolate eclair flavors. But I noticed this location on Mission was bigger and had specialty flavors so I gave it a shot too.

They rotate the specialty flavors each week and the ones I can remember off the top of my head are pumpkin and green tea. Pumpkin flavor BTW was bleh. I'd rather have a pumpkin pie. Stick with the vanilla or chocolate.

As far as cream puffs go, I like that they are fresh but they are so big that eating them is a HUGE MESS. I guess this would be ok if you have that fetish where you like to be covered in food. I don't. The chocolate eclairs are even messier. I practically needed to take a shower after eating one of those.

In summary, good cream puffs but not good enough to crave. They're comparable to the frozen cream puffs that Trader Joe's sells.

excerpts: And if you're in the mood for chocolate, get the double chocolate eclair, much better than just getting the plain chocolate puff.
In the span of 4 days, I've paid Papa 3 visits.
Chocolate cream puffs are now available, but the vanilla ones taste way better, and plus they're 20 cents cheaper.
eclair.author: Connie C.
eclair.review:
UPDATE 6/23/06: I tried the green tea cream puffs and they are SO GOOD! Tied with vanilla in my book. And if you're in the mood for chocolate, get the double chocolate eclair, much better than just getting the plain chocolate puff. In the span of 4 days, I've paid Papa 3 visits. I see him more than I see my own dad!

UPDATE 6/2/06: Chocolate cream puffs are now available, but the vanilla ones taste way better, and plus they're 20 cents cheaper.

I learned my lesson the first time I went here and had to walk away empty-handed because the wait was too long. This time, I called Beard Papa and asked them what their wait time was. 

"There's no one in line right now."

"What?! Ok, I'll be right there!" 

I hung up the phone and ran out of my office with my coworker, collecting money from others on the way. We practically ran over there, which was actually smart because when we got there, there was only 1 person in front of us. We placed our order and stepped aside. In seconds, 10 people had lined up behind us. When we got our yellow box of cream puffs, we brought them outside and proceeded to indulge in these heavenly puffs. We looked like 2 kids eating with powdered sugar all over our lips and chins. The puff was not warm, but I didn't mind the vanilla custard inside being chilled. It's probably not worth a wait longer than 10 minutes, but it's good enough that you can't just eat one in a sitting.

excerpts: The choux pastry has no taste (at least not any that's discernible from the glob of sugary cream and powdered sugar - and chocolate if you got the "eclair").
eclair.author: T C.
eclair.review:
I don't see what the big deal is about these things.  I've had them a few times, and I just can't fathom why anybody would wait in some ridiculously long line for them.  I've had them here, at the one in the mall, and even in their home country of Japan outside of a train station in Tokyo (where there was also a short line for the freshies).  They smell damn good fresh, but that's about it.

It's a novel idea, and they're not horrible/inedible, but to me, it's the same as getting a tub of Cool hwhip (yeah, hwhip - hwhat's wrong hwhith that?), and taking a big ole spoonful or two and shoving that in your mouth.  The choux pastry has no taste (at least not any that's discernible from the glob of sugary cream and powdered sugar - and chocolate if you got the "eclair").  Maybe it's just me.  

Anyways, if you go to the one in the mall on a weekend afternoon, be prepared for a huge line.  Other times, it's quite manageable, if there's a line at all.

excerpts: I bought a few (chocolate, vanilla, and eclair with vanilla) and brought them in to work for my co-workers to sample.
I think the consensus was that the chocolate puff was the best of the three, perhaps because the puff itself tasted most fresh, sort of eggy like a popover.
Yum.
eclair.author: Cassidy P.
eclair.review: Okay, so I have to admit I have absolutely nothing to compare to my B. Puffy experience--really not a lot of fried foods where I grew up.  I bought a few (chocolate, vanilla, and eclair with vanilla) and brought them in to work for my co-workers to sample.  I think the consensus was that the chocolate puff was the best of the three, perhaps because the puff itself tasted most fresh, sort of eggy like a popover.  Yum.

excerpts: To me, they look exactly like a cream puff except the puff part of the eclair is more dry.
And the taste is.....bleh.
eclair.review:
I walked by one day and noticed the bright yellow writing on the glass in front. I waited anxiously for opening day to come. Opening day was crazy!!! The line was out the door and down the block. They were handing out samples. I wasn't about to wait in line for that long and decided to come back when things died down a bit. 

They had a promotion going on that first week. Buy 20 cream puffs and get a free thermos. I asked about the thermos and they ran out. I was a lil' disappointed so the guy gave my girlfriend and I a charm for our cell phone. That was nice of him to do that.  

When I tasted that first puff.....oh my!!!! It was sooooo good. It wasn't too sweet. It was perfect!!!! I went back each week to taste all the other flavors. Their flavored cream puffs are "Rotating on a weekly basis". I like all of them except the chocolate one. It tasted funny to me. My favorite is green tea and milk tea. The milk tea puff is available in San Francisco only. The coffee one is available in Redwood City only. 

They have cheesecake sticks for $1.25. It was good but not as good as a regular cheesecake. 

The Fondant Au Chocolat ($2.25) is mouthwatering!!! It's not too sweet either. 

The eclairs cost a little bit more than the cream puffs. I'm not very fond of them. To me, they look exactly like a cream puff except the puff part of the eclair is more dry. And the taste is.....bleh.  This may be only me though.

They had really long lines during the day time and after work for about 6 months. After that, you can just walk in any time of day and wait in line for a few minutes. 

On their website you can see the flavors of the week for San Francisco. I've included a link below.

http://www.beardpapasf.com/flavors_sf.htm 

Go get your puff on!!!!!

EDIT 8/8/07: Just went in and saw they have gotten rid of the milk tea flavor cream puff and replaced it with tiramisu. NOOOO!!!! I really liked the milk tea one. *sob*

I had a vanilla and a green tea (the flavor of the week) puff less than 5 minutes from when I entered the shop. Both scrumptious. Five dreamy stars.

eclair.author: Jen E.
eclair.review:
I'm so not hip.  I didn't know anything about this place.  We were up at the MOMA today on a field trip and this one Mom said I'm going to find that Japanese cream puff place.  Not wanting to go home, I followed her. We found it easily.  She waited in line while the rest of us watched the kids run around.
After about 30 minutes she was back with a dozen.  We each had one, then two as the kids really didn't like them. Lucky me, I got three since neither of my kids liked them. :-p
Super yummy!  Love the crunchy flaky pastry and the custard filling.  Would've been the world's be eclair if only there were some chocolate.  
Was wondering...do you think I could buy just the pastries and fill them with ice cream at home???? Yum!

excerpts: Best Chocolate Eclair (with Vanilla filling)
I've ever eaten.
However, that's if you wait 5-10 minutes for it to "thaw" out a little.
I got it a little cold, didn't get it fresh from the oven.
Despite that, the eclair was delicious!
They offer  3 types of cream filling (green tea, vanilla, chocolate) in the puffs or eclairs.
I only realized this when the cashier asked.
Other desserts they offer are cheesecake sticks-if you're on the go and don't want cream filling dripping all over, and chocolate au fondant.
I wish they had some iced mocha-chocolate frappes to go down with my eclairs...
eclair.author: Aileen A.
eclair.review:
Best Chocolate Eclair (with Vanilla filling) I've ever eaten. However, that's if you wait 5-10 minutes for it to "thaw" out a little. I got it a little cold, didn't get it fresh from the oven. They should seriously consider changing the fridge temperature or think about making less puffs so that there's not a lot of excess to chill up. 

Despite that, the eclair was delicious!

Cream puffs were just okay, puff too crunchy (tasted like crackers for a sec)-not flakey like most-but super generous with the filling.

They offer  3 types of cream filling (green tea, vanilla, chocolate) in the puffs or eclairs. I only realized this when the cashier asked. I'm not sure I saw these choices on the menu.

Other desserts they offer are cheesecake sticks-if you're on the go and don't want cream filling dripping all over, and chocolate au fondant. Other locations offer mango ice shower, mochi, and Mont Blanc. 

For beverages: tea, coffee, vitamin water (no formula fiddy though!), etc. I wish they had some iced mocha-chocolate frappes to go down with my eclairs...

Not worth the travel, but worth the two block walk if you happen to be around the neighborhood...

excerpts: Experiment with the other items on the menu -- such as the $2.10 eclair or the strawberry-flavored cream puffs -- at your leisure.
eclair.author: Wella L.
eclair.review:
Just one more fan chiming in to say Beard Papa cream puffs are the bomb!

Yeah, it's a weird name. Japanese franchise. Does that explain it?

Because they're made with fresh ingredients, you must keep refrigerated and consume them within 24 hours of purchase. Yeah, right. Like they'd last that long in my house. I'm eating these "puffies" as soon as I'm out of the door.

Get the $1.75 vanilla cream puff for the classic experience. Experiment with the other items on the menu -- such as the $2.10 eclair or the strawberry-flavored cream puffs -- at your leisure.

excerpts: The best is the "eclair" with vanilla creme.
Caramel is also good if they've got it.
eclair.author: Valerie M.
eclair.review:
Fisherman Santa*, I love you.

The best is the "eclair" with vanilla creme. Caramel is also good if they've got it. They're big enough to share, if you're feeling virtuous, and if not, well, just more deliciousness for you.

The only downside? Messy! Unless you have a giant mouth and devour it in one bite, chances are you're going to have to lick your fingers several dozen times. But it's worth it, I promise.

The chocolate fondant thingies are also delicious, if you want something a little smaller/more chocolatey.
 

*this is what my boyfriend calls the Beard Papa icon-man

excerpts: I wasn't blown away by the eclair, but I've never been one for chocolatey coating.
Hubby said it is the best eclair he's ever had though.
The vanilla puff -- just good.
eclair.author: saudade s.
eclair.review:
Since Beard Papa's opened in San Francisco, all of my fellow hapa friends talked this place up.  I never could bring myself to make it a destination --  I'm not a huge sweet eater -- and never sought it out on trips to Japan, and still I heard I MUST try the cream puff.

Well finally, I did it.  

I wasn't blown away by the eclair, but I've never been one for chocolatey coating.  Hubby said it is the best eclair he's ever had though.  The vanilla puff -- just good.  But the chocolate puff, that is some seriously delicious puff goodness.  Subtle and light.  The keys are as with any Japanese sweet: not so sickly sweet like so many Western confections, and high quality ingredients. 

So, four stars instead of five, but only because I'm not a big sweet eater and it's not like if I'm in the neighborhood I NEED one.  Not like ice cream at Ici.

eclair.review: Now you are talking.  I am an eclair girl so I just had to try it and we got a cream puff too.  I loved the hard chocolate on the outside.  We got the vanilla and I was in heaven.  Until I tried it with strawberry.  Tasted like a chocolate covered strawberry.  That is how good the cream is.  Not too sweet, just enough.  I wish I could have them shipped to me!!

eclair.author: X marks the spot ..
eclair.review:
Was debating whether to give 3 stars or four, but initially settled on four stars. Went there today with boyfriend, which would make it my second time there. There were only  two people ahead of me, so once we placed our orders we had our two cream puffs (one chocolate, one pumpkin)  within seconds. 
My initial reaction to the pumpkin cream puff : "mmmm....tastes like fall, here you have to try some" 
Boyfriend's reaction to the pumkin puff: "yeah you're right tastes just like fall" 
I should say that I in turn had a bite of the chocolate, the chocolate was subtle but it worked. I've read that some people were put off by the runniness of the cream (is that even a word?) well anyway, I liked that the custard wasn't thick. it was like eating a mini eclair, without the chocolate coating.If a simple little pastry inspires a bit of sharing, and a few images of pumpkins, and turkeys, and trick or treating, and things related to fall, then four stars it is.
Hmmm.....minus one star for making me write such a brady bunch ending. yikes!

excerpts: Today, I tried the Eclair and the chocolate covered shell made it just perfect.
eclair.author: Sara N.
eclair.review: Every time I walk down Market Street, BP is calling my name like the devil! These cream puffs are out of this world and make all others taste like crap! Despite the fact that they are pre-made, you actually get a quality cream puff. You get a crisp shell overflowing with a light and creamy filling. I've tried green tea, strawberry and chocolate, but vanilla is still the best. Today, I tried the Eclair and the chocolate covered shell made it just perfect. The chocolate which tasted like dark chocolate was not overly sweet and worth the extra $0.35. I think I've found a new favorite!

excerpts: Ended up getting one of their great cheese cake bits and then an eclair for the long walk back to the office.
eclair.author: David B.
eclair.review:
Stumbled upong Beard Papa when walking back to work. Took a very nice "alley" from Market to get to Mission and saw a wierd picture of I am guessing, the Beard Papa?

Place struck me as different off the bat, name wierd, logo wierd. So I had to investigate as I got closer. Well as soon as I saw they had pastries, saliva started accumulating and desert before lunch was on! Interior made me think of a candy store or some toy shop, but instead they sold great size pastries at the right price.

Ended up getting one of their great cheese cake bits and then an eclair for the long walk back to the office. Blocks in the SOMA are long, cmon! 

Next time I will spring for a dozen of those cream puffs to share with friends, co-workers or family. But they might disappear before it reaches any of their mouths.

Service was friendly. Counter person obviously knew I was a newbie, and offered me a free sample. Really nice, and I ended up eating way more desert than I needed.

Spoiled my flipping lunch!

excerpts: If you ever enjoyed an eclair or creme puff:
This is the place to get them.
It's rediculous how good they are.
The chocolate eclair is at the top of the list for this chocolate fan - the creme is lightly chocolately and with
it's soft texture, a great compliment to the dark and crisp texture of the outer coating.
Go to Pappas, go to snacky heaven.
eclair.author: Dan M.
eclair.review: If you ever enjoyed an eclair or creme puff:  This is the place to get them.  It's rediculous how good they are.  They now serve the chocolate creme puffs and chocolate eclairs.  The chocolate eclair is at the top of the list for this chocolate fan - the creme is lightly chocolately and with it's soft texture, a great compliment to the dark and crisp texture of the outer coating.  Go to Pappas, go to snacky heaven.

excerpts: I buy empty eclair shells and stuff them with ice cream when I get home.
